GXvz0djxqO605DYjRoZ0cQ.text: Walked in and was seated almost immediately by the friendly hostess. The ambience was laid back and relaxed. It was busy but you wouldn't notice it much because the service was quick. The noise level was just right. Music wasn't overbearing and the conversations throughout were at a low level. The seating arrangements have options. You can sit at the bar, separate tables, or picnic style table. We had the tuna hand roll, ceviche, and octopus and cucumber salad. The best hands down was the octopus and cucumber salad. It had the perfect blend of sweet, cool, sea, and spicy. The tuna hand rolls were simple but great. No frills, just tuna and rice; the way it should be. The ceviche was delicious but I wasn't too big a fan of the rice noodles inside. But, it was definitely 5 star ready. I will be returning next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ceviche was great. Spicy and fresh.
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus and cucumber salad was delicious. Perfect blend of cool and spicy. Took me straight to the islands with this.

PI9Nmpc7TbUu7jUzUK13ow.text: Nigiri Sushi, Rolls and Sashimi was OK.  I just disappointed in Shrimp Tempura.  That was not tempura, but fried Shrimp.  Shrimp was fried with banko, I had to ask Tonkatsu sauce. Rools and plates were beautiful, but I think most of dishes are bit over priced for that quality of fish.

a3r_Tk99Jz4CKYIJ7QSqVA.text: My Cali sushi style home away from home when in Nevada.  Was introduced to Kaizen by a local back in 2012 and now hit this off-yet-close-to-Strip spot most times I'm in Vegas (5-12 times/year).  They have a relaxed, nice vibe with friendly, efficient service and a great spread of rolls and solid quality fish.    A great spot to sink some cold beer/sake and fill your belly with friends after a massive few days on the town ;)

bmvFfcqwAb_ughgySesbbA.text: This place rocks! We were starving and in a hurry. Super fast service and delicious fresh fish! Very nice staff as well. We will be come back

UWs_RFH44lM4BdWl24Pw4g.text: Excellent sushi bar. Had just checked into Hard Rocky Hotel across the street and was very Hungry. Kaizen filled the bill. We had rolls and regular sushi. Everything was delicious and service was outstanding. We sat at the bar. Also, house sake was delicious.

2wTZMEvAPxjt20WmpvUe2Q.text: Food was great.  Roll was refreshing and had nice cut pieces of tuna on top.  Ordered mango lobster roll.  Would order again here

zXsaCV-47SBM_lCjQqLxeQ.text: Your korean bbq is the bomb! It's very delicious! I enjoyed eating here! Very modernized!

hhALqwCH_gn-Pmnw9Z9BlQ.text: We came in at 6 on a Friday night and sat at the bar, had excellent service, everything was amazing. Started with the salmon and yellowtail nigiri and an order of egg rolls. Both cuts were super fresh, melt in your mouth type sushi. Then we went to the rolls, had a Tokyo and Bing roll. Amazing! Topped it off with dessert, or as we do....another salmon nigiri! Definitely recommend for anyone staying in hard rock or the Hyatt.

_XYnm7kI5rAVcdAl540QGw.text: We're here from out of town and noticed Kaizen in a shopping center across the street from Hard Rock. The service was friendly and efficient; the food was awesome; the decor was clean, simple, and comfortable. The Chicken curry udon was a huge surprise. DELICIOUS!!  Also had terrific soft shell crab, oysters, sashimi combo plate, and the broiled Saba...All excellent!  Coming back for happy hour...10pm-4am Buy 1 Get 1 Free Alcohol Beverage.

RetrZavA_2vKGSP39sd5RA.text: Best Sushi I've ever had.  Yes, I'm sober.  I travel frequently, and this is without a doubt the freshest salmon I've ever had.   -salmon tataki -sunset roll -kiss of fire  You're welcome.

q04yZeof86uXBPs2YVe6Sg.text: Nice lunch bento set and teriyaki bowl. The grill Saba fish is a must try! Nice, cosy and attentive staffs!

To begin with they didnt have a great selection, so I ordered a baked salmon roll, that was TINY and so full of cream cheese that it completely over powered the taste of the salmon. On top of that they are one of those places that charges you a fairly normal price for a soda, I want to say it was like $2.50 or something... But it's in a can, so no refills.  Service was slow, they forgot my miso soup.   Could have been better.

OVVp-8MvqEagkpJVDxU6gw.text: Absolute best place in Vegas to grab the best sushi. Fish is always fresh and delicious and the staff is always friendly and very attentive. Also they always have great specials. So do yourself a favor, come eat here and dont forget to check out that board on the way in the door!!

Yc7iq2nUsk18TuOlpxB5hg.text: First Kiss Roll is delicious and service is very attentive. Open late for all you night owls. I come here sometimes twice a week! I would also try the green apple saki ...

BGgS34mYvFys2xi_xXZ6wQ.text: I was so happy to find this place...I was staying across the street at the Hardrock and nursing a major hangover that I had already attended to earlier in the day by ordering eggs benedict from room service ( good room service FYI )...anyway still lagging and trying to decide to rise and shine or hermit in my room when my friend said he was coming over...so oh shit, guess I better get up...he asks me what I want to eat and I say Sushi downstairs....I start getting ready and start imaging what I will order once at Sushi, my friend gets there we head downstairs walk in the sushi spot and God Damn it...I'm 10 minutes too late and they are closing...argh....so they recommended across the street...I'm glad they did.  Yeap its an American style sushi spot ran by maybe Koreans with all kinds of fried sushi rolls...which is exactly what this hungover girl was craving anyway.  Albacore with crispy onions ..Yum Salmon nigiri...Yum Shrimp tempura roll...Yum some kind of bulgogi roll..Yum and some other specialty roll, can't remember...  Everything I had was delcious and fresh....service was fast and friendly and I felt happy here...the hangover required that I be around only a few people and the HardRock was totally over crowded...  They are open super late for those like me who crave things late at night!

GwdRLnipmaXmF5bNvRu75g.text: Amazing atmosphere, great attentive service by David, clean, and super delicious. Loved it

lJn_KwfbK3vjB9g7UtH2Lg.text: My first time here and I had the king crab roll and the King of Ocean roll and all I can say is amazing! I have lived in Las Vegas for almost 20 years and never had sushi this good! Who knew?!?!?

ldkrvByL714qjkd4DcwedA.text: -got takeout from here late at night  -they specialize in specialty rolls (you know the ones with all sorts of fish and different sauces covering them)  -would come here again if I was staying at hard rock  -parking lot is kind of busy

_QUlAQHXzhZlINvwVgdJ2A.text: 5 stars for the food and our awesome server, Joon! Came here for late night sushi and he offered excellent knowledge of the rolls and sake. The quality of the food matches the price. Best non ayce place I've had in Vegas!

mjMuL-rqRaETA-MAh9aiZw.text: No doubt the best in Vegas. Top notch quality in terms of food, taste, presentation, service, environment, EVERYTHING! As a recent transplant to Vegas, this is absolutely my go-to place for sushi, a la carte or AYCE!

KF2gBCb6jUs1JaMRBbQJTw.text: This place is great. The way it's decorated gives it a really nice ambiance. The vibe made us wanna stay there longer just to chill. The service was great. And of course the sushi was fresh and delicious! The portions are big and the presentation is excellent.

0shlgEQH1g7nZpKLQFQw5A.text: There are times when the thought of leaving the house outweighs the feeling of- if I don't eat sushi right now, I will, in fact, die. I really don't like to get sushi delievered because, it just is never that good, but desperate times call for desperate measures. Plus, I just wasn't ready to die. I used the roadrunner food delievery app and it let me customize my order exactly how I like it (I'm one of those annoying cant order directly off the menu people) . Food was delievered to me exactly how I wanted it and I got to eat with my favorite dining companion, my cat- Ape. I also did not have to wear pants like a civilized person. I took my first nom, and it was delicious!! Cold, fresh and yummy. I also love their "beef tarta" . This place is great. If you can crawl outside with pants on, they are open late and super friendly inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon sushi- nomnomnom

lb1YZ7YYGjRPtdl0JEypNw.text: I lived in Japan for two years and ever since then (almost 10 years ago now) I have been searching the U.S. For authentic and amazing sushi and this place had it! The "beef sashimi" (they call it something fancy but that's what it is) is AMAZING! And the three rolls we got were just as good! I would be be surprised if my boyfriend and I came back before going home!

i5Qi9-q9NzqcUfMn4tV7AQ.text: This restaurant made my fiance and I physically ill. It is by far the worst sushi joint I have ever been to. Not only did they completely screw up my takeout order, but they served us bad fish. I called to speak with management and was told I would be called back the next day. I called back the next day after my call wasn't returned, and again, no manager. Same thing for day 3 and 4. Only after threatening to contact the health department was I coincidentally given to the manager. Who offered no apology, and instead offered a $20 credit for next time. Why on earth would I return to a restaurant that made me sick?? Anyway, I was eventually offered a $11.99 cash refund. Which is a complete joke, not to mention insult. I will be contacting the health department this morning, as this is not acceptable. This place should be shut down for criminal negligence.

myx4qiBPSUgbFOJSll8tuw.text: This is off the strip so it was decent.  It's located inside a plaza like corner with CVS, hookah joint and some other restaurant/stores.  The waitresses here were friendly and sat us down very quickly.  I ordered the rose roll and something else I forgot but it was good.  I do feel like it was a place to pick up hookers or something...

beGAl9ClFd5iVq-U8WF_Ew.text: Staying at the Hard Rock and was in the mood for sushi. Walked across the street and I am glad I did. Food was amazing,fresh and delicious.

4HVJgKDy7WLa8FLhM-_T9g.text: This place has a great salmon tempora roll. The service is wonderful as well!  Will be back for sure for another round. Sad they don't have an all you can eat though.

sTpN6WEXsM1UJCNO5sMipQ.text: Total quality management. Look it up: dictionary.reference.com... Edamame and cold tofu with ponzu both delivered. Mountain of salted goodness on the former, rectangles of soybean with sweet homemade ponzu sauce on the latter. Loved both. Rolls were massive if unmemorable. Rainbow featured an assortment of fish, Mackerel Madness was pretty mad with mackerel and more ponzu sauce. Yet a week later not much stands out from either. Reasonably priced and a space that tries to be as cool as possible. Call it three stars for reaching middle management.

EZdOPBf03n4ihqlRk7RHBA.text: I go to Kaizen Sushi about once a week and I love their food I recommend anybody looking for a good sushi place to go there and their prices are very reasonable

I tried another local favorite but it was an hour wait. Kaizen was just a 30 minute wait and I'm glad we did.  The service was great. The orders were taken almost as quickly as our drinks were brought out and rolls were quick to follow. They all had excellent flavors and our out of town friends agreed we made the right selection on where to eat. Very clean and a friendly staff.

B7WOgDEvJQop_3pDlXo6qA.text: 10/10 Would recommend. Good lunch deals, for that quickie to satisfy you and your hangry friends. You rock, don't ever change.  Forever yours,  Lizzie McGuire I have to add more words because nobody likes just the tip.

N-TvA8uo_qzTnn3d9FFxPg.text: This food was amazing, and the server was very professional and courteous. We tried multiple sushi rolls and they all were outstanding! I'll definitely be coming back. Keep up the good work Kaizen!

o4NNM5AyDFQRvEOdsTA3pg.text: I love good sushi and sashimi. Fresh, the right temp, reasonable portions. I like to taste the fish, not have it hidden and smothered in sauces.   Kaizen is a great place to go in Vegas. With so many choices in town, this place is a great place to enjoy quality sushi and sashimi. The food is spot on, and the prices are reasonable. The vibe is open and bright. They have the little things like fresh wasabi and know the difference between sushi rice and steamed rice.

-KUI5F38L6EdxTcWogBroQ.text: Great menu! Welcoming vibes and heard nothing but amazing reviews from friends and family! Food came out in a timely manner. Fresh fish and great food. Amazing service and super accommodating! Highly recommend!!

Su5xP73A6DloIcpNGFc2wg.text: This place has a great modern look with a great ambiance. The food is great and the lunch special is quite the deal. The california combo - central that came with california rolls, miso soup, side salad and my choice of beef teriyaki was enough to fill me up. I highly recommended this to anyone that enjoys Japanese food.

1CaR1mYwWoCDvG6YOYDFew.text: Great sushi and niece and relaxing environment love this place we came for a basketball tournament  and look for this place again and again love it and I recommended to sushi lovers for sure

YQQ5VisG1oBK3LG_WsZMSg.text: This is my favorite sushi spot in Las Vegas! The menu is incredible and hard to choose from. They have pictures of all rolls with helps you to decide. Absolutely the most delicious sushi!! Avocado train, golden knights, tune crispy rice, salmon killer my favorites!

BxwnsC2iHL6vyKPZRmtadg.text: No all you can eat. This ones for the tourists. If you want all the sushi you can eat for 25$ go to spring mountain road. Good sushi here, but you get as much as you want anywhere else in vegas. Don't be fooled!  Go go all you can eat!!!

5yIaUFHiqoIzZ3mbNg_7mQ.text: I love good sushi and sashimi. Fresh, the right temp, reasonable portions. I like to taste the fish, not have it hidden and smothered in sauces.   Kaizen is a great place to go in Vegas. With so many choices in town, this place is a great place to enjoy quality sushi and sashimi. The food is spot on, and the prices are reasonable. The vibe is open and bright. They have the little things like fresh wasabi and know the difference between sushi rice and steamed rice.  The staff was helpful and friendly when I asked for recommendations and navigating the menu.   I'm not a huge fan of rolls, but they do have a large selection if that's your jam. I had a rice less fish forward roll and it was delicious.   This place is a solid 5 Star..if you like sushi check it out

8jmMnS1FQ0lvmW-w3XwunA.text: I love that they are open late, and this is a huge selling point. Decent sushi but very mildly pricey compared to other equal-quality sushi joints (like $2ish more per roll). Consider it a convenience fee for being open late.  Their flavored sake was absolutely incredible. For you people raised in imperial measurements, the 250ml sake is a good quantity for two people who are going to be there for a little bit.  Careful in the parking lot, some folks be crazy due to proximity to the college, the strip, and the roads nearby.

kEqrDUpTVgY8-Ma780QxCA.text: Best sushi in Vegas...love this place!!!! The rolls are amazing...cool music/vibe...almost a club scene.  It's understandable why locals come here....   Can't wait to come back!!

I've been coming to Vegas twice a year for 19 years for business and I ONLY eat at kaizen every single night! Unlike the big hotels on the strip with expensive places like nobu, you can actually relax in a hometown local atmosphere, when you leave here you'll be beyond satisfied, your stomach will be full and you'll still have money in your wallet  do yourself a favor and check it out!

OP7IceFvol0ijhCHkjwKrA.text: Solid place for sushi. Good portions and large menu variety with fast service. My boyfriend and I got the spicy tuna salad which was HUGE (a bit too spicy for my tastes but still tasty). We also got the Kai and Twilight rolls and they did not disappoint.   All in all, great place if you're nearby.

04Lg_W86kCs6NEJUm7sVnA.text: This was a great local find when I was staying at the Hard Rock Hotel and didn't have a car. It's right across the street in an unassuming strip mall. (Plenty of free parking if you're driving, btw!) I was impressed with the hip, modern and clean design. Definitely wasn't expecting this place to be that stylish.   The hostess was friendly and seated me right away. She also was my server and was very on top of things. The prices are about average, but not as ridiculous as the casino sushi places. The best deal I found was the chicken katsu bowl, which was around $10. It was the most delicious katsu I had in a long time. It was moist and the serving size was perfect. I hate when katsu is dried out and tough, but this definitely wasn't the case here. I had a good miso soup and a roll too. I can't remember the name of the roll, but it delicious. The fish was fresh and the sauce complimented it perfectly. My server came by several times to check on me and refill my beverages. All in all, I had a great experience and I will definitely be back. Saw lots of good dishes going by that I would like to try next time! But, trust me, try the chicken katsu!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect lunch.
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You&#39;d never guess this place was in a strip mall.
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love their Kai roll.

tbaVYSkxMUmAPGuSs-YQBQ.text: I enjoyed every sec of my visit here. I was completely excited to go to sushi at 1am in the morning and everything taste fresh! The menu was very nice gave plenty of options including 2 for drinks for happy hour. It was my friends first time for sushi and our server was super knowledgeable and informative on what he should try which I really appreciated. She told us what she likes and dislikes which is a big deal to me. I'm a HUGE fan of Eel and that have an appetizer with 8 pieces of will served on a sizzling skillet with onions and peppers it was delicious! I had the King Crab Miso Soup it was beyond amazing! I had a great time and love how small and cozy it was. Can't wait to go back when in vegas!

rV9e5iLcn7ZvJQdTZ1wg1A.text: Awesome late night sushi place ! Very attentive servers ! Sushi taste so fresh as well.. Both kaizen locations are awesome !

KtN0nQkVfRJbCoJ5oJSYnQ.text: This place is amazing. There is a wide variety of items on the menu, even for non sushi lovers.   The food was extremely tasty, and the service was on point.   I highly recommend this place to anyone that loves sushi and a good atmosphere.

ZoYF7KBdou60iIFu06lH8Q.text: If you come and eat there on an empty stomach, you'll definitely get your money's worth! If I lived in Vegas, this would be my go to spot!

_jkoun6x1bBor5yQDE4gOw.text: The Sushi is amazing. The service and atmosphere is top notch. I would highly recommend this place.

wRFN4UMeOCybDztAZL02Nw.text: Their food was great! We had the salmon skin salad. Ate the whole thing. We also order their rolls. Very good too. You will not be disappointed! We are from SF Bay Area. Next time we visit Vegas, this will be our must go Japanese restaurant !

W6wI_axZf6M0I26tvybSfw.text: This is our to go spot while we are in Vegas. It is a very hip place and it is right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel. The food is excellent and the service is good as well. Will we return? Yes, it is our Vegas sushi place.

ZusjxjMi-5CgT0adS67eQg.text: YUM-o! my friend & i went here just because we stopped at CVS and was craving sushi. & i tend to be a sushi purist ever since going to Sugarfish in LA but sometimes i want a fatty heap of lobster-crunchy-ricey-mayo- goodness...& hey, I'm vegas! So we go in & mind u, we didnt yelp! it before so we has NO idea what we were getting ourselves into. BUT boy were we pleased. the menu is like a book so good luck choosing one thing. I ended up choosing the Japanese Lasagna, cause well i have never heard of it! and my friend ordered the Silver Plate Roll (for starters we got Monkey Balls and Seaweed salad-- Delish!)... Both dishes were bomb.com but The Japanese Lasagna will rock ur socks off!!! It was soo what i was looking for :)...Sigh, sadly they dont have a place in LA....but I'm sure as hell gonna find a rip-off...or maybe its just a sin city treat? ;)

6GSVSqzJXoFz7QwRu_SW8w.text: Unique sushi like giant clam and abalone sushi..I didn't  like eating either one of them. The giant clam just didnt have much flavor. The abalone was like eating cartilage.  The fatty  tuna was good and some kind of fish belly sashimi was good. Service was soooo slow in the beginning. It took forever just to get started with our beer/sake. The sashimi is a bit better than an average place, but not great. Uni was not fresh. Sweet shrimp was not that great ($28 for 4 pieces).  We ordered 3 bottles of sake and 2 bottles of beer for 11 people. We couldn't finish 1 of the bottles of sake and asked if we could return it. They were ok with it.

7pj-8iM8a_V_316TrBhRRA.text: Don't bother going here. The workers were rude and unprofessional, the miso soup was old, and the sushi was too fishy and just off. There's too many better places to eat then here.

aHR1hno-fekF7RylSU7WRw.text: On the evening of Tuesday 9/20/16, I thought perchance I would try my hand at dining at Kaizen sushi whilst I was traversing about the streets of Las Vegas. From the moment I walked in I was greeted by nothing but positive and upbeat vibes, they were even playing popular music that I had taken a liking to. I decided to relax at an elegant, and I must say slightly romantic, table with the good friends I had been accompanied by. The service was prompt and very polite and I coaxed myself into an appetizer while the somewhat indecisive female friend of mine took her time perusing the menu to find something befitting of her selective tastes. Much to my delight the appetizer was phenomenal and set the tone for every bit of food thereafter, as it was all exquisite. We were very satisfied after a few rolls and sat with a tantalizing feeling befitting a king after such a wonderful meal. We even were a bit naughty and went for dessert despite having to take some of the sushi home, but alas, when in Vegas one must live a little. To conclude, I give Kaisen sushi a well-deserved 5 star rating and would highly recommend it to any malnourished travelers looking to tickle their fancies with a smorgasbord of incredible tastes!!

oKfiAU3X4C2chk6DJdKPAQ.text: Excellent food & good service. The men are Japanese (not Korean) & make delicious rolls without packing it with rice. The flavor is balanced and the rice amount is just right. All the raw fish taste well cleaned and fresh.

tmpzYZw7ritQElUuvrq70g.text: Let me tell you the BBQ roll is spectacular. I felt like a little baby Buddha was dancing on my tongue. This place is awesome and they even surprised us when they told us that starting at 12am  they had buy one sake get one free. Sake Bombs here we go

xBmdN9iKWvhhYJxdgssoYA.text: My favorite late night sushi restaurant. As long as you're having a good time and of course ordering food and drinks they will stay open. Usually close about 4 am, it's also a great meeting spot before hitting the strip. The vegas roll is my favorite!

FYzauwF_2vNBrxOIfHg-PA.text: There are a few times in life where you stumble across a little gem. I just had this experience. I'm a sushi aficionado and going to the many sushi places I've been to, this one rates at the top! Beautifully presented yet so delicious you can't stop ordering another roll. I highly recommend this place and their 'Sexy Roll' and 'Rose Roll'. Pure genius. I'll be back.

r9KNhdYUBOgY0aru4plY9w.text: I had the chicken katsu bowl for lunch, it was great, portion size was big, tasted great. We ordered a ton of sushi and it was amazing. I recommend the sexy maguro roll.

ibVSjSBY05jqL_M6iy_Dsw.text: Grabbed some rolls on the way home. Great food & service. Can't wait till next visit. Yummy

i9x3wMwYKZrMS5BhquIeew.text: We come from LA and eat at Kaizen every time we come to LV at least once if not twice!   We are vegetarian and they accommodate us beautifully! rk5nrWXerwGWNz2FyfSI2Q.text: Great food but I ended up waiting over an hour for my sushi because they forgot to put in the order. They compensated me one glass of wine only as i had three glasses waiting for my food that never came.

LITrDym6P4Wn0FzPrvgNtw.text: Great sushi for great prices.  I come here everytime I come to Vegas!   Will definitely come back.

ELy_SgDwFPfh0VLp207c1w.text: Came here late night to eat with the family. About 5 couples, a family of 4, and 3 people at the bar. Waitress sat us down immediately but after 15 mins no one came to acknowledge that we were even here. No "hello I'll be with you shortly", no "can I start you guys with some drinks", NOTHING. I get that there's only three of you, but why bother sitting down somebody you're not even gonna take care of? Obviously the visit was already at a bad start and I was not happy, after getting the waitress' attention, the one that sat us down -- she asks "has anyone helped us?" LIKE SERIOUSLY?!!! After 15 mins you FINALLY noticed?! Food was a hit and miss.  But honestly it was really hard to enjoy the whole experience with the terrible service provided. A revisit is unfortunately not in the near future..

oGk4RysLSBtHdm2p7rgY7A.text: After reading the reviews we decided to try this place because it was right across the street from our hotel. I like the fact that they are open really late and it has cute decor. I don't agree with the numerous reviews that it was the best sushi, but of the four rolls we got the T.T roll was the best. The other 3 rolls we got were the Jay roll, Katana roll and the Salmon killer. They were typical rolls drowned in a lot of sauce!  ******This is an edit to my review. The advertisement said check in and get a free item. When I inquired about it I was told "you have to write a review". I wrote a review and was ignored for 21 minutes until we had to flag our server down. It wasn't that busy and she passed by our table over 10 times to help the customers next to us. I give this place 2 stars. Service is terrible and sushi was mediocre.

KSzhQx9aN_YKn292wD09jg.text: This is probably now my favorite Sushi spot here. I decided to come here for my 4th Anniversary dinner and I don't regret it! The sushi is "REALLY" good and the presentation of it is so far the neatest I have seen out of all of my sushi experiences. Sad to say however that it was too bad I could only take down three rolls because my stomach seriously wanted to go for a fourth! I definitely recommend this place. The restaurant is clean, the staff is friendly, and the sushi is great.

eCgtbc8kRl2YXrrp2fDhsQ.text: This is the best sushi restaurant in Las Vegas!  The waiters and waitresses are very friendly and the prices are right. The sushi is very fresh and delicious. Would highly recommend coming here.

mDjvrksxAKeFcOw02ifoQA.text: I have been to this location several times and always have a great experience! The food is fresh and delicious, and the burning your stomach roll will satisfy the spiciest of pallettes. There's always an open table or a seat at the bar and a warm inviting atmosphere. Jz3_JFSMPsNG71OnYkohXw.text: Very quiet when we went in for an early dinner. Right across from the Hard Rock you can walk across the street. They were nice-made us some rolls from a very busy menu of rolls. We ordered a cold sake thought it was coming in a larger bottle, our bad but for the price we asked to just get the LARGE bottle. The next size up. It made sense. So they came and nicely poured a half empty bottle of that sake. Not sure if they poured it out or someone else had a half bottle....Regardless they were happy to do this. When we didn't finish it of course, it was huge, we thought we'd cap it and take it with us to our Hotel. WE do this at every restaurant in SD all the time. Cork your wine and take it with you if you don;t finish it. In Vegas where everyone walks around the streets with alcohol, no big deal right. Well our waiter was happy to go back and put in a to go container but the owner stopped him. Said it was illegal that we couldn't take it with us but he was happy to put our name on it. Well, what when we came back in a few weeks or months.?? He wasn't nice at all, or apologetic. Rude and didn't care really. Totally ruined the feel of this place for me. The sushi wasn't amazing anyways and in Vegas there is an abundance of killer places to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tEplmiv4DgX7YbFBexRudA.text: Me and my kids went here last night for the first time having an all you can eat sushi experience. I wasn't quite sure how it worked and was skeptical so I kept asking the waitress, Nour questions. It was packed there on a Friday night, we waited 30 minutes to be sat so needless to say this waitress was extremely busy. The food was good, we had an assortment of rolls that ranged from good to amazing, we also had a bunch of appetizers (everything on the on the menu is included in all you can eat btw). The star of my visit was the service, when you go to a place that's so busy you automatically turn down your expectations of the service. Not here, I was surprised to see her keep up with the pace and keep a smile, composure and efficiency. We asked like...a hundred questions and Nour answered them all with a smile, didn't seem rushed in her responses. She even recommended items based off the questions we were asking. All the others seemed to be the same way so I'd assume that the people who work there like their job...and it shows to the customers. Good job guys, keep up the good work.

8T5CfwpfNcgJEME3Lbaxiw.text: Amazing place with very tasty sushi! Presentation is 10 star and customer service is impeccable. Also music is very pleasant and relaxing

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All of the sushi here are delicious

LfYrV4rKG_Ins0CaR4PF7Q.text: Tried this for something new near UNLV. Delicious!! The Chicken Terriyaki Roll was yummy and the veggie tempura was great.

c0h0EVHYjimoStfsxHouzQ.text: Was looking for a good place to eat sushi, and this one had pleasant reviews by my fellow Yelpers.  It is located in a plaza with other restaurants, a 24/7 salon, and retail stores.  I love the ambiance and customer service. They are attentive and helpful. Nicely decorated with elegant simplicity.   We ordered the avocado train, spicy rainbow roll, and the baked scallop. All in all, we were speechless the whole time we were eating because it was that good! The avocado train had a delightful surprise with an avocado ball at the end of the roll. What is in it, you ask? You gotta order it and find out! The spicy rainbow roll was a good balance of spicy and fresh fish. Lastly I love the sauce on the baked scallop roll. The mushroom and scallops were super good!   Would definitely recommend this place to friends and family!

Tt6GS4VUSkXsMhL6cFUHqg.text: One of my favorite spots for sushi and drinks. Always a great atmosphere with fresh quality food and service. Salute Kaizen!!!

minQTXf6jYqxTQ7p9U4DGg.text: Awesome food ! Every thing tastes great been coming here for years ! I highly recommend the vegetable tempura roll and the white rose roll

6dQUnU7oiev54eW6zOvdSg.text: I only gave this a star because the food was good.  Let's talk about the service...good lord they were so gosh darn RUDE I am baffled. I came in with a couple of friends and it's 12am on a Friday night, I would get if it was super packed, but it wasn't. So we had to share a menu, 3 waiters were "waiting our table" the reason for the quotations because they were doing anything but tending to us. Not like we asked for much. Just some more water since we had to wait so long to order, get our food just everything in general. Then we look over and see one of our "waiters" taking sake shots with his friends instead of taking care of other customers. Also don't asked for anything else after they bring you your food unless you wanna get hit with a nasty attitude like it's an inconvenience. Terrible service, whoever did the hiring needs to be let go cause they aren't a good judge of character.

4S0I8bnlaNUaBf8Id3Kx8A.text: It was freaking awesome! Really was some of the tastiest and freshest sushi I've ever had. Try the Shogun roll. The tempura was cooked to perfection, and the accompanying apple sake was a showstopper.

wPaGoc4HHd1BGXl-RZ2FDw.text: This place is amazing! Came back two days in a row since we enjoyed it so much! The salmon cheese stick appetizer is super yummy. There is a good selection of rolls. I enjoyed the Unicorn the most. Great teriyaki as well, and better than your typical.  The service and atmosphere is great for families and date nights. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone, and am sad that we don't live closer.

Lb_Y_vTpt_ke_ICIdM7YMw.text: This is probably my favorite sushi place ever. It's not close to my house, so I don't go as often as I'd like. But every time I bite into something, I'm like, "THIS is what it's supposed to taste like."The fish is always fresh and buttery. Every roll is perfect. I can't even.

1dGlP5FHMnjKXEXmaMgnmA.text: I am a big fan of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi. Sometimes a restaurant fits perfectly into your day or even your week. In the fall of 2014 I had been in Las Vegas briefly and had quickly grabbed takeout from here. I remember thinking the ambience was fun. Returning to Las Vegas in December of 2015 I used Yelp to track down this sushi restaurant that I remembered enjoying but couldn't remember the name of.  Since I was traveling for work I was often on my own for dinner. Walking into Kaizen I was instantly welcomed and the staff was more than happy to give me a table to myself since the restaurant was not too busy.   Over the three separate visits I made to Kaizen I got to sample a variety of rolls, all of which I enjoyed: -Philadelphia Roll-specially requested for this to be made with salmon and cream cheese inside and salmon on top -Sexy Roll-spicy tuna inside topped with fresh tuna, smelt eggs, and tangy sauce -Crunch Roll-deep fried shrimp, Yamagobo, cucumber inside topped with tempura crunch and eel sauce -Red Rock Roll-deep fried shrimp and cucumber inside topped with spicy tuna, seared tuna, and spicy mayo -Hot Night Roll-deep fried shrimp and cucumber inside topped with spicy tuna and eel sauce -Orange Blossom Roll-deep fried chopped shrimp and crab inside topped with salmon and tangy sauce  Everything I had was delicious and the service is polite and quick. Definitely great to stop in for dinner when traveling for business. On weekends the restaurant can get significantly busier so expect to sit at the bar if you're dining solo.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork goyza, Red Rock Roll, Philly Roll

VDMu0Pvl611tf9TNBsyYfg.text: Those is our goto place for sushi in Vegas.  You can walk across the street from Hard Rock.  Great rolls, great sushi.  Cooked foods are great too.  Highly recommended!

This place I believe is overpriced and overrated !!! I would've given 3 stars because the other sushi was good but service was slow and they weren't even busy that day :(

I call in my order and it only takes them about ten minutes to have it ready. The girls who work here are all very sweet. And the prices are amazing!

k5vfQT7V1vQBV54MC8lpyA.text: I have a 2 years baby and unfortunately they asked us to not feed him with the pasta plate we brought for him! We were very disappointed since my wife had to go feed him in the car! We spent over a 100$ and this is the last time for us there!

Ly5O3wFfMMS_vjjmEPaTaA.text: Food is great. Spicy salmon salmon was great. Service was fast and pleasant. Will visit again.

TM1Oz2bxPI3wcOqc6HCRmA.text: By far the cutest location. The sushi is amazing & the staff is always professional. Clean! & the cheese cake is a must try!

A3-eB7M0oOrXOqR15NqOHw.text: The rolls are great! Would definitely recommend their Japanese Lasagna! By far my favorite in Las Vegas! Plus their presentation is amazing! Every roll looked photo worthy! Delicious!

KDwtiqeeiGsXeWd0YzWwpw.text: Beautiful location and really close to campus.   The food was fresh, the hostess very kind, and the lunch special had healthy portions.  I'd definitely come again.

68S83-uZPsbP2dTVY1E0eQ.text: We walked in and for a second, i thought I was in a Italian restaurant. Everything was so fancy and the host looked Italian. Then i saw the nicely formed, eye appealing varieties of sushi on the white plates.  As i looked through the menu, it was so hard to choose which roll to get. I wanted to try them all but my bank account wouldn't let me. The waiter was patient and made some recommendations. As soon as it came to the table we devoured them up, thus no picture was taken.  The rice on each roll was fluffy and not overly sticky, the fish was cold, firm and tasty, the rolls that had tempura waa freshly made, evident from the crunch and warmth of the tempura as you bit into the whole roll. My favorite had to be the roll with fresh tuna and roe. The roe just pops as you bite into it. In all we ordered 5 different rolls and spent over 80 with tip. I don't usually spend this amount for so little food and if I do it has to be spectacular. This place hit it out of the ballfield.

3CR5A_gKxqLubppTqSCYJw.text: The Japanese word "Kaizen" brings back memories of my B-school days, when studying operations management in the car industry.  Kaizen means "continuous improvement" - why would any restaurant want to name themselves this?  Maybe Kaizen Sushi is aware of its shortcomings and wants to strive to be the best.  HMMM...  Food & Drinks I came here with a couple of girlfriends for lunch and we immediately ordered lychee sake.  Points for having this on the menu!  It might be the Boone's Farm of sake, but can't deny that it was goooood!  We didn't want anything too heavy to eat because we had early dinner reservations, so one of my girlfriends had sashimi, the other had a bento box of short ribs, while I had the ahi salad.  As you can see, the unifying thread was NO RICE  (we were going clubbing that night - we didn't want to look TOO bloated!)  Amazingly, these dishes were satisfying - the portions were pretty generous.  Because we ordered from the lunch menu, everything was reasonably priced.   No complaints here!  Atmosphere Kaizen is located in a little strip mall, so we weren't expecting the place to look anything less than your run-of-the mill sushi joint.  However, Kaizen had some pizzazz - the walls were colorful and rock music was playing.  We felt like we had walked into a bar.  For what it is, Kaizen scores points for atmosphere too - no complaints here either!  Service This is where Kaizen should practice some Kaizen.  Orders came to the table slowly and randomly.  The bento box came first, which had my friend & I drooling.  My order came last, and by this time I was ravenous!  They should have served our food all at once!   So I'd give Kaizen 3.5 stars if I could, but I'll round up because their name suggests they are striving for perfection.  As far as the service goes, I should hope so!

SVoGprSYIDDQtQP1gSyP1g.text: Great restaurant just 5 minutes off the strip. The sushi was excellent and moderately priced. The total was probably half what it would have been at a more well known sushi bar in Vegas. Service was also excellent, the waitress was right over when our glasses were low to refill them. Highly recommend and will return next time I'm in town.

pNeLpie-JJbQk0sV9kHeRg.text: I love Kaizen! My girlfriend and I always go here all the time and it's always awesome! The rolls are always great and the decorations and environment is so well done!

BCS1xHaBPd9gCkFDDxuU5w.text: The ambience was great! The layout of the restaurant has wood polished tables and benches in the middle while the back wall has booths and the front has a long sushi bar. I went with my son and wife. We ordered Unagi, sashimi appetizers, pork ribs, and Kaizen roll. The food was fresh and prepared well. The ribs took longer to cook then we expected. Overall a good experience.

QNn4AIiia_X8w1ONGNUitw.text: 5 stars for being the only sushi restaurant open so late (conveniently across from the Hard Rock!)  The service was on point when I went and the food came out very quickly.  Only downside I see is that there aren't any private tables.  The Saketinis were delicious! I tried the pomegranate and lychee and would highly recommend the lychee.  The rolls were delicious, and if youre a raw food/sashimi fanatic, definitely try out the Rose Roll!  My server was very attentive and continuously checked in/out with me and my SO.  If you're drunk or hungry at 2AM and you're looking for an amazing sushi restaurant, then stop by at Kaizen!

TJM2trHGpWByYEIbjddA3g.text: The atmosphere is above standard for a restaurant of similar state. Service was quick and professional. Staff was very knowledgable on the listed items. Very large menu. More standard options as well as more uncommon items. With the heat, they always made sure our drinks were tipped off. Food was phenomenal and lots of good per portion. Would definitely recommend for families or singles.

965vLv3hOM7IYZFQvl0vzg.text: A great solid place for sushi, and even better for lunch. The bento boxes are probably the best deal on the menu in terms of quality, quantity and price. The thing that threw me off was the tempura shrimp bento was solid minus the tempura part. Instead of traditional tempura batter, they used the same batter as that of the chicken katsu which was a big let down for me as it was not as I had expected. My girlfriend had the pork katsu which bowl which was excellent as I picked off her plate as well as mine. If your in the area, give this place a try. I do hope though the tempura shrimp thing was a fluke and it was because they ran out of the proper batter. Otherwise, it would be a big strike against them as far as I am concerned.

epTo9kUAz8e8EcszYp9HCA.text: One of my favorite weekday lunch spots. As a local it's hard to find a decent off strip sushi place that is good and has fair prices. They have awesome lunch specials and a hip fun environment.

ohP3ZsvESmEwHTs0xTtJ5g.text: This is the spot you hit for solid good sushi. I don't think it is too inventive however the quality is high the prices are more than reasonable and they are open late so late night place for sushi this would be it.

BRYMg509cmIv79UUNoSahQ.text: Wonderful place for lunch!  They have these lunch specials and all are big portions for a good price.  The sashimi combo was very fresh and the tempura was good too! I have been there several times and my boss goes there almost every day.  The only waitress i have seen can work the whole lunch by herself and does a great job. I am sure we will be back again!

d-xdKDfRb0z-FT7XDuJF9g.text: I came here because of a friend's recommendation and I'm so glad I did. It's a bit off the strip, near the Hard Rock and the area (I guess LV in general) isn't the safest... but the restaurant itself is cute and cozy inside. We enjoyed all of the rolls we tried and found the fish to be fresh and the service to be friendly.

tnh_DM8_TwyL7x7ByYT2tQ.text: Our favorite sushi place! Spent 5 years in Japan - this is as close as it gets!! Fast service amazing fresh food!

wkQc_GpNtxbFl0fJrKEEyQ.text: I recently stayed at the Hard Rock on a trip to Vegas, and considering the fact I was on a limited budget, I was very happy to find good affordable sushi across the street from my hotel!  The sushi there wasn't amazing or anything, but it was good and definitely cheaper than a lot of the alternatives in the area.

tzTZ4I5PZpJpyBZmrmTK3g.text: Spectacular service and food. Our waitress was very attentive and genuinely friendly. I am local so its great to find restaurants i enjoy. I am defintely a Kaizen fan and would recommend it to anyone looking for great japanese lasagna.

VOHLkIDzmMFVh5IM3BsyCQ.text: Yum-zo!  I'm typically a purist - chirashi, sashimi, miso - sign me up!  But the inventive rolls here caught my eye.  Photos in the menu don't hurt.  Nice, quick friendly service.  I think they put crack in the ceviche (actually maybe just lime and sugar) but I wanted to eat it (garnish and) all.

RJlbjBkI2tOzgAULazX09w.text: My previous Vegas trip on Aug 2010 a group of my friends (living in Sin and HI) and I came here. And being from Hawaii we are exposed to excellent sushi, so I already knew I wouldn't find it as high-quality as I would back home. BUT it actually was pretty decent. The prices where very reasonable to for how good, big and fresh it was.  I tried the "First Kiss" being raved about from my friends which was exactly what they claimed. I also tried the salmon and hamachi negiri.   I'll be sure to hit this spot up again on this years Vegas trip!

nWHIqRCOhDPwn8djlP8u8g.text: Across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel, this place is totally convenient and super yummy. They have a ton of fun rolls to share, including a few no-rice rolls that low carb LA-eaters interested in drinking their calories in Vegas can appreciate (myself included).  Of course, I recommend the HARD ROCK ROLL and the SPICY TUNA SALAD that has huge chucks of tuna and nice, light dressing.

sxpp2DzzHJ8KhFw1Scpfdw.text: This is our second dining experience at Kaizen Fusion Roll. We we very happy with the friendly service and the wonderful rolls. We drive in from Boulder City but it is worth the drive and we will come in more often. We tried 3 different rolls and each was excellent. Experiment, you won't go wrong!

idkKSHEsjs9g4w4fZfPbbA.text: In a very convienient location for those staying at the Hard Rock Hotel, and nearby on the strip.  Stay out of the overpriced, overrated Casino sushi joints and take a quick ride down to Kaizen.  The sushi is fresh, staff attentive, and the beer and sake floweth.    You can have your choice of traditional sushi, sashimi, or get adventurous with one of thier tasty specialty rolls.  The SPICY TUNA SALAD is a must try; large portions of tuna with a fresh mix of greens.  This is one of my favorite sushi spots anywhere, and the best I have had in Las Vegas.

vGLalxvdhW4uyFHmBnUkTA.text: this is one of our favorite dinner hangout spots in vegas!!!  great hours, great location, great atmosphere, great service, great food/sushi!   tons of sushi options and if you want something that isn't on the menu-- the chefs are great and will make whatever you want!   can't wait to go back!!!!

tCNNs2ihqDRzMVdegfsBxQ.text: I must point out that I did not have any sushi here! So in order for this place to get a fair and unbiased opinion on their food,  do not count on this review.   I came here simply because I was staying across the street at HRH and it was a walking distance for a drunk person. I got tired of burgers and pizzas, and I wanted something different. This place had teriyaki bowls at $8.95 a bowl. It wasn't a restaurant quality teriyaki bowl as I expected. Infact I have had way better ones in Socal at mom and pop places. However I m must say I do like the ambiance of this place. They got a sports bar style counter setup with some flat  screens. And behind the bar were the chefs making sushi on the fly. If I was into Sushi, I would definitely come here.  I was just so hammered that day where raw fish would've been a trip killer.    This place is definitely worth checking out if you need a good walking distance munchies spot from the HRH.

y5mwB3khVCBtw7QcUvqEAw.text: I frequent the Kaizen establishment closer to my house on Eastern Ave. I had friends in town and they were staying at the Cosmopolitan. I picked them up and took them out for lunch to Kaizen. I was surprised to order my usual items that I was used to but they were served differently. Not a bad thing, but it did catch me off guard.  The service was ok, had a little issue with my wifes soda being frozen. They did bring a new one out. Overall, a good dining experience. Would recommend and return.

ZEJyvdApK5oDNdHO4WSPHw.text: Good food, reasonably priced. They were able to accommodate our larger party very quickly which was nice. Service could have been more attentive. Pretty good overall.   The beef teriyaki bowl & fried chicken sushi roll was really good :)

AzEiT7fGo1PDscJewLpfcg.text: Love this place! Go weekly since we were staying nearby when we first moved here. Get the same thing every time - tempura shrimp or lobster roll and chicken katsu. And of course sake and beer. The place is lively and there is a video screen which is a bit loud, but works in this place.   Service is excellent. We love Tom. This place is also kid friendly and my daughter's favorite place to eat.

HLDjUko6Ok0SDwbGiTCMjQ.text: Been here before food is ok not the best sushi rolls in town for sure . This time I sat at the bar And sushi chefs were totally out of touch and I practically had to yell at them to get my rolls, but the retarded thing is me and my friend were the only guys at the freaking bar.

kqT1Q17h_ZMDHZQx-uRvqg.text: Solid Solid Solid, my fine yelp friends!  Came here for lunch, had a great prix fix type option, but decided to go completely a la carte.  LOVED the spicy tuna roll, just gave my tongue enough tingle to satisfy.  Hamachi was tasty, and wasabi oyster shooters were pure heaven - ooo-fa!

XMrrCXKS1sj0h9kcoD2wFA.text: Where do i start.. Kaizen Sushi is a Japanese restaurant  in front of the hard rock casino. Or at least it tries to be.. First, it's korean owned (like most sushi places.. In case you didn't know, sushi rolls were invented in korea, not japan), they serve Japanese food, but not traditional Japanese cuisine, if that's what you're looking for (try Ichiza). I came here for sushi, and to my dissapointment, the sushi was not fresh, I've been here twice and both times the fish was old.. From tuna to uni, the sushi was old and dry. Not to mention the size of their cuts.. For the price they charge they should at least make up for quantity. I've had an order of $6 nigiri that filled me up more than their $22 chirashi bowl (mix sushi bowl). Ok maybe not... but you get the idea.. The only reason why they dont deserve a 1 star review is the fact that they have friendly people working there, and they are open later than most sushi places in vegas (they close at 4am).. so prepare to order a couple of Sapporo's and Sake, and hope it makes the food taste better.

OIrbhVodzkG90D6ABFD8_g.text: Came here for lunch one day and was happy with the food and service.  I had the chicken katsu bowl and an order of California rolls.  Both were good and was a decent portion.  My friends had the kalbi short ribs and the bake muscles.  Both were delicious!    If you have a sushi craving while in Vegas come here and you wont have to pay the outrageous hotel prices!   Decor was really hip and modern.  They blast hip hop music and have a large projection screen playing music videos while you eat.

0X2CTFjc6Qb4MKm9MYphMQ.text: Came in a few times with my boyfriend, once with his dad & another time with our friends. Both times the food was tasty- our favorite was a  salmon roll topped with a creamy sauce and macadamia nuts, and this has been the only place to have it. But at $20 per roll, it's the kind of place we go to only when we'll be sharing with many people. It's close to my work and open late, which is great considering I get off work around late some days- but if I can't afford to eat there then it's not a viable option.   The interior is nice, with long wooden tables and an open feel despite the small size. The music doesn't really jibe with the asian food theme, and there are large TV screens along some of the walls playing random video.  Overall the food is tasty but expensive. For the same price range I could have multiple courses at Ichiza. The salmon killer roll IS especially good, so I would go back for that sometime, but expect the bill to run a bit high. It can also be awkward navigating out of the parking lot given the location and all the one-way streets.

psaUPhT2Tqzr9ZjGwayoBg.text: came here by accident. the  korean bbq place nearby was closed. but turns out this place aint too shabby.  i love the decor and with our big group of 15+, we sat at the long tall table by the door.  i can't review what everyone else had but my ahi tuna salad was BOMB! too bad it didn't stay in my stomach long =\  the service was good probably due to the fact that we went during lunch time when it was pretty much dead.

mtvT6aAYB-DLeyvt-5IP2Q.text: 2 rolls, a beer and a large hot sake for under $40 bucks...in Vegas...yeah. Almost unbelievable, but True. The rolls were just ok. It was only better than fast food because it was fish and rice. Had it been coated in grease, it probably would have tasted about the same. It was just ok. The price was fantastic - the sake was good. Cold beer is always cold beer. The waitstaff was friendly and sweet - the sushi chefs looked like they were biding their time until something better came along and you could taste it in the rolls. It was walking distance from my hotel...a little off the beaten path from the strip... and I like this.

LI1AzIzsqp_8VkqhpkNBNA.text: We will always eat here when we come to Vegas (we come here every year). Unique rolls, traditional rolls, great service and no loud slot machines!

YwqUw2MDGloVPw2CRi84CA.text: Amazing sushi. My favorite was the Hawaiian but I also loved the tuna tataki roll and Mexican fiesta roll. I would definitely come back if I am in Vegas again.

t4kgxSNZTiflEq-4TkRmaA.text: It's open late, it serves sushi(meh sushi) and the prices seem to reflect the fact that it's across the street from the Hard Rock. That combination is not something that will ever make me want to come back. Not to mention all 3 of the rolls I ordered were sloppily made and didn't seem to be the freshest of fish. Pass!

r8Ph3gn0k25HbNqKy_fPug.text: This was an enjoyable experience... Sushi was great and they were playing hip hop?!? Like Whoa!!!! I am definitely coming back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi!!

CdzU-yi_iN8olRMkiflMwg.text: Awesome food , excellent service & I like the ambience , it was our first time here & we really liked it .

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o4Q6abjPrPY-fJlzGvCyiw.text: So I have a bone to pick - W and I walked through the front doors that had a huge sign saying "LUNCH SPECIALS *EVERY DAY*!" When we asked the waitress about the lunch specials, she said there weren't any lunch specials because of CES. If you're going to do that, take that sign out on the front. Otherwise, it's just dishonest, and super irritating.  Ordered to share: miso soup, rock and roll, silver state roll, and the scallop volcano roll. Scallop volcano roll was def the fave and hope to find something at home like it.

g4mUUjrXuefxl-0GT4VH-w.text: Came all the way here bc I wanted to Gangnam kbbq but they were so busy so we headed Kaizen instead.  We got the Lasagna, BBQ and California roll. And it tastes absolutely amazing. We loved the bbq roll tho.  The service was great. We were seated right away and servers would always check on us. Will come back definitely!(:

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Came out pretty quick. Happy us cos we are so hungry

ZN2tgnWwLpCaGENOCPUOig.text: I love this place. The atmosphere is nice and cozy. Rolls are delicious! The quality of fish is fresh. Also I love their desserts. Happy hrs is buy one get one free drinks. I would recommend this place for anyone who's craving sushi at night. I would come back again!

UOMGUKFofz9i3NJnsYvPIw.text: Ok this is the best spot I love it and great customer service you must try !!  And the the atmosphere is to die for

GRrWj6ftVk59dyc_-vRdIg.text: This is defiantly one of the best sushi places in Las Vegas. Always consistently delicious sushi. I come twice a year for a trade show and I don't miss this place. I look forward to having sushi at Kaizen. The crispy rice is one of the best I've tasted ever. And also the spicy tuna salad is my favorite.  I live in LA where sushi is king. Thus place is better than any place in LA. A must gem close to Hard Rock Hotel. Serving is always spot on.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N45c5U5-ITdRfxJlGR1uRg.text: Truly disappointed.  The service was horrible and when I pointed it out I got excuses about the kitchen.  Don't make excuses, take responsibility for the poor service.  There was staff standing around talking to each other instead of serving customers.  The food was just okay, not super great.  We won't be going back.  I wouldn't recommend this place, there is way better sushi restaurants in the area with better food and superior service. Never going back.

G3wN_ISWxIlrgAKbe8MhFw.text: Love this place! The bbq roll is amazing and that Salsa Dancing Girl roll...  so delicious.

tiSezJqZC5Zq6J6yRu4jrw.text: Thank goodness for this sushi restaurant. We are staying at the Hard Rock And had a sushi craving. I'm in love with how good the food is and the price point.  Sashimi was spectacular and the shrimp tempura roll I had was spot on.  I'm coming back if I'm ever in the area again.  I suggest you make it out here! So delicious.  Oh and I should say that the service was so friendly and fast. Yay to Kaizen!

Y8P5S8V5jxuArfqibgYfuQ.text: This is a great place, nice atmosphere! I had the  shogun roll and shishito peppers, all fresh and delicious! My friend had the scallop volcano roll and loved it. Her first time having shishito peppers and agreed they were delicious.  Parking was easy and away from the strip and casino crowd. Good for families or a fun date. Also great options if you aren't into raw fish.

VWkHXvwyQggdRufhgddfCQ.text: Good food and music with friendly staff. Fun environment no issues.  Loved the miso soup and tempura with the salmon rolls! The decor is awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon tempura roll
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar

JfZtfPHRlpPLkKQ82jdxJg.text: Fish was very very good. Tasted fresh, nice presentation, and good prices. Absolutely would come again.

YI6MdMUOMCjp5QZoZev5RQ.text: Excellent sushi! I highly recommend it. Some of the best sushi we have ever had anywhere and we have had Sushi all over the country. Cheers!

ImgY8P5ywIEWxuU_oTFp2A.text: Awesome Lobster rolls!!!! And vegetable roll is amazing! Love the many different veggies including the pickled. Great sushi!

abyfs3NuQCvrcsUuoSQlaA.text: Bento boxes are cheap for lunch special!:) food looks good though. Nice ambiance. Desserts are great! Good customer service.

QPNS9bZ4g8Xi5TjyBnr-Ow.text: We called last minute for a table of 20 and they graciously accommodated us.  Not only was the food phenomenal, the service was even better!  Definitely will be coming back when in town.

RAdjFToSA1k1LknuZZXBrA.text: Thank you Kaizen for the great meal that was needed before our night out dancing. Michael was our server and we applaud him for putting up with us...he was attentive and laughed at our bad jokes. The ambiance wasn't too casual and not too fancy, which was perfect even though we were pretty dressed up. The sushi was DELICIOUS, fresh and nicely prepared. Two girls in our party ordered the miso soup with lobster and loved it. The sushi we ordered was great and filling. The best part about this place was that it wasn't that busy. We assumed it would get busier later into the night, since they are smart and stay open until 6am.   I plan on returning again to this cute spot off the strip when I'm back in Vegas.

0PF4HFxxIyjpdidXjK2u1w.text: This is my go to sushi restaurant when I want better quality sushi than you get at all you can eat. The food is always really well prepared and the chefs do a great job. I've become close with most of the employees and I'd recommend Kaizen to anyone!

6F0Bauob0d5IPB9WLc8SrQ.text: Late night sushi across the street from Hard Rock. Pretty good at 2am. Had a crazy girl roll, Nevada roll and spicy tataki roll. Could have passed on the NV but the other two were tasty. Friendly waitstaff. Will come back again for sure.

RZR7-K9cI5yAPLmpXuQBrQ.text: Well I have mixed feelings about this place. It's close to my apartment so that was a plus. Looks nice and upscale inside. What took it back down was the wooden chop sticks. I think if you go upscale make the chopsticks upscale too and stop cutting down trees. The menu is huge!!!!   Ok so the BBQ roll isn't good to me. The meat was chewy. Too chewy I swallowed many bites whole because I couldn't break it down. Crunchy roll was good. Tried the crazy boy it was interesting. Not bad but I just didn't like it. I had ordered the Katsura roll to try it but it never came. They charged me for it and then I told them I never got it. They took it off.   Ok so here is where I get picky. One if I order something bring it to me. Two 3 different people came up to our table asking if we are done eating and paid yet. Seriously I ordered rolls a few times relax and let me eat or wait for the goof.  When I'm done eating I'll let you know. And three when we walk in and I tell you we want a table instead of sushi bar don't suggest the sushi bar over and over.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ roll and crunch roll
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinning

iDpSOAE3s_oK-BgomnEHTw.text: Love it! It's one of my favorite sushi places in town. I would recommend to anyone who is Vegas get the shiitake mushroom tempura roll

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sake!

ujwTnQkpP_K-w_OwCe5seg.text: Today is my 3rd time here. Came recommended by a friend. My favorite sushi place in Vegas! Friendly staff, and the food comes out really fast. Medium range in regards to pricing. Will keep coming back.

X20B2HmWXAHhOEV8_rEHrg.text: Ordered delivery for Mother's Day, was a GREAT IDEA! Movie and sushi at home with my son and husband! Sushi was quality, the raw tuna melt in your mouth  Delivery was early side of the delivery est, short one chopsticks but we are at home so we are fine, all WORTH it. Spent as much as we would have eating there with tip  for all you can eat but honestly we are all so full, forgot to take pics SORRRRY. But trust it was BOMBBBB! Would order again!

Q9GQVMEDX6Nm_Ie1pVUNLA.text: HANDS DOWN , THE DOPEST SUSHI PLACE IN VEGAS , I go here every 2 weeks ! That's how awesome it's is ,it's AYCE don't have these many options, but here you literally walk out so full and happy ! Me and my bf live Thai place and the staff, THE STAFF ARE SO AMAZING AND FAST ! I promise you won't be disappointed

OCQysC8jOI8Z17_DsYJolA.text: If you love sushi rolls, you HAVE TO check out this place! They have so many sushi roll varieties, it's insane! Sushi's for vegetarians, sushi's for people who don't like fish or seafood, baked sushi's, etc

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W7VRa4SfCWnx6z4kFxeNxA.text: Greeted upon entrance from a very sweet host ! The food was very fresh and yummy ! The atmosphere is very relaxing and clean ! I would definitely recommend to check out this joint !

DKitGU2ZTM6abc2OcmCPhA.text: My husband and I went here for his birthday dinner since we were in town. The menu is impressive. So much to choose from! Taking a shot of the menu won't do justice. We ordered the Orange Blossom, Spicy Tataki roll, & Spicy Tuna on Crispy Rice. All were so tasty! The Orange tasty was the one we favored most and it was recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
