RzL0xOLnsmn6fcvZ-FteIg.text: Very good service Sushi very fresh  And the servers nice and friendly  Will come back

zob2rJ_oeTu6yJAx9ebRWw.text: Price is very reasonable Have to get the tuna poke salad, ika yaki, and the paradise roll!  Service is quick too!  Not that far from strip (:  Ambient setting and very cozy  Would recommend and definitely going again!

HtgPYT7CNIQeelJ2rNwXkQ.text: This is my Vegas Sushi place. Literally have been here over 10 times and I will continue to come. The crazy girl roll is my absolute favorite! The guest I brought got the teriyaki roll and the jalapenos roll and both of his were bomb! I've always come late night and the customer service has always been great. I'll continue to come over and over again! Love it! Also the monkey brains are bomb too!! Lol

cOixBc3kY6UrK95zEh5OLA.text: We had to go grab sushi and with so many choices in Las Vegas, it is hard to choose. We decided to try a high rated place, but outside the resorts and hotels. It was empty when we went in, so I was a bit hesitant to try it. But pleasantly surprised. Great service, fish was fresh and yummy. Cooked muscles were perfectly seasoned. Overall great, experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rG4fwH36KiNqBR08c2b9PQ.text: WOW!   The selection of rolls this place has is awesome.   I went two days ago for lunch with my boyfriend and it was the perfect holiday setting.   Music playing, fireplace projector, cozy seating.   Honestly so worth it.   Would have left five stars but it's a bit pricey but that's expected because of its location.   Hours are awesome because they're open late

-TQIUws-Wk0wKk8PuGzCrg.text: We came to Kaizen for our bday celebration and were blown away by the yummy factor. Paradise Roll was amazeballs. Mixed Poke  Fresh and delicious!!

GTLu6NKYbOuGVaWfLaPynw.text: My cousin's don't even live in LV but they have made 5 trips this year mostly because of this restaurant. The fish always tastes fresh and amazing. The service is quick and efficient, and the atmosphere is cute with friendly servers.   Some great dishes: -ika yaki: never had anything similar to this at another Japanese restaurant and I'm sort of kind of sad I can only have it here instead of back home (although it is another reason to come back to Vegas..) it's soooo fucking goood.   - bbq roll: such a diff take on a roll!!! I've gotten it twice now and it's so good.   - rainbow roll: again, the fish is just so fresh.  I will continue to try diff rolls and update review.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goin in on some rolls

I4-qB1Oo1RoVqA5oLQcFSg.text: This is by far the best sushi joint I've ever had. The sushi is very fresh and taste amazing. Will definitely come back.

KrbXBQa9M8oEzwZpuUAZyg.text: Seriously we eat here every night when  in Vegas. I have a very sensitive tummy and every time I eat here I feel great. I am so happy with the menu because I can order differ things every night and feel like a different restaurant! Best rolls, best buckwheat noodle soups, best short ribs. Afraid to share because I don't want them to be too busy for me.

Jp0WYUqHvWrF1Tah-r-vVQ.text: Always come here. The guys that make the sushi are the best at it. Always have great customer service here. My favorite dish is the salmon skin cut rolls and spicy garlic edamame. My go to drink is the lychee martini! P.s. they're open till like 5am...dont ask me how I know lol

Q3PMhXeyZEDy2qX4Eg2tPA.text: Absolutely a must try! if you love sushi, I believe this is one of the best places! my personal favorite roll is *salmon killer 2* i'm not a spicy fan, BUT the salmon killer two has the perfect amount of spice and flavor is delicious also! the staff is friendly too!

sxonzEFwrSsZORGSysLLJw.text: Delicious food, great service. Came for a birthday dinner and it turned out great. They even have fresh wasabi.  So check it!  We'll be back tomorrow again.

SYYZYiXEhF1pkVl8v0NiLQ.text: This is my personal favorite sushi place. It is reasonably priced, easy to get to and great atmosphere. I've never tried a roll here that I didn't like

NpHdMqoGZJPSHMoa_9uANg.text: I love the atmosphere of the place. We were greeted and serviced as soon we walked in.

Sy1j_SzsVxGeBHFkF1dAHA.text: Even though the atmosphere is more like "club sushi" I still like this place. I can put up with the big screen playing trendy music videos and the elevated volume for 3 reasons.  1. The fish was fresh, the rice was good and the selection of fresh fish sufficient!  2. They are open until 6am and I have another option for late night/early morning sushi cravings.  3. Great service!

ajmU257yu1QGBDeHNmaFtg.text: I like this place a lot because they have great food. I like them even more because they're open late. I've been here a few times after a night out on the strip, I don't know how exactly, but I've made it. I've had rolls and noodles and have enjoyed both with friends.  However, after coming here for a late night [sober] dinner recently I came to realize it really is a good sushi spot away from the strip. Especially since they have great deals - it was half off when we went for dinner.  It's good food, a great deal, chill atmosphere and great service. I must admit though, that i give them extra props for being open late and still delivering great service at such a late hour.

uqW2un_S316QKCzz9bsQ8A.text: Stopped in here after Yama Sushi had an 50 minute wait! The decor reminded me of a nightclub. We ordered Gyoza and an assortment of other sushi rolls. The service was pretty good.  All of the rolls were pretty good, but the real standout was Japanese lasagna. it tasted different from Sushi-mon's or even Yama's because it tasted more like it should be called 'Japanese Mac N Cheese'. it was refreshing and interesting tasting.  The Gyoza was not as awesome. I'm not a fan of deep-fried gyoza. This place definitely hit the spot for my sushi craving. However upon leaving the restaurant i realized it wasn't the same as Yama sushi. Still good, but not the same.

qeEVksfQM7Qt-X7n7eBpKA.text: My favorite sushi place that I intend to go here for my Birthday to have a drink and enjoy the wonderful rolls here. My waitress here last time was ultra attentive and nice. The prices are fair and food is just amazing like I mean really good. It had me dazing in class one time because I wanted to go here to fix my sushi craving.

isWV-3Wa78UpW4QYcMvPLg.text: Lunch at Kaizen?  Heck yeah.  Why does eating sushi on your lunch hour feel so scandalous?  Probably because spending $35 for two people is a little much for lunch hour. lol  It could be worse.  I got the lunch special California Roll with salad and miso soup.  Pretty good.  California Roll was really small but Im not really expecting much for it being the lunch special.  My friend got some sort of dragon roll and sashimi.  Her roll was much bigger than my baby Cal roll.  Both she said was pretty good.  My one gripe for this place is that they don't serve white meat chicken!  I love myself a teriyaki chicken but not with gross dark meat.  I understood back in the day the cheap way to go for these places is the dark meat, but now in a health cautious world a place such as this should have white meat for Gods sake.   Anyways, food pretty good.  Service good...they guy actually remembered I needed a fork for my salad. hehe  The place is always empty for the most part.  I sometimes wonder why being that its across the street from the Hard Rock.  So yeah just an "okay three star review" because of the "no white meat".  Get with the times Kaizen!

SodudoWxtWeyuL6PnaLYkQ.text: Cool Sushi spot, right across the street from Hard Rock Hotel in Vegas.  I had sushi at this spot after a gig in Vegas at 4:00am in the morning. Place was jumpin' at 4am....lot's of people out eating sushi in the wee-early early morning hours. Kinda pricey...but if you're really craving sushi late night, this is the spot to go to.  Check my pic....this is one of the rolls I had, Bake Lobster Roll...was pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good late night Sushi!

alNgXSoEqm4cz4figNGtpw.text: Great sushi spot! The white rose and Unicon rolls were awesome. The kaizen roll was good too. Everything was really fresh. Good service. Prices were pretty good too. Will definitely go back.

Pg9pINUg_dafGnfWzEzVpg.text: I'm shocked at all the good reviews this place is getting. We could hardly eat our sushi and had to return it to the chefs! Its nice that this place is open late but thats about it. The food was priced high so I was expecting incredible sushi. Turns out, the sushi you get from Costco or the buffetts at any LV strip hotel tastes way better. I was so disappointed at the quality and will definitely never dine here again.   Here's a sampling of what we ordered: CA roll - super dry Tuna roll & various sashimis - the fish wasn't fresh Chicken Teriyaki bowl - chicken was dry and inedible Tamago roll - this one we sent back because it tasted funny

wVgZLbAzLLM_RjGms9yG6w.text: Great sushi, good atmosphere. Unusually odd music choice (DJ techno dance music? Insert gag reflex here. Was i supposed to BYO Molly?) but it IS Las Vegas so what do you expect?

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maki roll

HF8_1maDb7csic8tMgOq6w.text: EXCELLENT sushi rolls and a lot to choose from!! Had the krazy boy (deep fried California roll), Tiger eye, and one other. Soo good. Also had the chicken teriyaki bowl which had lots of veggies and rice which was great, as well. Prices very fair and affordable. Great service, they even called a taxi for us after. Will definitely be back. Only a few minutes off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Krazy boy, Tiger roll, chicken teryaki bow
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken teryaki bowl, Krazy Boy roll, cant remember the other two. Excellent flavor!

81FkXmkyI3vBqojobacI4w.text: Great food!!! Will come back again. Must try the Jay roll and the tatami roll. Came here all the way from LA.

R5aYukEK4olozcLB2bmWRw.text: Place was recommended by the Oyster House and its absolutely wonderful. Glad we tried it.

OB7q87Yk--s1b8EkvC9dvw.text: We are visiting from Oregon and had been here years ago with local & out of state friends. This was our 2nd visit and we love it just as much as the first time.  Everything we ordered was fresh & fabulous!  Great atmosphere and great service.

F8I3TMBJH9PwX80_X1S05w.text: Service was ok, but not the best. Ordered dinner for two from the sushi menu. We were looking for some soft shell crab. They delivered a breaded and deep fried something - was hard to even tell it had crab in it. One of the unagi pieces I ordered tasted a little funky, but one was ok. I read many reviews before opting to come here. I can't imagine even going to an AYCE sushi restaurant. To those who complain about price, we paid $60 for a light dinner here, but would have much rather paid the $200 elsewhere and gotten ten times better food and service. Couldn't go there though, because it was Wednesday. :(

ypAEr7hGB0qtukcHpDANHw.text: The fish doesn't taste fresh and it's a little over priced for the quality. The service is friendly

hLumHe8suPQQt2VUVhfH2w.text: This is probably one of my favorite sushi places in Las Vegas. Food is always fresh and the service is always great!

HN49R2AQfQS1DQ9d7o4ZyQ.text: perfect! food is great! good service with nice waiters. weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeereeeeeeee

9JHuwYdUdx9GSiX8w96UEg.text: This place is right across from Hard Rock in a shopping center.  Super good rolls although normal to slightly higher priced but very good.  Service was pretty good, I would definitely come back again.  The desert menu is awesome I have never seen so many options at a sushi restaurant which was really cool.  I had the chocolate truffle and it was really bomb.

gWl4Bnze-BQOd94cgV5JDA.text: The atmosphere was very nice. I liked the vibe of the place. The sushi was fresh and our waitress very kind. I would recommend it. Will be back when I'm in Vegas next time.

pTNYxvoZGOh1Z17mb9ypVA.text: My favorite sushi place! They never disappoint  try the First kiss or the Orange Blossom they are my favorites there

hHxmXeHz714aooPIxR8bEA.text: Staff is really attentive and friendly. Food was amazing, great options. I'm a vegan so I have to shoehorn that in here somewhere, because vegan. Also crossfit. Good food, good vibes.  10/10 would go Kaizen.

u1n741m8nzb7l7QPS0SCjw.text: This a a great little place off of the strip. Everyone on my group was craving sushi so we decided to hit this place because it was close, in a little shopping center across from the Hard Rock.  It's small but don't let that fool you.  We were quickly seated and orders were taken right away.  Talk about great sushi. Everything we had was great. I had a dragon roll and crunch roll. There prices are pretty good for the quality and size of your rolls.  Pineapple sakitini is a great cocktail to order.    I almost forgot that they stay open until at least 4am everyday, a must for vegas if you are into hanging out late. So if you have a late night craving stop it.  If you haven't had enough to drink they have buy one get one free.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C02RRarWX8sKN7UuCJQXUA.text: While I was in Vegas for my friends birthday, we decided to get some sushi. This place came up when I searched, "all you can eat sushi." Sadly, it wasn't. But we stayed and gave it a shot.   The service was awesome. Our waitress was friendly and patient with all 7 of us. We ordered a variety of rolls, and every single one of them was delicious.   They also had some late happy hour, which is after 12am, and it's buy one get one free.  Very clean place as well.   Give it shot!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1qOZYCs7Mvqqqfsn5UowyQ.text: I don't see why people like this place so much! They have horrible service! It's seriously the service that gets them the 1 star. First of all no one was even in the front to greet you. We ordered two hot teas and NEVER got them, but was still charged for it. The sushi rolls were good. The food is good don't get me wrong. But the waitresses that work here don't even want to be there.  Some other waitress that wasn't even helping us in the first place got us water. And apologized for her coworkers mistake. Wait why are you apologizing...? The Asian waitress should be apologizing. Anyways I definitely will not be coming back. Management needs to check up on this because several people are complaining about the service.   On top of all that another customer walks I'm after us and gets his drinks and food before us? Thanks for the slap in the face.  This place has a Japanese name, but definitely Korean owned.  I suggest to order togo to avoid this situation.

t3Qf1YNTcRUEcJeS3dYv3g.text: Without a doubt the most interesting sushi bar with the freshest fish in Vegas. Never miss a chance to come here when in town.

oAxQxJkp3pl7PTn72LDcnA.text: The UNI here is fresh! I know it's hard to find a good UNI, and I've tried everywhere. Kaizen tonight had a fantastic UNI, bright vibrant color to it and a fresh quality taste.   All the sushi was exceptional.   Our waiters Joon and Irene were amazing and went above and beyond to ensure our dining experience was enjoyable. We will be back!

y9QwpBJxAkoDSesaiK4R4Q.text: This place doesn't disappoint! Fantastic sushi and price is decent. The only reason I didn't give it 5 is the service is always abit slow and my appetizer usually comes out half way through my roll. Kinda defeats the purpose of an appetizer.

ekz0zvQJgyBdMC9iURXk6A.text: Our fav go to sushi spot! Extremely fast service and the food is DEEEEEELICIOUS! Guaranteed to leave with a smile and full belly :)

Ryd6UJpUHbLuhX-dUxghqA.text: Very good menu and great service!!!! Don't sleep best sushi in Vegas!!!! Don't sleep on this jewel! Very food happy hour menu as well as regular! Very close to casinos and a lot cheaper! If you want good sushi try this place!

u66EiJJB_hqr2YeZ984KNw.text: The spring roll is surprisingly good! As well as the Las Nevada roll! The spicy tuna salad is fresh though the sauce isn't that spicy. We came from watching a show and found this open just in time for Happy Hour! The ambience is calm and the interior is pretty. The best part is that it's just across Hard Rock Hotel where we stayed!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is satisfyingly good!

Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The agadeshi tofu is satisfyingly good! And the crunch roll is just the right size though it would have been tastier if there&#39;s more sauce.

hh1Q0ZWgD2tJize2l0zQhw.text: This restaurant is amazing!  We had grilled octopus, paradise roll and red dragon.  If truth be told 4 of us got 3 paradise rolls because it was so amazing!  I definitely recommend this place when in Las Vegas.

_OgZME0CPpxNoh1MIGEW9A.text: Amazing food and service complimented with kind and courteous staff. Great choice for a late night meal with nice music and ambience.  Rainbow roll and cherry blossom are great choices and are extremely fresh and delicious.

yLCb7OfOaxqcKWmrd3UWew.text: Their sauce was amazing. The best sushi I've had so far. After a long night of drinking I was shocked to see they were still open. They did NOT disappoint I can tell you that

NI2LjVaykDAbtL_g9hAw_w.text: I love this place and have been coming here for years, I am a sashimi girl and they have a great sashimi selection. I also like that they are open late. Also the new dessert menu is awesome.

yWGmnLW7a_m67KZ4MmO1gg.text: This isn't my first time eating at kaizen but decided to do a review. I love their food here. It bums me they no longer do all you can. I remember the last I went they do all you can eat. I don't know if it was seasonal. But my favorite entrees here would have to be the baked salmon or the beef teriyaki. The serving fills me up. Other than that, I do love their baked rolls. I would definitely recommend the baked lasagna. Super duper good. If you're into tempura roll I would recommend the crazy boy roll. 8 pieces for only 7 bucks! I love the eel sauce. The food is great overall. For service wise, it's fair. You'll have the good waiters and sometimes the bad ones.

Bt4Q2i_PLvUTqQODn_CCvQ.text: I loved this restaurant. They were extra attentive and accommodating. I got the Kaizen Ceviche -- highly recommended!   It's really close to the Bellagio where we stayed. It's not too out of the way.   Definitely come out to Kaizen if you're in the mood for something delicious.   Kyle

KyrdLuq7DraFZoRU9B44VA.text: I've been coming here for years and it's still great. Fresh fish, huge creative rolls and friendly customer service. They are open late and the atmosphere is sleek but not snobby. I've never had a bad experience at Kaizen. One of my favorite sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monster Roll

DmUmvjmedo-LoIvVAXwkzA.text: Great place to hang out.  The sushi is awesome.  Would definitely recommend the scallop volcano sushi. The waitresses are very friendly.

jL_0H5RqKTaDsFqjNrHLZQ.text: Excellent service, great food, great ambiance (Olympics playing on multiple TVs....go Team USA!)

KMYFZ5DnmmoXpjkmOD17kA.text: I love sushi!  I can literally live on sushi! Kaizen Sushi so conveniently located, I come here every week. It's a small restaurant. Everyone knows everyone! It's like family!  The waiters and waitresses are always happy. They are always welcome us with a smiley face. Our servers always know what we drink, but for curtesy, they always checking on our orders, asking if we like something else. Mostly we drink iced tea. They serve passion fruit tea, always very fresh. We tried the Sake (Lychee flavor) first time. It's great flavor, kind of sweet, but good, if you like sweet drinks.  My favorite items are: Sexy Rolls; Nevada Rolls; Crunchy Scallops Rolls. I don't always eat raw fish, so I am happy to order the above mentioned. Those rolls are a very fine balance with great flavor.  Besides the rolls, I really like the Seafood Curry Udon. Personally, I don't eat very spicy food. So, I asked them to make sure the curry is very low, and a sauce is very light on my udon. They prepare it perfectly for me. BF likes the Chicken or Beef Curry Udon. Both of the meals are in great balance of either the seafood or meat and vegetables over the Udon (noodles) and the curry sauce.  For dessert, I really liked their deep fried green tea ice cream. It's a huge portion, so it can be easily shared.   Love their recently remodeled dining room! The white chairs are making the restaurant look much nicer than before. The atmosphere is great. Music sometimes louder than I like, but high energy, so it doesn't bother me!  I noticed some art/paintings are displayed on the walls, and they are for sale. So if you like them, you can purchase it!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchy scallops rolls
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchy scallops rolls
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lychee Sake

49LDVdITfI_nrTZyoqX0Iw.text: Great service. Friendly staff. Nice place. Miso soup with lobster was good. Had Champaign called Cooks went well with the food. Green tea was good

f6zFKtOIBI9X_j3oGiojww.text: This is our go to sushi spot. I always have the veggie tempura roll, and my bf gets the bbq roll. We both have spicy garlic edamame, and miso soup. Everything is always great! Good service. Never any complaints.

UKV1KaiRvL1PXe_arm-GRw.text: I don't even know why we stopped here - we had just gotten done with a food filled day, ending at Dog Haus in the same plaza and I have such a weakness for sushi, I just had to check reviews. Once I saw the great reviews, I couldn't pass it up, no matter how full I was. So we stopped in to sit at the bar and just have a drink and two rolls, rather than my usual boat of sushi and sashimi. We got the Paradise and Ninja rolls and I liked the Ninja Roll, but I loved the Paradise Roll. It's rare that I order rolls, and when I do, I'm always disappointed in the lack of flavor and heat. I'm not a fan of reviewing a place after just getting drinks or just getting an app, but these were both so full of flavor that I just had to add a review.

Tk3pQY8-Ws6e-Y2beG0nRA.text: I love this place I travel far into the city just for their sushi  yum I highly recommend if you want good service n great sushi's

wRNfSQgf8chP5vCkBb-Qjw.text: Amazing sushi.   This is my favorite place to go in Vegas for sushi.   I love the rolls and the kaizen rolls are the best... it's like 2 pages of great choices.  Go here now!

7Z8vXlGI9pYB4xykA_SCxw.text: This is my fav spot in Vegas. Great selections of sushi rolls. You can create your own rolls too. TAKKY is my favorite server. She is awesome! I love the food and the vibes here. Definitely would come back again!

XbVGS4tC3L6z3yVPKZSeJg.text: This is my second time here , came in for lunch yesterday and now I'm back! I got the  Shrimp Killer 2 ... sooo good! Next time I'm in Vegas I'll definitely be stopping in to eat and try more of the menu.

3ChwglSOWNf-PuDWvuIs3A.text: Back again, one year later. Never disappoints!!!! If you want great sushi at a very fair price, you need to come here!

HaXWF8tpUSrk1eIG0EsLOA.text: Go to Kaizen and experience the all-you-can-eat sushi special!!!! The sushi just kept coming more and more! Sashimi was delicious, the rolls were great. Monkey brain was great! And to finish off make sure you try the tempura cheesecake, it's definitely an experience!

G86xTNDBalk19JwgSZhQcg.text: We came out for dinner after a long day at work. There are so many choices in the area, and we finally agreed to stop here. We made a GREAT choice. I do not eat sushi, but ordered the chicken yakisoba. It was worth the extra to have white meat.   Very good meal.

jvmMcsQKh1he3uo6wYusJw.text: Really good sushi.  Great Ponzu sauce!!!  We came here by accident, but we're really glad we did!   Highly recommended.

a9RhO5LWF8EBBCCyu_hU4Q.text: Great atmosphere, and beautiful location. A must see in the city of Vegas if you're over by the Hardrock hotel and casino. We had the Rose roll and Tokyo roll lil to no rice and tons of flavor.

hPmvxxLcYEnXpxbhxDdPZQ.text: We wanted a light dinner. Had two  rolls. It was like crunching on a nut eating the tuna, salmon, mango roll, would like to have been told the mango was not ripe. The crab in the firecracker roll did not taste fresh. Staff were pleasant, decor is nice but the sushi was just so so. It was a Friday night and we were seated immediately, however.

B2rxyo8rX7oH1q2ud9NjiA.text: One of my most favorite sushi spots in Vegas. When I'm near the strip I always like to come here. The service is always great and friendly and the food is amazing. My favorite is the Rose Roll (I've attached a photo of it) I'm a huge tuna lover so this one is perfect for me. I also tried the chili crab lettuce wraps tonight and those were really yummy!! They have an awesome happy hour where you buy one alcoholic drink get one free! I'm all about that. If you are near the Hard Rock Hotel, you have to come try it out!! It's open super late too which is great for us industry people.

o3oBZbE69PBqdf6IsViUhw.text: Best sushi I have had anywhere in the U.S.  The service was outstanding as well. You must give it a try! I will be back every time I'm in town.

M6EMvJ94y7TT0Qt9SWP-BQ.text: The flavors are great. I don't usually do reviews but this place deserves it. Visiting from Los Angeles. Our favorite place there closed and was driving by this place and decided to check it out. Sure glad we did. Tops my list. Your not eating just plain fish here. It's filled with flavors! We will be returning for sure. I would give at 10 starts if i could.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red dragon  Seared tuna

Q8Pfs-v9d_EWRt_U7GzO1g.text: If you're a tourist looking for sushi this is only 1 of 2 places farily close to the strip. It's open til 4am Sun-Thurs & til 6am on Fri & Sat. They have quite the selection of rolls. However the rolls are a bit smaller than other sushi places I've been to. The food is good though & comes out rather quickly regardless of what the wait staff tells you. The wait staff is a bit slow at times even when it's not peak hours. Try a saketini if you get a chance they taste a bit like sangria. If you're like me & order a Sapporo you expect it to come w/ a beer glass chilled not a Modelo Especial glass. Deduction of points on that fro me. The atmosphere is well lit. You can sit at a booth area or at a table. The tables are picnic style so you could be rubbing elbows w/ neighbors during busier hours.  If you're a local this place a bit pricier than other sushi restuarants for less of the food. Again great food, just need to eat more to be full. Normally 2 rolls & an app w/ a beer will fill me up. It took 3 rolls & an app w/ a beer to fill me up here.  Tried 9 rolls last night out of our group: Shrimp Killer - Good Spicy Rainbow Roll - VERY GOOD Teriyaki Roll - Not so good Silver State Roll - SO GOOD Dragon Roll - ok Avacado Roll - ok Tiger Roll - Good Firecracker - SO GOOD

CfPmWx4d_hPf6PWJ1_NKpA.text: Great customer service! We recommend you the  silver state roll and BBQ roll are really yummy!

zdczFQJwUKsXNAN_zKE0Dw.text: Sushi rolls are soo good here! I really like the presentation of their rolls. A lot of detail and creativity is put into the presentation. I would definitely recommend for late night sushi or any of their other menu items!

L4h-Xh2SHRn7DBE2pK7BnQ.text: The atmosphere is great as well as the service. I always get the spicy tuna salad its so good!

AV-HHGmPfRKSZRYx-KFj7w.text: Always good food and good service. Love the lobster tempura roll. The miso soup is delicious too.

dWbpHInz09Y_e6zaQVQamg.text: TUNA POKE WAS AMAZING. Sushi was fresh and sashimi pieces were nice and thick. Everything was on point  even for being open til 4am

6AWexbxqhv1BriR0rq2DSw.text: This place is not bad. I found it late night and decided to sit at the bar. I usually NEVER sit at the bar, but it looked inviting , and very casual, it was a friday night, around 11pm or so. They were playing techno music, I actually like the atmosphere. My date and I came in a for quick bite, and this was pretty fast and not very expensive. Both time that I have been there it has not drained my wallet for what i got. 1st time here i got a shrimp tempura roll ( 7bucks), not bad. and a cucumber roll(4 bucks). My date got the shrimp killer. ( around 8). Not bad at all.   Second time I went i ordered to go, and I got a vegetable tempura roll,(7bucks) which i found to be VERY GOOD! They put avocado in it. I tried the spicy scallop roll, but I did not care for it. It has some kind of a red mixture, somewhat like tomato. I dont know. I have had better. Everything else was very good!. Shrimp tempura roll. vegetable tempura roll. scallop roll, cucumber roll all came out to 24 dollars to go. I know i dont order extravagant rolls but thats cause im allergic to some of the stuff in those. So for me veggies rolls are wonderful. Ill prob come back again, because they pay attention to my fish allergy. I come here alone sometimes after work, and I never feel weird. The sushi chefs talk to me, and they said they would remember my allergy if I came back, that makes me feel SO GREAT!

U8iQKqgilt5Mpv_c2TY_fw.text: Good -  The food is excellent. Bad  _  service is terrible.  Lunchtime service would be better if I went to the kitchen to get it  myself.  wait staff obviously has little training.               Ask for hot tea and you might wait 20 minutes. ORtsIbb2yiAMx--ydbNIFQ.text: Stopped in for some late dinner encouraged by the reviews here but still skeptical. I sat at the end of the sushi bar so I could watch the food being prepared. I was impressed with the care and attention to detail. I asked for an eel hand roll which was made quickly and well. I decided to try one of their crazy fusion rolls and ordered the Unicorn. All the ingredients came together well and the slightly spicy, slightly vinegary sauce really added some kick and acid while letting all the flavors of the fish and shrimp and lobster come through. Staff was friendly, attentive and efficient. Prices were reasonable. Overall I would definitely come here again and recommend it to friends.

xr5A-_KpHBqZE7yKCIoAeQ.text: In essence...  No AYCE. Overpriced because it is so close to the Strip. $60+ with tip for 2 people.  My husband and I managed to land here for sushi on a Friday night. We did this because the line for Yama Sushi (which is my fave sushi spot in town) had a line waaaay out the door and to be honest I just did not want to wait that long. So. Enter Kaizen, which had good Yelp reviews, but alas, was somewhat of a disappointment.   First with the good, the place LOOKS fabulous. Dark exterior, plays with lovely lighting and the tables are large with good spacing. Dinnerware and presentation is superb, but it better be since this place is so close to the Strip. Customer service is so-so. Although the entire staff yells as people enters/leaves, our service with food to our table was only okay. I ordered a hot green tea and it was brought out in a large cup, which I dislike because I enjoy my tea HOT. As it sits uncovered it cools down quickly and not once did a server ask to refill it. I prefer smaller cups and pots of tea for this reason.  Ordered:  - Edamame  - California Roll - Tuna Roll  - Shrimp Roll - Spicy Rainbow Roll - Spicy Tuna Hand Roll  Pluses - size of rolls at least (kind of) make you not feel so bad about how much you are paying and that you cannot get AYCE here. PLUS, again, presentation is great and sushi is very good quality. The only qualm I had was with the Tuna Roll being a bit on the warmer side when it arrived at our table than I would have liked.  My husband is a super picky sushi eater (hence the very plain rolls we had). The place does have some interesting rolls, the spicy rainbow roll was decent, and large, I'm glad I ordered it as it did fill me up.  BEST - Edamame, just stinking amazing for some reason. Served steaming, with a good amount of salt, and a LARGE portion.  Not the best... again, price wise you can find just as good sushi elsewhere and Vegas, except you don't have to pay for the atmosphere and Jay-Z music videos in the background.... HOLY GRAIL!!!

Xy0Fel_QUZwGNf2bjyr_rA.text: Fabulous place. First time here with my wife and daughter. Clean and open space. Service was great, sushi was fresh and the cooked food was great.  Price is decent for the quality. We had agedashi tofu, chicken karaage, rainbow roll, calamari tempura roll, and a chicken teriyaki rice bowl.

n1wWZ91bZGJPJulBbbhwBA.text: Almost all of my sushi experiences these days are AYCE, so it was nice to go out for a few rolls and know I didn't have to prep for stuffing myself. Prices are definitely high given Kaizen's proximity to the Hard Rock Hotel and ordering two rolls will easily set you back for more than a typical AYCE dinner. However, I do think the quality of ingredients is better, the rolls are thicker, and there's a little more effort put in to justify at least some of the price.   The restaurant is hip and modern despite its Strip Mall location. There's weren't many customers on a Tuesday night but it did look like most of them were tourists. We sat at the bar and ordered the Shishito Pepper appetizer to start. I was surprised by how many peppers they gave us. They were served with bonito flakes on the side, which I wasn't quite sure what to do with. Do I eat them on top of the peppers? Between bites of the peppers? I ended up drizzling soy sauce on the flakes and eating them with the peppers, making it easier to stick together. We also ordered the Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna (always a favorite), Katana Roll, and TT Girl Roll. The Katana had just the right amount of heat and the sauce served with it tasted like Cool Ranch Doritos. I do think it was ranch based, and I never knew how well ranch goes with sushi, though what doesn't go well with ranch...? My boyfriend enjoyed the T.T. Girls roll, I liked the eel on top but thought it was a little too saucy.   Overall a pleasant experience at Kaizen. Don't go in thinking you have to eat like you would at an AYCE place. It was a lot of food and I was thoroughly satiated at the end of the meal. This is certainly a cheaper option than eating at Nobu at HRH, but if you're trying to really get down on some sushi and don't care too much about quality or ambiance, there are plenty of AYCE sushi spots just behind UNLV that may serve your wallet and appetite better.

egWbRyJDmL15WTSUBbKNRg.text: We visit this sushi spot every time we come to Vegas. It is our go to for sushi and with good reason, their food is fabulous! I sadly didn't take any pictures because I totally thought I had reviewed this spot before.      I definitely recommend it. I always the white rose roll, Tako sashimi, and the tempura green tea ice cream. I did order additional items this time, the unicorn roll and a tempura appetizer.      The unicorn roll was good. The tempura was not the best I've had, but I've been to Japan comparatively, and not a lot of tempura here meets that quality. Not all tempura is created equal! Lol.      Our group ordered probably about 5 or 6 other rolls that everyone shared and nothing was disappointing. This place always delivers and they're open super late night.     Another biggie is their fish quality! It's great, never any questions or concerns about freshness.

mK6kZeYR5q7Q8suppQb_UQ.text: Not a bad thing on the menu.  Was in town for two weeks on business. Having lived in Vegas, there's no shortage of good sushi in town but good sushi near The Strip at a reasonable price with great service? Here's your destination. Everything is fresh, nothing was fishy, and over two weeks, we sampled nearly half the menu, I'd figure. Don't let the strip mall fool you -- this place is great and locals and tourists alike will be in for a pleasant surprise.

Girls Roll and the Rock & Roll roll. All of the them were delicious. My favorite was the T. T. Girls roll. If sushi can be "comfort food" than that's what the T.T. Girls roll is for me. You won't be disappointed here! Afterwards we went to Insomnia Cookies for a little dessert. Best cookies ever!!!

LQU7fKrLGNJZuSHXdyh4lw.text: Yoooooooo this place is the bomb! Im a big fan of AYCE which they offer here, which is awesome!   Let me be completely up front and honest here, I've been seeing 1 sushi restaurant for years(which will remain unnamed), rarely straying from the exclusivity of our unity.   The story goes Kaizen is right down the street from my girlfriends house. Naturally I was a little hesitant to go here, what would my other sushi house think? Would they find out? Would they be mad at me, jealous?! I was a complete mess and stressed out about the situation. Non the less I still went. I nervously ordered the AYCE, immediately putting in an order for a few rolls, then I waited. Within no time my rolls started to be quickly delivered to me. After taking the first bite of the First Kiss roll all my nerves melted away and I was suddenly in a sushi heaven. I'll never forget that first delicious tempura roll from Kaizen, the First Kiss was very much a First kiss from Kaizen to my taste buds.  The Nigiri was so satifying and delicious it may have been made by God himself. Seriously I think God took the form of a sushi chef and made sushi at Kaizen that day. Everything was so delicious, amazing service, friendly staff, and I'm pretty sure god works there on occasion when he's board which happened to be the day I went.   What are you waiting for?! Go to Kaizen now! The main thing I learned from all of this is that there is room in my life for two sushi houses. I will be back to see you soon my sweet sweet Kaizen.

amwkbRwgkFbCNpjiJ3MpDA.text: Love Kaizen I come here after work and fish is always fresh ... :) Avocado train is what I order every time can't get enough of it. It's delicious !! Service is great

The tastes of rice, crab, fish are pretty flavorless. And the fact that this is not AYCE, their portions should be a lot bigger. This place tastes like an average AYCE place -nothing special. The one nice thing are the hours. At 2 in the morning we wanted sushi and went here. I guess if you're walking by this place and want some sushi, go. But otherwise you are missing absolutely nothing.

OaZS0w0UwjsJwJJRgBmvEA.text: I have eaten here several times, and each time loved this place.  Quality is excellent, and the platting is nice.  My only criticism is that either the tables are too high or the chairs are too low ..... when I eat there I feel like I was back in 1st grade sitting at a desk made for middle-schoolers.  Highly recommended.

qRlR7bV5YW6oE57Kpx4Sng.text: Amazon yellowtail ... amazing everything. This is my second time here. Orange blossom is the go to, but if that is not your thing, everything is fresh and great quality sushi.
