Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow tail and jalapeño... yummy!

xktEkty7oa0i4fiI-NEKVQ.text: Great place to eat with friends. Food was good from soup to entree. Service was also good and reasonable. Would definitely come back to this place and grab more sushi and katsu!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

57HskOLkVKpZmD9ZaFfvMA.text: We went here after a very late night on the strip. Right off the strip, and uber ride was very cheap so location was amazing. Walking into a place at 3AM, you would expect a place to look like dirty and run down. This place was the complete opposite. Very nice and very clean. We're helped right away and given some suggestions and their best sellers. Their menu is so BIG. We just went with what was suggested. Some of their maki rolls were not traditional but they were very good. I enjoyed my meal as did the rest of my party. Highly suggest this place if are out late and are craving Japanese cuisine. Also they have unlimited passion fruit ice tea!!  Would I return to the place? Most definitely. This place exceeded expectations

1t7-vVQWTrx3qRYgflM1UQ.text: You must try the Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna. Very fresh. Also they have a great happy hour on weekdays.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kanojo Roll &amp; Spicy Spicy Tataki Roll

WeG81HSVgVNwUyaCTIdWPA.text: Best place to go if you want to get sushi at 3am with good friends. So fun. Friendly staff and such a fun experience!

JUcu0yDPTAGkMne2P_M_qg.text: I am staying at the Hard Rock hotel so the walk is not bad at all, it's right across the street so it is convenient. The place is really nice and cute with modern decor. The service was really good and everyone was really polite and friendly. I ordered the Kai roll and BBQ short ribs, which was really good. I would definitely recommend this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kai roll.

s2SLgrdRp3J_NzhhGuCWQQ.text: Great service everything is amazing and the food is great  Kate serve us with a lot of love

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon killer and Salsa Dancing

DkxRta3THrmke4JaemM5-g.text: Awesome spot to get late night sushi off the strip! My large and rowdy group of friends rolled in around 2:30am with late night sushi cravings. Sorry we were so loud! Wait staff was great in accommodating this very rude group of friends. If your friends yell very loud inappropriate sexual things that may or may not disturb the other diners, this place will still not kick you out! Believe me, they are great!   Do not under any circumstances order the baked scallops or some roll with jalapenos on top of it! Both my friends said those two items were gross. However, the roll I ordered that has ponzu sauce on it was delicious and I heard the Poke is phenomenal so could be hit or miss. The menu has excellent pictures so you can use your best judgement to make the right decision. Although, making right decisions and being in Las Vegas usually don't go together.

ekwaFIb7TjYWk-NCyocz6A.text: This is my favorite sushi place, but they do not have ayce.  It's also great that they open until 6AM on weekend.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  I go here one a week and staff know us as I walk in.  Sushi are always fresh.  I try some dishes from the kitchen and it's all good too.  You Can't go wrong with anything you order on the menu.

O-XL9otEMlvLriSJ6wZShw.text: Great food. Great Service. A nice "off-the-strip" option. The super reasonable prices almost made me forget that I was in Las Vegas! Also, I was there around 10pm. They have a reverse Happy Hour that offered 2 for 1 drinks. I'll definitely go here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

kbIeosMPEFCzu9e9JCrCpQ.text: Yummy sushi.  I love coming back here everytime I am in Vegas!  The Baked Mussels for Appetizers are delicious.  Will order again when we come back.  Everything you order here takes great and the service is fast and very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Fusion Sushi

TNBThzDM8B7t6cU7kzSzTg.text: Heard It was great and we were not that impressed. I'm not one to write negative, but I'm sorry our rolls were a bit fishy. This place came highly recommended so maybe It was an off night.

p1xQKvJ5YwsjSdWFHFhObg.text: Stopped thru for late nite craving and was pleasantly surprised. This place is quaint, chill, and the service was on point, very attentive.  Sampled several of the rolls (had the "baked Lasagne" to finish the meal. I was thankful The fish was fresh and decent prices comparable any respectable establishment. I'd recommend if your on this side of town.. I believe they have ayce, but not sure, nice set up w televisions and bar special was half price beer.

-iGpJOJrmShQdIFLNgrGXA.text: I came to Las Vegas during the SEMA convention, and I been coming here to eat every day! The food is amazing! The atmosphere is very nice as well! I highly recommend coming here to eat!  yummyy

jUHKvhxQJW67o0t7wEgUGA.text: This is one of my FAVORITE Sushi spots here in Vegas!! The very 1st day I flew into Vegas, my roommate Jef brought me to the Kaizen in Henderson and I automatically fell in love!  Kaizen is a very great sushi spot especially for one of the best HAPPY HOUR spots to go to after 12am-4am when your hungry and drunk! Can't beat a buy1get1 for Beer and Sake and $2 Hand Rolls!!  Workers: Very friendly staff and theyre always down to drink with you especially the chefs!! They always make sure you have a great time!  Menu: Its SUSHI!! Its a bit pricey but its worth! Try it and let me know! "First Kiss Roll" is my favorite Special Roll on that menu.. Pretty much everything on the menu is a great pick and I always bring all my out of towners to this spot and they always ask me to take them back again!  Location: Right across of Hard Rock Hotel and down the street from the Macarran Airport! Cant ask for any better. Better than it being off the strip than on the strip or in a high end Casino!  Check it out!!

ALQruLrwytw4shckjG7lUA.text: We ALWAYS come to this sushi place when we are in Vegas.  NEVER a disappointment.  Service is great and they will fabricate any type of roll you want, just tell them what your tummy desires.  =)

o_0LR5pb9a6GnBsxSh-WEg.text: Best sushi in the world!!!!! Now my favorite and it makes you happy because it's so cool inside! EAT HERE!!!!

CoGdTUYCCRFCngvhafKVNw.text: Great off strip restaurant... Decent prices with good saki selection... Sushi was good

lcSvCFEV405u-7Csd4OCAQ.text: The decor inside was very nice. When you stepped inside, everyone welcomed you even the chefs. You can hear music  playing along with the music video displaying on one of their walls.   The waiter did not sat us down. He just went off and lay down the menus without even a heads up that it was our table. Seems like he really wanted us to leave, since he came by every minute to ask if we were ready. When we were finally ready to order, the waiter was glancing out the door and was waiting for other customers, which was so rude. One of the workers had to personally go up to the waiter and tell him that we wanted to order. Never experience this kind of situation in my life but it is what it is.   The food tasted great. If you order stuff that is not in the menu book, the portion is quite big. The busser would always come by and refill our drinks, which was very nice of him.   When more customers come in, the waiter paid even less attention to us. One of us had to stand up and get him so we can have the same attention as others.  Overall I like their food, but seriously the service is horrible.

tBZaPN0-zcFHYcA29plu0Q.text: this place is awesome! i'm always satisfied to find pretty good sushi for good prices, so that i found here ridiculously yummy, beautifully prepared sushi for very reasonable prices, i was totally stoked.   whatever you do, order the Avocado Train, i think it's called - it will break your heart. the yellowtail with jalapeno is perfection, and the grilled ika is scrumptious!!   i'll be back every time i visit vegas ...

KEYL9iWKIju8afyseGXJKQ.text: The food was delicious! The fish is very fresh and the service was excellent. The atmosphere was comfortable and we were seated pretty quickly, there were so many choices to choose from and they all tasted very good, the price isn't that bad either!

7cTMNJoL-JGjvNmgJDkFQQ.text: I know everyone 'loves' Kaizen, but I've been here a few times (7-8) and I've never really loved it.  The eastern location is better though bc they do have the half price sushi but still.  Their sushi is high priced, and they dont have all you can eat, so you end up spending a fortune.  The few good things I've had were the jalapeno roll, which was actually really good, but I feel this place is more 'americanized' sushi which I hate.  I love authentic food, but this place is just ok.  I hate to give a less than spectacular rating, but I've never had a great meal from here.  If you come here for late night sushi, hit up musashi! Its down the road on paradise and way better! They have happy hour EVERY night from 11pm-3am.    The service has always been good, but the food is just ok to me.

L2Y21gge_Vh-ULPhBtshFw.text: Hands down an awesome sushi bar! We were staying at the Hard Rock Hotel and saw this place across the street. Boy are we glad we tried it. The menu was a bit overwhelming since it was our first time there. The server was very nice and great service. She made a few suggestions and they were so good! Their prices are typical of sushi places. Anywhere from $10 and up per roll.   We tried a baked scallop roll that was full of scallops. The don't skimp on their ingredients and I love that. I tired a lobster and crab roll wrapped in halibut...FRESH! We also tried their banana roll. Different because it was slightly sweet and savory.   I love the fact that there are real Japanese people working there and making sushi. Maybe it makes it feel more authentic. You just feel like you get the whole experience versus a Mexican guy making the sushi for you. Even though he probably has no problems making delicious sushi.

5oSqymaEsBY5Bl5ENe4xcA.text: Quite possibly the worst sushi we have EVER eaten.The fish wasn't fresh.it was overpriced and amateur.if you wanna call yourself a sushi restaurant....Learn how to make sushi.And if you can't afford to keep fresh fish in the house.....don't call yourself sushi chefs.Also.I Ordered the seared beef tataki....It came out ice cold.GROSS food.Save your time and your money.This place should shut the doors before they give someone food poisoning.Word to the wise...they order cheap ahi that is not sushi grade and they use it for sushi.Please bring a roll of toilet paper.Your gonna need it when your colon explodes on your ride home. Don't eat at this joint.seriously.Unless you have an extra three days to spend running to the bathroom......

hYtslXj5CqUfzs51R_stOg.text: By far the worst sushi restaurant I've ever been too...  My friends and I love sushi so it wasn't a surprise that we came here considering it was right next to our hotel. We got seated really fast and we were kinda excited about the menu since there was a lot of variety. My boyfriend and I ordered 2 rolls since we usually get that amount of rolls at other sushi restaurants thinking it will fill us up. Once my friends and I got our sushi, we were pissed off because the sushi had like 4-6 rolls. We just looked at each other like are you freakin' serious? I had to order another sushi roll because it obviously did not fill me up. When we got our check, it was about $105 since it included gratuity already. My friends and I ended up putting $120 instead of $105 since none of us had change. So we're waiting..and...waiting for our change. The workers during that time were giving us dirty looks cause we were still there and probably wanted to clean our table. So it finally hit us, where the fuck is our change? We asked the lady if we can get our change back and she gave us a dirty look. That bitch thought that extra $15 of our "change" was her damn tip. Like really? The tip that was on the receipt was already $15. So this restaurant tried to get a $30 tip from my friends and I when there was only 6 of us. Really? $5 tip from each person when the food didn't even fill us up? Shake my head at those workers man.

1DV8_Qd6uc10OObcLZogXA.text: This is my go-to spot whenever I'm out on the strip and craving sushi.  It may not be the most authentic place, but the food is fresh and tasty, service is good, and the prices are extremely reasonable.  The atmosphere is casual and they always have good music playing.  The best part about this place is the fact that they're open really late.  I've been here multiple times and never been disappointed.  Whether it's 7 pm, 12 am, or 5 am, Kaizen is always a good choice.

7CNxA-eMV1bMrjK-_QvsUw.text: I don't normally write reviews but this is the best sushi that I've had in years.  Try one of the restaurant's special rolls.

LTc_S9DBPVziNZ4Jasac-Q.text: It's really hard to find a great sushi place that's consistent. I purchased a Groupon for this place since it was close by my house. I took a friend for lunch and we were told we don't get the special lunch prices if we use a Groupon. So in the end, it really didn't save us any money. Regardless of that, we were one of two parties there during that time and our rolls were delivered far apart. Plus, all of the rolls were so-so. I wouldn't go again.

toZg6AN6cqRaoIgntBxdsw.text: 2 for 1 happy hour from midnight to 4am Sunday to Thursday is great!  Prices are a little higher than I had hoped but they made up for it with the portions there.  Easily the best late night sushi place I've been to in Vegas and I plan on going back soon.  Its closer than "I Love Sushi" in Henderson which is my fav so I will just come here when I can't schlep it all the way over there.

7GGFIwI193Sj-Hgan4fgww.text: The first kiss roll is one of the best sushi rolls I have ever had in my life. The spicy tuna crispy rice is really good too

AtmtKTDHFOFRyg58EPALgw.text: Sushi at 3:30am!  No, it's not a typo.  This place is actually open until 4am on a Monday night.  And it's the only place any of the bartenders, waitstaff, hosts, taxi drivers, and security guards at Wynn, TI, The Venetian, or Fashion Show mall knew about....  so I'll go ahead and declare this the latest-open sushi place I've ever been to on this continent.  (If you know of anything open later in Norcal, DC, or LV, message me.)  The taxi ride here from the strip was all of like $7.  Of course we spent more than that, because we first tried Tao for sushi, but it was closed.  Then Social House - closed.  Then Ra: cerrado.  Then Hamada: shut, barely.  Then here, after burning a few hundred walking calories and a yuppie food stamp on the taxi.  Once we got here, the staff was very friendly and welcoming.  And the place was actually about a quarter full - with the younger party-looking set.  No one raving drunk though.  The nigiri was a bit more expensive than that would've-been-$7 taxi ride per pair but not exorbitant for Vegas.  Not the cheapest or best I've had, but the salmon, yellowtail, and white tuna nigiri were all fresh enough and they did have some delicious, albeit very thinly sliced toro ($19/pair), again at 3am.  I mean if someone can satisfy my sushi craving at 3am on a Monday night making the fish taste good is gravy.  They also had some white tuna that is the "pure white" type we geigens love and large bottles of Kirin.  And we couldn't help but notice a group of 4 at the bar doing sake bombs dominoes style (which the undergrad in me says looked pretty cool I must admit).    I doubt 3am sake bombs are even legal in Cali.  Along with most other things in this town.  Viva Las Vegas.

mDKMRApE3oAD-AFc30Cw5g.text: 4.5 STARS  I WISH there was a place like this in LA: what can be better than late-night sushi?!? We always make sure to visit Kaizen when in Vegas...  The Lowdown:  - HAPPY HOUR starts at midnight (!!!) Prior to midnight this place might be empty, and it sometimes begins to fill up late on weekdays.   - FOOD - High quality ingredients. Albacore & salmon sushi melt in your mouth. Actually, everything we've tried is delicious. The shishito pepper appetizer didn't disappoint (a personal favorite, which I often use to help gage the overall quality at sushi joints). I'd say this place is comparable to ever popular Katsu-Ya in LA.  - HUGE MENU It takes a while to peruse the entire menu and get a feel for the many specialty rolls - there's something for everyone.  - LOCATION I like the fact that this is an off-strip, "locals' favorite" type of place.  Very cool, un-touristy crowd.  - PRICES Its surprising to know that so many people think this place is expensive. Haven't you noticed that EVERYTHING in Vegas is expensive?!? In terms of sushi prices I'd say this joint is average, and the Happy Hour prices are a real bargain!  * WARNING * CHECK YOUR BILL! I'm docking half a point because the last time we were here they "forgot" to charge us Happy Hour prices, and gave us a bill with regular prices instead. NOT cool. Of course they fixed it when we spoke up, but if not for this incident Kaizen would be nearly perfect  :(

8dkp056c6EtzrhP8Teu5AQ.text: Ate here last night. It was pretty good. I had the spicy tuna crispy rice, the fire cracker roll, and the Crispy soft shell crab appetizer. The spicy tuna crispy rice was very good. and the firecracker roll was great as well. I wasnt a big fan of the crispy soft shell crab. I usually am, but this one had a pretty heavy batter on it much like the cheap frozen breaded shimp you can buy at the grocery store. Overall it was pretty good, and the staff was very friendly. They were out of large Sapporos, so they brought me 2 small ones...at the same time...I probably looked like a lush double fisting it in a sushi bar, but I dont mind that. :) The menu had alot of very interesting and different combinations of sushi that I'll have to go back and try sometime. I'd recommend it if you are looking for a semi-modern take on sushi.  PS. I went to the one off of Eastern and Horizon ridge...not the one by on Paradise.

aYQqqPHYciFkdBECgyJglg.text: Nope, not buying it... Non japanese sushi joint with large screen tv playing hip hop music video... Why???? Nice interior though. I usually don't like to give negative reviews... but this wasn't my place (sorry).

ubZAsFR11Ynohxwp51DdHg.text: Good sushi spot in Vegas with some innovative rolls. The restaurant has a good vibe away from the strip

4rdisKaj8q8EXcaCGp3LeA.text: This sushi place is amazing! The servers are very attentive & friendly. Cold drinks & tasty sushi rolls; what more could you ask for?!

vRqdS40E_egCxX8LhI3Ubw.text: We're in Vegas for a volleyball tournament at UNLV and chances upon Kaizen and WOW!! what a find! The salmon nigiri was excellent.  Crispy rice was delicious along with great hand rolls. :) Great atmosphere!

nJG_pWqaCTzta_yOAip-HA.text: Love the late hours and amazing menu! The Rose role and crab salad has it in along with the amazing sake selections

hPyesVOlWV9om4skwCitmQ.text: This is my first time eating sushi. Absolutely wonderful experience. Great service and very prompt. The location is close to UNLV. Must try and I plan to come again! I recommend the KAI rolls

Ntoxy0x4uLoWO3pWk3l9ig.text: After wandering around the strip seeing many Pokemon and other characters like a fat guy in a bikini, I really needed something to cleanse my palette. A friend recommended this place.  My group started with the grilled ika which came with a spicy sauce and this awesome scallop mushroom app that was in a cream sauce topped with a charred cheese - do delicious, I just wish I had some to scoop the extra sauce. Then we had a few roll by then the scarring that occurred from the fat bikini was gone. But we stayed for dessert - fried tempura cheesecake and deep fried ice cream.

7NwpNZA-a6o33jSkiFgHSw.text: First, I have to thank Mary P. for this suggestion.  Actually, she suggested the location in North Las Vegas. But still glad I came here.   I was staying at the Hard Rock and wanted some sushi. Had Hamada's 2 nights prior (see review) and it was horrible. Had to redeem myself.  Service:  Tons of staff to the point that you will always have someone at your needs.  Good job Team Kaizen.  Now for the food.  Tried their Spicy Tuna, Chicken Katsu w/Brown Rice, Baked Salmon,and Caterpillar Roll.  All were tasty, fresh, not fishy, and made to order. My co-worker had a special roll created exactly how he wanted it.  Always good when they can improvise.   Can't wait to try the location in North Las Vegas.  Only issue with this place is that they lack AYCE. But they stated they were better than the north location.  We'll see, I will be the judge

hNdOEUexiyx5juFAdMhmPA.text: Terrible food, fish not fresh and the manager was our waiter.... He was very rude and unprofessional. Didn't try to help us at all! I asked for the manager again because I didn't believe it was him and the same guy came, talking about how he is the manager, the CEO, and the owner.... Who talks like that? All I wanted was a roll off my bill, he bargained with me asked if I wanted 50% off of one of the rolls.... And than didn't give me the discount!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Terrible service, fish not fresh, the manager is the waiter the CEO and the owner.... I will never come back again

d8i-T2mQptqacydcqJJP2Q.text: Happy hour is awsome here on weekdays !!!  They open late till 4am !!!  Good place to come eat sushi and hangout with friends !!!

H_Jpreot3CteWF3fUIyHyw.text: I absolutely love this sushi restaurant! I have eaten at Nobu , Katsuya, and Koi. This place is definitely the same quality of food and service is great! It's my second time here and everytime I come to Vegas from now on I'll definitely be stopping in. I ordered the spicy yellowtail roll and the crunch scallop it was delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oOxqsXjpbEF2QtabsMHhmQ.text: I wish I could say that I was drunk and stumbled upon this sushi joint... but instead, I came here to grab a take-out lunch while I was staying at the Hyatt Hotel supervising a group of tourists to a trip to Vegas.  It would have made it much more entertaining if I did.  In any case, Kaizen Sushi is not a bad place to get your sushi fixing in Vegas.  They specialize in fusion rolls, so right off the bat, you know that you should focus more so on them instead of simply nigiri or sashimi.  The atmosphere inside reminded me of a very fancy bar, both very dark and roomy.  They have a pretty sweet deal for those night owls (or those trying to be) where much of their food becomes half off.  Considering that this place is open late, this place is definitely for those post-clubbing events.  For my mini lunch, I ordered the Calamari Tempura Roll, which came out to be about $8.  I love eating fried squid, and was interested in seeing their take on combining it into a sick sushi roll.  What I really loved about this roll was that even though it came in only five pieces, they gave me the extra calamari on the side.  It also came with a sweet dipping sauce.  My roll was okay.  Nothing to rave about to be honest, but it was a good way for me to get my sushi fixing for the day.  Everything else on the menu seems to be way overpriced, especially in Vegas when there are so many other eating bargains out there.  Definitely worth a try, but go ahead and gamble at Hard Rock and make some moolah first before you come here.  Then you can fest like a KING/QUEEN!  Parking is available outside in the plaza.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari Tempura Roll (Take Out Edition)

SZBzM_ZOykSMeGnYhdeJ5g.text: Really enjoyed this late night sushi place and after 5 hours of playing blackjack I was grateful to find a decent sushi place open after 2am.  All the other late night sushi places seem to close at 2.  Sat down at the bar, at 3:10am the place was surprisingly seated with about 10 other late night eaters. I ordered 2 rolls: King of Ocean Roll (topped with lobster, shrimp, tangy sauce and contained avacodo, asparagus, cucumber) & Sunrise Roll (salmon,avacodo on top, with spicy tuna inside and ponzu sauce).  The food was satisfying and tasted fresh, moreover very satisfying.  Service was friendly and prompt, 2 young Japanese sushi chefs working at the bar preparing the sushi.  Waitresses were young and cute, overall a very satisfying experience and exactly what I was hoping for.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Late night sushi chefs
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sunrise Roll $12.95
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The King of Ocean Roll $13.95

7pqurBCMC38kQ1OpMzpCng.text: I eat here often For the past 9 years actually The sushi lasagna is incredible and a must! Soy paper!!!

m_6_LYqdPPophM_ntsf2jA.text: The environment is good, looks fancy. And they have pretty good food here, vegetable tempura roll tastes awesome! BTW, the server Michael is awesome, FYI. LoL great place for hanging out with your bf and gf. Check it out.

r05dhE0LaAYue9N6VVpF5w.text: The last time I was in Vegas this was the last place I  ate before my flight. It was delicious!  Best sushi I ever had the avocado train is amazing!!  I went home and craved this place for weeks.  I loved there fresh ginger not the cheap pink ginger that most sushi places use.  all there rolls are pretty amazing and at a great price for Vegas.   I just flew in for another convention and this is the first place I stopped. I think the service was great the sushi was Fresh and location is great right next to CVS for me to pick up some stuff before I get to the over priced hotels. I'll definitely be eating here a couple more times before I fly back home.

VbeX8YIyfLuuxNI7HsIsDA.text: Very delicious food!! Try the garlic edamame ! Great ambiance and friendly staff! This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in Vegas!!!

l8DqXKcrYLvtWiJ5u66sjA.text: My wife and I were their by chance. The Korean BBQ next door was closed for maintenance and we decided to grab a quick bite here. Suffice to say, we ordered Uni and it was the worst mistake we could have made. It was spoiled!! I immediately spit mine out in my napkin and my wife ended up swallowing hers out of respect and embarrassment of not making a scene. I feel very bad for her and upset with this establishment. They should have known better than to serve rotten Uni. Uni is best within three days. Their Uni must have been over a week old judging by the  texture, smell, and horrible taste from being spoiled. Well the next day my wife started feeling sick and her condition has gotten worse as the day progressed. Fever, vomit, and so on without embarrassing her more. The worst part is we were on vacation and the last day of our trip she got sick. She hasn't been able to eat all day.  I hope she gets better soon. They comped only the rotten Uni. They should have comped our whole meal and then some for what they are putting my poor wife through.

3PeA_RHnc7oco92FnoaIOw.text: Good sushi spot close to the strip but not directly on the strip. Prices are much better than on the strip. Very cute decor and clean. We came on a Thursday night and it was not busy. We were seated immediately and got our food quickly. We ordered miso soup, edamame, teriyaki bowl and two tempura rolls. The food was fresh and tasted great. We will come here again the next time we're in Vegas.

0XPyx8hBUgUOhW5pAU3zRg.text: Service and sushi outstanding. We thoroughly enjoyed everything about the place. I would recommend this to a friend. Clientele were enjoying the sushi bar as well

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vu8JFPmPwraK3Y2bKWql-A.text: If you are going here expecting a 4 star restaurant such as Nobu, you will be disappointed. As a regular sushi eater, this place does not make the cut.

4iEnrDLS2xga7s48XJbGYw.text: Great place & very friendly service, I highly recommend this place. Love the rainbow roll and spicy garlic edamame.

IaOTXjHTK4abOovl5u19gQ.text: Their sushi was AMAZING! I live here in Vegas didn't even know this place existed. Great food HORRIBLE, RUDE SERVICE which makes me not want to go back.. Whet in a week ago about an hour before closing with a party of 6 our waitress IRENE gave us the worst service from the beginning even though she had an auto gratity already added to our check. Half of us at the table work in the industr and couldn't believe her attitude (rolling her eyes after asking questions in regards to the menu,etc.) I would definitely request a DIFFERENT SERVER if i ever went back.  She ruined our 1st time experience there!

_28nIbXeDRBSdu1vcdb9vw.text: Nice atmosphere, service, and food. Not too far off the strip to save a little $$$. Great for lunch. Try the Kiss of Fire if you are into spicy rolls. Our servers were very attentive and brought our food promptly. You can't go wrong especially if you are staying in Hard Rock.

yKwZ8IIstuDEfpGyo7hLTw.text: Rolld here are super good and service was great! They had shishito peppers and chili oil which not a lot of sushi restaurants have nowadays. We came here late after a night out and they were open until 3am :).

rfjbfNJb3KwoJoQcrt5TdQ.text: In a city of overpriced oversized greasy meals I am always happy to find some sushi. Great ahi poke, farmed salmon :(  Decent variety of rolls. Kinda pricey but I should expect as much since its Vegas and I'm from Vancouver!

qkMTCxUUXFMlTiGUxTeywg.text: Nope. The sushi rice wasn't cooked properly. I admit I am an idiot for ordering uni but it came out a little darker of a color than typical and it didn't taste quite what I am used to. Maybe not 100% fresh. Edible not enjoyable. They were nice enough to take it back though. Not what I am used to very under par.  Maybe you need to get wildly intoxicated. Terrible place. The worst sushi I've ever had.

4wRBWxlZizmMQdVY0R3cGw.text: Fast service and delicious sushi! Staying at the Hard Rock and this is conveniently located across the street! Plus its open til 6am on a Sunday!!!

GKqh4Aef6KP4mNcCHl9qqw.text: I haven't been to this place in a couple years and I forgot how great their food is! Artistic rolls with lots of variety. A must

qcCnhhVQIiEIsT8KZZ6PxQ.text: I came here for a pre-birthday celebration. The service was great and the rolls were fabulous!  We came back the next day because we enjoyed the rolls so much! Definitely coming back whenever Im in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5r7Ab-P9DhEaR2UTdNhscg.text: I come to this place at least twice a month on late Saturday night because it opens until 6 A.M. on weekends. This place is not AYCE but that's because they offer high quality sushi. I like to get the Unagi Bowl and Miso Soup if I'm trying to get something quick to eat. The presentation of the Unagi Bowl is great and it taste absolutely delicious. My favorite roll here is the Rattle Snake Roll and I get it every time I go. I recommend the Salmon Skin Hand Roll or the Philadelphia Hand Roll, bare in mind that their hand rolls are pretty large! They also offer extremely fresh nigiri and they always have a special fresh fish for the day so be sure to ask! When they have special fishes for the day, they are indeed special because I cannot find some of these fishes at any other sushi restaurants. The Hamachi Kama is also a must, it's perfectly seasoned and grilled and it practically melts in your mouth. They are getting ready for a new location at the Linq so they have been training new waiters so be patient if you get one of the new ones! The sushi chefs are also amazing and have fun personalities if you're sitting at the bar. They like to drink, dance and sing while making sushi! Note, this place is a bit pricy because of the quality but it's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giant Clam
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Belly
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rattle Snake

HDVZUWDzfSJu-QzNIHUJ4w.text: Last meal in Vegas before heading back to LA. Kaizen was really close to our hotel and on the way to the freeway.   It wasn't very busy when we got there so we were seated and served right away. We ordered the sashimi lunch combination, the first kiss roll, and the tokyo roll. The server said she accidentally poured two soups instead of one (claiming that the lunch special comes with one soup). She scored brownie points with that move.   The sashimi combination was alright. The slices of fish were decent. Not the Best sashimi I've ever had but it hit the spot.  The first kiss roll was pretty scrumptious. Not entirely sure what sauce it's served on top of but it was absolutely delightful.   The Tokyo roll looked scary. I've never seen a raw fish roll look so slimy before. But the server Shima informed us that there was a mustard ponzu dressing on top of it. Me and my boyfriend only ate half of the roll trying to stomach the unusual slime but the waitress insisted that she still discount the roll from the bill.  To make up for the Tokyo roll, our server brought out a deep fried green tea ice cream covered with whipped cream, cherry and drizzles with chocolate sauce. Never having tried this concoction, we were pleasantly surprised with such a treat. Thanks Shima!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. deep fried green tea ice cream!

Z6cihIsmXPU3eMDRxkgHUQ.text: Kaizen sits across from the Hard rock hotel nestled in the corner of the CVS plaza. Between Capriotti's and Ferraro's Italian.   Here is the breakdown according to me. It's in my area.. it's slightly over-priced sushi.. and the service is sometimes good, sometimes they forget things.. lol.. what do you want from a place that is often pumping until 5 am.   We head over there for a late night sushi fix, and most importantly.. the 2 for 1 .. ANYTHING from the bar.. after midnight. Usually that equals cheap sake and beer.. but it does the trick for cheap. Also I always see Carrot top there.. which is good or bad? You tell me.. it just is :]   You can find me there on any given evening with a crew or just me and one of my foodie buddies.. mostly for me it's about the liquor and the broiled yellow tail fish collar. Yes... you read that right. if you don't know, now you know.. check it out. It's not that you can't get fish collar at other Asian style eateries, but this one is close by so I'm there most :)  Happy Eating!

odmNWgb3pUhz8rCRJ0JW8Q.text: Good service, I like chicken Katsu. Green tea ice cream and red bean ice cream is good. Fast service.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A9zraugThOZo6Ve_5tz32A.text: So we're in town and we think of w place to go to sushi at 4:21 am and where else but kaizen on the strip it's a chill atmosphere and our lyft drivers name was dyker and he was super chill. He go us here safe and did I mention he was chill.

5XemWNh8m15N7XtBIJ-CwQ.text: I've eaten quite a lot of sushi all around the country, but this was NOT good sushi.  It wasn't awful.  But it was about as good as the sushi you might get pre-made from a grocery store.  "Mediocre" is the best I could possibly rate it.     The decor in the restaurant was beautiful; a lot nicer than I would have expected for a strip mall restaurant.  And the service was fine.  But the menus were that cheap laminated stuff you find in low-end Chinese restaurants, with poorly lit photos of the rolls.  And the descriptions were all so formulaic:  Inside - tuna avocado, on top - shrimp, sauce - ponzu.   They all read like that so that none of them stood out to you.  They all sounded pretty much the same.  But most importantly, of the 4 rolls we ordered, none were outstanding.  They were all just blah with a slightly fishy taste to the sushi.  I would NOT go here again and I would certainly not recommend it to anyone. We should have spent the extra $$ and gone across the street to Nobu (in the Hard Rock) for some seriously amazing sushi.

1Z14ohBIn6ciukiFoDd6KQ.text: We ate here on Sunday night after a hard work day at JCK. I loved how I could pick anything I wanted from there enormous menu. I got the spicy tuna salad for which have tuna poke and seaweed salad along with an actual salad below and there amazing dressing. Worth it. Then I tried special roll which was great and it had shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, and yellowtail on top. Then I ordered just a basic spicy tuna roll and added cream cheese as  you can do that here. To top it off I have the mochi ice cream which is great! The only reason why this restaurant did not get 5 star is because the service was piss poor. Get more servers as a Sunday night, off the strip with great priced sushi is gonna be busy. Go here if you want some good sushi! :)

warWK4YYSyJAnL-3WCOfsQ.text: A great lunch spot, conveniently located on Paradise Road, across from the Hard Rock Hotel.   Great food, friendly staff and good prices. The sushi is fresh and he lunch specials are a great value.   Highly recommended!

bzV1iNQxS-Q-bNyL8BlqPA.text: Had Korean BBQ bento box at lunch it was awesome. The miso soup was tasty, salad crisp dressing was killer and the BBq was as tender as filet mignon, cut it with a fork (yes I used a Fork). Portions were large as well. Service was excellent and very friendly. Korean BBQ is one of my favorites, I've eaten it all over the world including Korea and I've never had better.

EWqFwSDzFdPeRk0ExtSxTg.text: Overall, great food and atmosphere! The tempura green tea ice cream was worth every calorie! The customer service also exceeded my expectations.

CMHwrsvMzBStq8fuZiIwxA.text: I loved this place! This was my first time out for sushi - one of my friends loves sushi so I decided to go. I'll be coming back. There were so many  choices and the decor was super cute! Very yummy!

-HTurBxT7Pm8P3KPACv9eg.text: We went here one night very late.... though it's more expensive than other sushi restaurants we like here in vegas it was delicious. We indulged in a couple bottles of sake and had some of their rolls and sashimi. This place is a classier atmosphere, definitely a good place to bring a date. But as far as pigging out on Sushi... I wouldn't go too hungry unless you want to get a big bill.

fRnTmVNth8OENs8Tz95RAQ.text: The general consensus was that the food was ok with the exception with a few items that was better.  They were very accommodating to the 14 girls we had.  The biggest complaint I have is that the rice fell apart in my rolls.

o3-qwYtR6so5d-ysaN1oEw.text: This place is the worst.  I saw a cockroach running out of the kitchen and i don't blame him.  Same old strip mall sushi you can find on any streetcorner these days.

ItDXGjFoojkN5xjfElLQ2Q.text: Wasn't really in the mood for sushi after a long week in Vegas working a trade show, but my pal saw Kaizen in Yelp, and insisted we go. Quiet at 8ish on a Wed. evening (thankfully; woulda had NO patience for a loud party scene that night). The drinks were great and the food was remarkable--fresh, beautifully presented, unusual combinations--all delish. I will definitely return!

W4uWyDg51jvjG71MBKNM1g.text: my husband and i are complete sushi lovers.  it's not too often we absolutely love a sushi place, but Kaizen Fusion is great!  the environment is trendy with top 40 music videos playing on a large plazma tv.  the rolls are fresh and perfect for one-size bites.  our favorite was the "sexy roll" for spicy tuna lovers. price is reasonable (just a few that are $$), and the service is also friendly.    afterwards we walk down the street to Hard Rock for some gambling and drinks to end the night.

MI8bRyOUNPf3m47OF4VjcQ.text: eh. way too expensive for the mediocrity of the sushi. there are SO many better places to choose from.

j_ryALiNJw10dOb3fNkTmQ.text: Good place especially for groups.  Pretty solid sushi and although it's in a strip mall, I actually prefer it since the prices are reasonable and it's nice and low key.

gIH-qSQyHPtlBzI4to9MzA.text: I was so skeptical, as I am a total buffet girl when it comes to Vegas.  I've heard any other ethnic cuisine in Vegas is absolutely disgusting... but this place proved me incorrect.  The baked scallops in their sauce was so good.  No words can describe it.  We walked over (not a great idea, but we were hungry and didn't want to wait in the cab line) from Hard Rock after partying it up at Center Bar (awesome time too) and ate there at 4:30 in the morning.  I especially liked the cheers we got when we walked in, looking awesome I'm sure, after a night of excessive drinking and partying.  The place is a like a club that serves sushi.  There is a deejay spinning tunes and with the exception of the sushi bar, most of the restaurant is dark.  The food though, was absolutely fantastic.

ASVe1Uu5fYpeIO1nO1KE5A.text: Their sushi is nothing special and its rather over priced for what you get. The happy hour over at the Henderson location is better for getting drinks before hitting the club (10p-2a). The only thing this place has going for it is that it's open late.

NvmRjs4MfccyE7eFYmtyCw.text: I have been to this Kaizen (across from Hard Rock) 3 times and the one in Henderson once, and each time has been consistently wonderful!  My 3 favorite items are the spicy tuna rice crisp (2nd only to Katsu-ya in Studio City, LA, where I think this sushi originated), Korean BBQ Roll and Seared Wahoo Sushi (very rare to see this Hawaiian fish sushi anywhere).  The various  soju/sake martinis are great, the atmosphere is hip and relaxing, and this place opens until 4:00 am, 'nuff said!

5Gs5KbB4RcOTDjwO2ZtPxg.text: One of my favorite sushi places, for sure! Hands down, best Japanese lasagna roll I've ever eaten. I had it for the first time there and honestly, no where else compares. I took my friend there for the first time recently and she loved it. Not having had sushi much, I told her to look at the menu, read all the descriptions and pick something with the type(s) of fish she likes. She did and ordered the Alaska roll which she said was really good. They have a great menu and I love how it's decorated. My only complaint is that sometimes the service is a tad slow, but they really do try their best, and that is ok with me. A lady next to me this last time was completely rude to the server but he didn't get upset and was able to pretty much turn it around, which was awesome. I don't mind paying their prices for what I get.. I've never been disappointed!

onY_kg0MYNr-EBqJFRYSNg.text: I love this place. My favorite is the spicy tuna salad. It's like a spicy tuna roll in salad form, minus the rise. I also recommend the grilled peppers and their fancy rolls.

fGos0pMNoVyGhEC-scF04A.text: my cousins, friends, and i each ordered the two for one drink special and shared a couple large hot sakes. in addition to our drinks, we ordered the calamari roll, kalbi rib roll, crazy boy roll, and a tako appetizer that also had cucumbers and vinegar (i forget it's name). we thoroughly enjoyed our late night meal! i love how pieces of what is in the roll is also on the side, so you can tell what you are eating and enjoy more food! also, when we were ready for our bill, our waitress told us that we still had one more beer from the two for one special. she didn't have to do that!

iB0kXAYmUt2gKy1lIoNp6A.text: Hands down the best sushi place I've ever been to!!!! Although it is expensive I think you get what you pay for. I would recommend going with at least 3 or 4 people so you can try a bunch of rolls. The place is always busy which is good and they are open realllly late. My favorite roll is the jalapeno popper. Will be back soon.

bzPz6xw5JIScT6n5Ztthbw.text: sushi is a little expensive but I order the teriaki bowl for 10 bucks, and every roll is pretty damn good!

I3wIHc09AlQOZFqK7mWr_Q.text: If you love fusion rolls, this is the place.  Mind you I've only been here once during my trip to Vegas but it was definitely unforgettably delicious.  We only got rolls so I can't say much about their other food.  However, the maki (rolls) were very creative and well combined ingredients.  It isn't cheap but definitely worth the money IMO.    I would come back here next time I am in the Vegas area.

0Uo7h77EPa5hLlE_8KA7Qw.text: Great place to eat and enjoy one of the best sushi restaurants in vegas. I always make it a point to eat here at least once every trip. One of the best things about this place is that it's open so late. It is never too late for a snow-corn roll (my fav) or the always-great rainbow roll.  Also, the decor is pretty nice, as is the music. they have a live dj there and the service is always great.

BIpCDRY4BDHcZ0t8M0yhpA.text: I'm based in LA and have become a sushi snob.  I was in Vegas and craving sushi and thought I would take a chance at Kaizen b/c a local recommended the place to me.  My skepticism quickly disappeared - this place is amazing!!!  I continue to yearn for their seared ono - I have yet to find another restaurant who makes it as perfectly as they do.    This place is perfect for a date or a big group.  Highly recommend!!!

frW8IIWF3O6NU9B9u8U5wA.text: This place is awful. One roll cost almost $17 and was the same quality sushi you would get at Von's. You can get better sushi at a convenience store. Avoid this place.

YMgIxnU_lMp98A0-VTWg5w.text: For a hip sushi restaurant with very cool decor and most importantly DELICIOUS  food that won't break the bank, Kaizen is perfect!    Everything I've eaten there so far is soooo yummy~  They have your typical rolls but they've also got a great selection of different things too.  There's this crispy rice appetizer that's topped with spicy tuna a drop of hot sauce that is something so simple but great.  That's just one of many tasty treats there.  At the end of every meal though I've always got to finish with the tempura green tea ice cream. =D  I've brought my friends here and now it's a one of our regulars we always eat at.  Great food, ambience, service.....you can't go wrong!

-5MfDCI_cd25nl3NaY2tzw.text: If you're looking for sushi after hours...Kaizen is the place! Good service, clean & the BOMB sushi!! Thanks to the taxi man that took us here, if it wasn't for him I wouldn't of found this place. :)

3NWBuVB2rv_9XdUcpBIVgA.text: JUST LEFT Kaizen. Sat at Sushi bar with owner/chef Danny- Let him create me dinner. TOTALLY DISAPPOINTING. Charged me $162 for absolutly mediocre sushi...stay away from this RIP OFF place. NOBU across the street, might be just as expensive, but the fish would be fresh and taste much better. A total rip off- NEVER again. If you go, don't say you weren't warned. HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!

wj94iWbBaCqtg0RPxl61QQ.text: My bf and I were staying at the Hard Rock and we walked across the street to get lunch and saw this place and since we are hard core sushi lovers we gave it a try. Their menu is pretty big, they have a lot to choose from..My fav was the Las Vegas roll. I say if you are staying at Hard Rock and are in the mood for some good sushi go there.. prices are okay not too bad (compared to the bay area) lol...

oBJmMrtOhMA14HHIfOBX1w.text: if you want a great dinner and late night place for multiple occasions, definitely check out kaizen. i think they have multiple locations. i've been there a few times for get-togethers and bachelor parties. very reasonably priced, food is definitely good grubs! i recommend the grilled rice sushi roll, i don't know the name but it is delic...! also, the snowcorn roll is my favorite. ask for the raw wasabi, its off menu, great little accent to the norm. very convenient location.

2vCohATFnerRse5Cprpm3w.text: Love this place!! Go to for late night sushi and drinks!!! Showed up with a group of 7 and were easily accommodated. Will definitely be returning.

FJfl5qa4D8_Wm3Vqakwn2A.text: I love, love, love this sushi! I can't always dine in so it is good to know you can call in an order and pick it up, easy peesy! The food is fresh, the service is fantastic, and it is a great place to take people visiting Vegas!

rv5qz2aiAf1a77OdQRnaMw.text: This place has a nice atmosphere, very nice and clean and the waitresses are great. This place also has a great Happy Hour special and the Raspberry Sake is EXCELLENT!!!

qkyMqsDm2VtVEMCmf2rpqQ.text: Really great place for that late night sushi craving, good calm vibe and friendly staff.

MTbUR8VvlseZPbh5eMQstg.text: I'll be a regular customer ! Hands down some of the best I've ever had.. Crab salad was beautiful and tasted amazing! Service was excellent!  The avocado train and sunrise roll will be ordered again!! I can't write how good this shit was!

wgeOvOI2-ctgxIsCR5svEw.text: Great environment,fast service,foods are tasty, lots of choices. Sushi are delicious, I like it a lot. Must come back next time!

AI3WS9rAgjlOokjkcWezwQ.text: This place is located right across the street from HR hotel ( home of trendy Nobu). We come here when we have a larger group or a mixed group who like a wide range Japanese food. The fish is very fresh and some really good non traditional rolls for those who like them, The atmosphere is casual, the staff very friendly and the prices are reasonable.

5CwmMrAc0RYN_FnAyyRhKw.text: I was craving sushi during a business trip in Vegas, and feeling super jetlagged and exhausted i just wanted something quick for takeaway before passing out for the night. Kaizen got great reviews and was a quick drive from my hotel, so I called in an order and popped in. The food was okay, but not great. The sushi felt like it wasn't very fresh and it was completely warm by the time I got it home (to be fair, it was 100 degrees outside but the car ride was only 5 minutes and the AC was on... so I don't think that could have been the culprit!). Maybe eating in is a better bet for the future.

VPI292EKeQWxYH7ZzQQSeA.text: Love this place the food is awesome the sushi is so fresh, we watched then cut the fish.  Best sushi in Vegas by far.

yl9hlfZ42V9pP4HzKQ3MDQ.text: Great food... we stop by 3 time a year. We are from cali. Love Las vegas. I bring customer all the time from local to international all of them love the spot.

fYpAsbROqkklaMTfCOOo9g.text: A Very solid sushi experience. Nice variety of rolls and other traditional dishes on the menu. Fast and polite service. Not bad considering it's in Vegas.

K3Kv8Q-CLz8prsK4c04RYA.text: Food is is good, staff is friendly and helpful.  Raspberry sake is bomb good!!! One place I always stop in when in town

MyI2tYINZy86QKdqhncIhQ.text: Food is delicious and fresh here. The servers and host are friendly and young. Very cool urban pace and great food. If you are on a low carb diet try the rock and roll roll it's wrapped in cucumber and pretty delicious!

vfWR2HztCjaQvJBX85sMrg.text: Been back to Kaizen like three more times now and they never fail to impress me.  My favorite sushi place in Vegas.  Try the mussels.....they're great.

RRqtGmmFGGh7wsuhU4mImw.text: Great food with excellent atmosphere! Really recommend the spicy tuna roll. Love the music videos playing on the wall and the bench styled seating

y5s-6r-eN3JTE03Gb1onQw.text: Average sushi at best.  We ordered yellowtail appetizer, Kai roll, Salmon killer, and Kiss of Fire rolls.  Good but not remarkable.  Service was basic.  Recommendations were not anything more than pointing to a menu.  Even the recommended Chocolate truffle dessert was average.

kF7GUrzJqE0O-2356SmxhQ.text: Wow I love food and I had the blast here food was amazing the Korean bbq roll was just incredible very recommend I will visit again and soon

Yn4JjjD50bQ97VoHmjFWCw.text: Very nice sushi experience with reasonable prices for Vegas. Cute atmosphere for a casual date. Off the beaten trail but well worth it.

fiRjJx6gdx21urSnpEKNcA.text: I recommend the avocado train. It has lobster and soft shell crab. Has all my favorite things in sushi rolls in one!

WrSmCvvJRneDEjZ3eSzoAQ.text: This sushi is the best in Vegas! Awesome service. The freshest fish. We go here all the time.

ThU_OuFgajKqSiIqYnsBrQ.text: This is probably the best sushi that I have ever had. The baked tuna shoulder was amazing.

WCwSNgB-VxNN90Beqh3szQ.text: Nice atmosphere and very friendly staff. Robust menu with plenty of tasty options. I would recommend this to anyone staying close by!

K_00R5Pa7A6rW0sEUEoC1A.text: Fresh fish good service nice buzzy ambience at a fraction of the strip prices.  Amazingly broad selection of sushi rolls. Two thumbs up!

9jiVCYj4v3Ke8KsJf3HtOg.text: Absolutely yummy, a little overpriced really enjoyed the atmosphere, wasn't expecting it to look so fun from the outside. We will definitely be coming back! Service was super quick, we got our first two rolls in 5 minutes.

mc_LyEOYLDShoBSNjQ2vNw.text: Excellent flavors here, ordered a few rolls and wished we would've found this place earlier in our trip!  Try anything with eel, one of the best I've had.

SbIZBFHsDLShjnDXTC0pbA.text: Nice interior with good service, waitors and waitresses are the best thing in this restauran

-WzHj3z6EstqYbn11pMhNg.text: It is fresh, gorgeous, delicious food! Exceptionally friendly staff. Prices are a bonus. You get high quality food without paying Las Vegas Strip premium prices. On paradise across from the Hard Rock.   Order the Avocado Train! Yummmmmmm!

Hg_3gqh3kCaNlTbd1QIDmA.text: One of the best sushi places I've ever been to in the U.S. I was skeptical at first with reading some of these reviews. Im so glad I listened to my daughter and came. It was her birthday so her wish. We ate the Unicorn Roll, Orange Blossom, and the T something girls roll. Delicious!!! And highly recommended. We'll be back.

bfvUxXd5IQGU-rNiJnXtQg.text: Fast service and close to the fun! Large menu too With a number of exotic rolls and staples.

9suRU7gicvX-Q2R6l1_vDA.text: Just go. Just eat here. Sushi is delicious, the atmosphere is super lax, & the service is good.
