FWZNzyuPG5JcpF1xgynwzA.text: It was ok :/ and kinda felt rushed when ordering. Over priced to and no all you can eat

CdHcXzkuuuVFdh16cxAFNg.text: Urban warehouse ambience. Great selection of rolls, bowls, and plates. Tokyo roll had lots of fresh fish. Large variety of full types.

sU11wsiTYsVeamldXoV-Ew.text: Came here for lunch before leaving Vegas. The service was pretty fast and friendly. We ordered the miso soup, spicy tataki, salsa dancing roll, beef tataki, and the poke appetizer. All were pretty good, especially the poke.

N7C4AzljtNUlzNrDqQG6dw.text: Living in Seattle, I'm spoiled with fresh sushi. Who knew that I would find it in Vegas too?  There are a bunch of different rolls, each drool worthy and the prices are fair. If you're a big fan of mussels, their mussels are huge!!! I love it.  The decor is modern and very spacious. The restaurant is off the strip, but totally worth the trip out there.  Also opens until very late :) aka 4am... for all you party animals you.

5DHgvig-6VQ_yJtB4zsSmw.text: I came in around 230p on a Monday so the place was not busy.  Service was good.  The California roll broke too easily but the salmon, tuna and unagi sushi were decent.  Green tea ice cream was good.

d_EVFLKUjEwb0pC1ESsKwA.text: Tried the garlic edamame, sunrise roll, salsa dancing roll, and spicy tataki roll. All the fish was fresh and were good portions. However, the base sauce that they put on the plate can be a little over powering to the point that's all you taste. It's not a bad taste, but it can make the flavor of each roll blend together. We got the Bomba for dessert and it was great! One can be split between two people. Overall a good experience and would come back.

OoNUoQ_3mNbuKEsLXDshSA.text: Kaizen has a pretty big selection of rolls, and some quite different from other places in town. They also have a great spicy garlic edamame which was hot and fantastic! I would definitely like to try more of the rolls as I like the unusual ones. I would need a few more tries to see if I might become more of a regular here.

gWNTKsGpECwBlp0WhSo-Yg.text: Visiting Las Vegas from Canada and I really enjoyed the sushi that they had and their wonderful staff and service. Would definitely recommend.

mKReXcMTCw3e379PGNez-A.text: Kiss of Fire roll was not that great, but the service was prompt. Appreciated the late open hours. There probably are better options in town for sushi.

AQ2vHhnw8Z1GfFX14QE0bw.text: When I think sushi  in vegas I think Kaizen. Fresh fish, tangy ginger, and a standout staff. Couldn't ask for more!  The only downside was the temperature, it was rather chilly inside so bring your coats cause you'll probably  shiver.  Have fun during your Vegas getaway, and make sure to stop by!

b5OTLxvmmr9poQhVTqVgnQ.text: Tried this place thru Groupon since it was close to my work. Rice was undercooked and I had scale in the spicy Tuna roll. Overall, sushi and rolls weren't tasteful much.

vWN0Vf3v2BZ73CfIZQC8_Q.text: Went with some local friends while visiting Vegas. Did not look like much from the outside, but the interior is well done. Simple with an open feel. There is open seating in the middle of the room to utilize its space and to keep it from feeling crowded. Both the food and service were good. As noted by others it is open til 4 AM on most days which is a plus in Vegas. I was told by my friend that they have a DJ's performing during the late night.   Will likely return when in Vegas next.

fEnWdYQCKwRNas1Cq9yyVw.text: My favorite sushi here in Las Vegas! I'm not sure I have had anything I didn't like! And the one on Eastern has happy hour specials!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;O&#34; Roll
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eel
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi sampler

LS5mrkbsr1GIQaoaIOsXLA.text: I wasnt wild about this place. I have 3-4 different sushi dishes and none were great. All were pretty average and forgettable. I was also kinda blown out by the bar bill, so didn't leave me feeling like I will be back. There are many better places in town.

RbAkCSXUjF8aSbBF1DDrHA.text: 3.5  we were craving raw oysters.. again. gosh, what is it about Vegas that makes me crave oysters all the time!?  we stopped in for a light meal. we got a plate of sashimi ($20), a roll, and of course, oysters (5pc for $12).   the roll was just okay.. not to mention the spicy mayo was sweet (ew?) .. however! that plate of sashimi must have been one of the freshest and tastiest sashimi i've had. this was also my second time having yellowtail sashimi in vegas and i must say, Vegas gets shipped some darn good yellowtail. seeee ya tuna  our oysters were pretty good too but i like mine naked, how most oyster bars do them. Kaizen puts a little green onion, the orange eggs, and a ponzu sauce. still yummy and satisfying!  i'd definitely come back here again but only if im in the area for undftd/stussy or staying at the hard rock hotel.  also, come at night.. i think theyre popular for their sake specials during that time!

Gw96WnjpeAXK_gcHb95gyA.text: Great sushi...happy hour is great and staff is funny and friendly and let's the customers create their own sushi :)

o-QGNfLQ36FtR-UK5H1TFA.text: Walked across the street from HRH for a late lunch Feb 26th, and we're glad we did. Our favorite was the Spicy Rainbow Roll.  We enjoyed the hip music and videos that were on, too.

uIZJZByLXU_YNP0XuL9ViQ.text: I love this place!  We eat here every time we are in Vegas.  Reasonable priced, great selection, excellent rolls, and super friendly staff.  Have never been disappointed.  We will be back soon!

xW7f9G8AludFG3MidTJ9Pw.text: It is close to the hotel and convenient.  It fulfills food needs and in a tasty fashion.  But compared to other sushi places it is ok.  Let's leave it at that.

zSCNYwX5GW8-ovfAxXq-7A.text: Delicious sushi! I got the combo and couldn't finish it, and I've never been unable to finish sushi.

I6SvnGDanTwGmZUCCR6l5Q.text: I am blown away at how awesome they deliver with good food. The avocado train is amazing with the softshell crab the rainbow roll sexy roll, if you love sushi this is heaven on a plate!!

o9C3XOSV5gUU9eXZLwVshA.text: DELICIOIUS!  And they even have chopped fresh wasabi.     I got a roll and a bunch of nigiri, and everything was awesome.  Loves it.

HT_V1Ztj2ziSaxkY5FbB1g.text: This place is great. It was located right across from my hotel (Hard Rock). Everything I ordered was absolutely amazing. The rolls are a good size. The service is great. I loved the BBQ roll.

DGo93yuSIfoy0oz7AlBY1g.text: i can't believe i'd forgotten to review this place!  i was there last month and was so pleased by my meal here that i couldn't wait to yelp it.  but then i got distracted.  :/  it wasn't until a friend asked for vegas food recommendations that i remembered.    anyway, this place is SO good!  here are my top 5 reasons for saying that:    1.  it is open late... as ALL things should be in vegas, and sadly are not.   2.  it is very reasonably priced. 3.  the traditional sushi is great, but some of the more creative rolls are freakin' rad! 4.  the service is polite and attentive... even in the wee hours of the morning. 5.  it's not quite on the strip but not on the other side of the vegas world either.  my only sad is the it's not in LA.  certainly belongs on my must-eat-there list whenever i am in vegas now.

GgfUBRkSdFc3NJGuAHqCvg.text: Whack.   The food was decent, but nothing was that memorable.  I would've liked my salmon skin salad to be crispy.   The bad service overshadowed the experience there. The wait to get change for the bill must have taken over 15 minutes. It's not like my friends and I had a complicated bill either, we paid in cash.  The Mexican bar after the Indian restaurant next door is much better than this place.

D3hESdftKpNEcHH504K3Gg.text: if your a fan of sushi, but cant stand all the hoopla that comes with the vegas casinos, all you can eat buffet, and ridiculous prices. Then this place is for you.  The first and most important thing is the sushi was delicious! We had sashimi, different rolls, seaweed salad, the works.  the atmosphere is is very easy going, their's no rush to get you out, the servers are very friendly and helpful, and best of all its open until 4am on most weekend nights. Being from out of town and not being a fan of the vegas lime light. (I only go to vegas for work.)  this place is off the strip, across the street from the hard rock cafe/casino/hotel, in a corner shopping strip.  We asked our waitress (sarah) from Japonais inside the Mirage about a local place off the strip where locals go. She recommended this place.  HEY! Sarah great call thank you.  i understand there's more than one location, lucky vegas residents.  i will be back to vegas (unfortunately), but now i have a place for sushi were the real people can go.

Wd2vG6LURqZOsAhxDXt4mA.text: Ok so I am really torn. I came here for my bday party about 2 years ago, and actually had a great time, but came here last night and was really disappointed. The service was fucking terrible. If you read my other reviews you will see that I am a very forgiving/reasonable person. The host was just plain uninterested and our server could give a shit less. The funny thing is we sat at the bar and the place was not busy. I was blown away, but my friend and I were craving sushi after a couple of drinks, so we decided to go for it. We ordered a couple of beers and a couple of rolls, which were about 14$ a piece (kinda pricey) but really didnt care because I wanted to let loose. The rolls were really good; in fact we ordered about 5 more between the two of us. Ok, so here is the problem. 1.No interaction from the sushi chefs 2.The server had a piss poor attitude 3.I tried multiple times to get recommendations from server and chef with no luck....they just didn't give a shit. Ive come to a point were i am so sick of incompetent people,uninspired people (hence the reason most of us yelp so we can find no bullshit, highly recommended places to go). Well the unfortunate thing about kaizen is that they have the ability to be great, but the service is just non existent. If this was an instance in which only the sever sucked, I could probably blow it off. But no, this was the whole fucking operation. I will never come here again. I have never been so ignored or made to feel so insignificant at a restaurant in my whole life. I will give them 2 stars because the sushi was a sliver above average. Its a shame but the service was unacceptable. Oh and their prices just suck for what you get. Nothing but another glorified "sushi restaurant" in Vegas.

k9jTUvaj3sL2h8wuvo1ECA.text: This place has a nice atmosphere, but that's about it. I know it's a fusion restaurant, but I'm not sure what's they're fusing. I didn't order any sushi, maybe the sushi would be better. I'd ordered the teriyaki beef bowl. It just taste like pei wei's food. We also got a udon...however we didn't know they had stir-fry. I thought udon was going to be in a soup. The flavoring of the udon tasted like the vietnamese saracha chilli sauce mixed with sweet and sour sauce. Absolutely gross.  Maybe their sushi rolls are better, but I think they'd overpriced their food and you could get better sushi at other place for better price.

HYxXuBkCNQRtTwScpQcFDg.text: This is another late nite, post-partying on the Vegas strip spot! It's funny because I have never eaten sushi @ 2am before!!! And it was so yummy! I especially enjoyed the bulgogi roll and Sexy roll. So if you are craving a late-nite sushi, check this spot out because they close @ 6am!!! YaY!

wVL5gWFAeqZjunYGg19E7w.text: Prices are up to par with most average sushi places.  Nigiri Sushi is about $5-8 depending on which fish.  Cut rolls are $5-12.  The spicy tuna salad seems to be a favorite.  Alas the salad seemed to be just a generic salad that they bought at safeway/vons.  The Hamachi was fresh and the two pieces were nice and big.  I wasn't that hungry so I didn't try that many things.  Though the korean bbq roll was a nice try to something new, it wasn't that special to make me want to order again (may as well just get korean bbq shortribs with rice), as there are so many other rolls to try.  I'd go again, prices and quality are up to par, and this time I'd try the other rolls.  Good for rolls, decent for nigiri (it's no sasabune).

KYhMS_hzwMC22iQBh8LTGQ.text: Every time I come to Las Vegas I tend to stop in here for a  meal.  It's never a disappointment.  Always seems to be so fresh.  It's Amazing to me how the desert seems to get stuff shipped so that it's as fresh.  Theres a nice selection of fish here and if you're into rolls it won't disappoint.  Also a good selection of sake and a few Japanese beers.  But do stay away from the chicken Karaage until they figure out their seasoning which makes the chicken dry as f_ _ _ !   Trust me on that or if not, at least ask if it's dryyyyyy!

217ByDRJjJ5fV0BSgLxK5Q.text: The sushi at this place is some of the best I've ever had. The Shogun Roll is amazing. We ordered the bento box for our kids. They loved it. And had to order extra egg rolls because they are sooo good. We will come back for sure. The rolls are on the pricier end, $12-$15 per roll. Worth it in my opinion.

QLBrR9rC78FsN9e8Yhj94Q.text: Wow what an AMAZING sushi spot!! Came here on our way into town and were fully satisfied with the sashimi Eddie the sushi chef prepped. The ahi, salmon and yellow tail tasted like they fresh out of the Hawaiian Waters's. Bonus the lunch was only $12.95 for 9 pieces!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1nliTdMQjUnk95Pp1GBkpw.text: Came to kaizen with my mom while visiting Vegas. Our friends suggested we try kaizen because they love it. I'm vegetarian and they were very accommodating. The sushi roll i created was amazing and the garlic edamame was delicious. They service was very attentive and friendly. We will definitely be back our next time in town.

dOxmDLzSkYcYEuL04fFoJA.text: First time here at Kaizen. Did not even know it existed in this spot across Hard Rock Hotel on Paradise and Harmon. Ordered the Baked New Zealand Mussels in Dynamite Sauce, Ika Yaki (Grilled Swuid), Crispy Soft Shell Crab for appetizers.  Very clean atmisphere but intimate with rigbt lightings. Decor is posh and modern. Love the local artist paintings on the wall. Our server was very welcoming, friendly and was nice to recommend off the menu. My family and I will be coming back again for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Tea Ice Cream Green Tea and Strawberry Mochi
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Mussels
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King of Ocean Roll

3D4yNnM2PIIPEFAJ6AV-8w.text: This place is phenomenal and open super late night.  The quality is breathtaking and it won't break the bank.   I strongly urge you to try the kiss of fire.  They say it's super spicy but it's perfect and not to hot.  There are more expensive sushi places, I'm looking at you Nobu, but they aren't worth the extra scratch.  Come here when in Vegas.  It's across the street from the hard rock and it's skipping distance to the double down saloon.  Great service and great ambience.  Come hungry! The portions are big.    Also don't just focus on the awesome sushi, their dinner plates, particularly the fresh fish, are worth ordering and are quite memorable.

K59MEdUWyIug3X1KfMXrrQ.text: We needed a quick spot for lunch that wasn't on the strip since it was mostly closed today and this fit the bill.  I ordered the caterpillar roll and it was quite yummy.  My friend ordered the Nevada roll and said it was really good.  My other friend ordered the halibut and veggies and she too was quite pleased.  Definitely would come here again next time I'm in Vegas.

TBt1xxxhI1iWZ1A1xtpDQg.text: The sushi was delicious and the service was excellent. Great atmosphere and I will definitely recommend to a friend!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi was delicious and the service was excellent. Will definitely recommend to a friend.

GOgyeJrMcntl23pyII-cgA.text: This place was incredible!! Thoroughly enjoyed our lunch! We stumbled across this little gem. We will certainly return on our next visit.

orK5emHE0JDSuVRb-8O1rQ.text: Loved this place. Nice quiet spot off the strip, and with off-the-strip prices. Went twice during a week-long work trip there and it was a nice respite from the pretention and BS elsewhere in Vegas. The rolls were inventive and terrific, with good quality fish. I sat at the sushi bar both times and found the sushi chefs to be friendly and knowledgeable, and struck up a wonderful hour-long conversation with a fellow solo customer that lasted well after our food was done.

j0AVbTxuAs2_cnUReGtHVw.text: Amazing sushi at great LV prices. Gotta get the Golden Knights roll and the Ninja roll. You can expect to pay $17-$20 / roll on the strip. Average roll here is about $14. Can't go wrong here.

ghWrwDhB323-kcLusnkuzA.text: Excellent food. Great staff, fun environment. Fair prices.   I ordered the paradise roll at the advice of the waitress and it truly was paradise.

YnpLlrceO2_I0ShbBkQRig.text: so to start this review id like to say that the manager of the company never returned my phone call but did call my brother back who threatened to call the health department on them and responded without saying sorry or taking any responsibility for not 1 but 3 of the 4 people getting sick. But instead defended their food and any possibility of it happening. Nor did he offer any sort of reconcilement. Thursday morning at 3:45am we sat down and ate with a group of 4. 1 of which only ate her 1 roll but the 3 of us shared the rest. It took 2 hours for the stomach pain to start. An hour later is when I first began throwing up and the rest of the symptoms that come with food poisoning throughout the day and through the night. I was supposed to go to the lake thursday am and had to cancel that and had surgery planned friday morning which had to be rescheduled due to the pain and weakness i had. My brother called the restaurant on paradise where we ate, he never got a call bak until the next day he called again and said he would be calling the health department as stated and only then did he get a call back. The manager brought up the idea of us drinking alocohol, mind you i didn't drink as i needed to be up for the lake. Wasnt at all apologetic for the incident only tried basically putting the blame on everything but the restaurants food. I would also like to state that i posted on my instagram story about the incident and i had not 1 but 5 others stating they had gotten sick from the same company. So as of now i will be taking this into my own hands so i can let the public know about this company. I will be contacting the news station as well.

zWygtuu5-E9ihYwOn8AqKA.text: Ours first time in Las Vegas. We stayed at hard rock hotel, next to it have sushi restaurants. The food look good and price is fair

2N-i1k50wfzRews_H9admA.text: A funning thing about the name of this restaurant "Kaizen", according to my Japanese colleague, means continuous improvement of something and is the motto for Toyota motors.    They said nobody in Japan would name the restaurant "kaizen". I guess it's because it implies that the dishes are not at their best if you are constantly trying to improve.   Anyhow, this place is somewhat of a novelty for the Japanese because they usually do not see nor tasted American-style sushi rolls. We ordered the tuna poke, 16pcs sushi combo, 20pcs sashimi, calamari tempura roll and a spicy rainbow roll.  Nothing is really out of the ordinary. The poke tasted a bit odd but the sashimi and spicy rainbow roll were decent. A bit on the pricey side.  There's an overhead projection of random music and videos playing. A large bar on the side. The location was easy to find with plenty of parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. calamari tempura roll
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16pcs sushi combo
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spicy rainbow roll

gqzWx3Kq6rk-6M2kSb9guw.text: Very accommodating beautiful presentation delicious food. Open till 4 AM very fresh beautiful presentation oh very nice thank you OK thank you so much I'm so sorry nothing perfect thank you

C0vgp6WcblqgL2G8G0UXyg.text: Service is outstanding and the sushi was good. The rolls are good and creative. If you like spicey with sushi this place will treat you well. It also has basic rolls but their own spicey creations are good. Also got the the gyoza, after living in Japan for three years wasn't inpressed with the gyoza. Decent but if you come and are looking for an appetizer I wouldnt go with this one, but nonetheless the food and sushi and service was good, so I would check it out if you're jonzing for a cool place and some good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise and Salmon killer
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sitting at the bar

eNPNxyiPU-74VCqMSaMEvA.text: Great restaurant to get away from the hussle of Vegas.  Service is attentive and personable.

wYCUO0aDORiP4oc9YXhKIw.text: Don't come to this plaza unless you're strapped with weapons....or at least pepper spray. Even a stun gun would be nice. Kaizen was okay but damn...this plaza was one hot mess!!! We haven't parked for 2 seconds yet and bums are already asking for money.  But this sushi place is nothing to write home about. Service was spotty....even though we came on a late Sunday night. After they brought us our drinks and water, we were ready to order some sushi rolls. We had to flag the waitress down, TWICE. It wasn't even busy!!! There were about 5-8 other tables. They didn't bother checking back on us....what if we wanted to order more sushi?!?! I totally would have by the way. We ordered a spicy tuna roll and also a Sunrise Roll. Sushi was delicious and their menu was never ending. I would've loved to try a few more...but DAMN...it was pricey!!!! Our sunrise roll was $13!!! Most of the sushi rolls ran from $10-14 per order. Umm, yeah...no. You're better off going into the heart of Chinatown or even further...(wayyyy further) off the strip for better priced sushi.  Also..side note: if you get cold like myself, BRING A JACKET WITH YOU!!!! They like to keep their fish and customers fresh and cold. Thought I was in their freezer box for a second.  Won't be coming back again. And this side of town is enough to scare the sushi out of me.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise Roll

zutTJSbhJKqmCDIdChy1rw.text: Good food, fast service, chill music after a long drive over. I liked the vibe here before life is beautiful. Sashimi was solid but underwhelming, the tiger eye roll was awesome. But the chocolate Bombay was cool, the dish that was most delicious I forgot the name of but it melted in my mouth quickly.

1vp4Mw84uYcl8bJcDylCiw.text: Jalapeno Poppers, they're okay. Taste better after taking a sake bomb. ^-^  Had a chicken katsu roll, which would be perfect for people who don't like seafood (but it has imitation crab). I also got a silver state roll which is really good, highly recommend. Although I like asparagus, I think the roll would taste better with out it.   Very friendly and considerate staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño Poppers

LkARISMKi3XAje3gt11Abw.text: Sushi and sashimi are good. But I ordered the beef curry rice, definitely not what you would expect. It is chop suey with curry flavoring. Come for the sushi rolls and sashimi those are great and recommend those. I don't recommend the beef curry.  5 stars for sushi minus 1 for curry.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef curry rice? Uh no this is curry flavored chop suey.

YBfpCzc-z5zCnprmOthljQ.text: This is the BEST Japanese restaurant I have been to. I am only visiting Las Vegas but will fly down here from Orange County California just to eat at this place. This place gets 100% full Mark's. I highly recommend this restaurant everyone needs to try Kaizen. Excellent service Excellent food Excellent everything. Thank u for the lovely experience.

czQ-bQ9cKFWwdmf_QuWK_g.text: What a great sushi and teriyaki bowls!! Very fancy place. So are the prices  Overall, very good place and very expensive!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken teriyaki
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious teriyaki bowl will fill you
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey Brain was delicous

n4bmLMMssPrjn-a7FjrRxA.text: Absolutely horrible!! First time ever being there me and my wife and my Aunt went and we just ordered our food. When all of a sudden what looks like a cockroach crawled up in front of all of us on the bar and we told the cook and he just grabbed a rag, killed it, and went back to work not washing his hands and nothing. It was absolutely disgusting!!! Please do not eat here! Also it was super hot and super crowded!

vHWnxhBlHXro0isnjPK4Pg.text: I love this place. Great atmosphere, quick to get in. Fast and friendly service. Plus since I'm keto, they accommodate my Rice-less sushi roll requests! Love love love

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AmWU0joN_JKYQC3jl-M35Q.text: This place is great! Coming from Los Angeles there is plenty of great sushi spots. Coming to Vegas we were hoping to find some at least something decent... but this place is just as great as anything you'll find there. Great staff and awesome quality! Check it out.

hCrR8zcRzHl7UEL_drvBIw.text: I think I found my new place. It was so amazingly good . I'm picky so finding a good place is rewarding. I will have to come back and take pictures and order the same thing. The crunch roll is sweet and perfect.

rHvhbjS1eJGRCZinVv-u-g.text: I'm not really sure why this place gets high reviews.  I must say I was highly disappointed. First of all the prices I felt were on the high side for the quality of the seafood. My wife ordered the 10 piece sashimi plate. It was the chefs choice. The waitress just placed the plate down and never said what kind of fish was on it.  My wife said some of the fish was good others seemed not so fresh and was very fishy. I had the rainbow roll and I would have to agree some of the roll was very good like the salmon portions, seemed fresh other parts of the the roll were very fishy almost bitter.  The California roll was good. I would highly recommend ordering the sauces on the side since they tend to over sauce the order. The service was good except for the server not telling us what kid of fish the chef brought us.  The house saki was actually very good and smooth.   There are many sushi restaurants in Vegas so I probably won't come back to this one since I question the freshness of the fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow roll
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California roll

Q33ecbK86gxLxD4dvcSCRQ.text: My friends and I visited this sushi spot when we arrived in Vegas. I ordered a Kai roll which was absolutely delicious. The ponzu sauce paired well with the halibut. One of my friends ordered a chicken teriyaki bowl and she likes it overall but she ended up asking for more sauce on the side. Another friend ordered a kastu bowl. She was expecting vegetables in the bowl but it was just the breaded chicken with rice. The katsu sauce that came with the bowl was tangy. A lot of different flavors were involved in the sauce, wasn't a fan. Overall it was decent food. We would love to cone back during happy hour to see what else they offer. Also, Richard was the BEST server! Make sure you ask to be seated in his section

aVwF-95JBrlLwk_N8eFu5g.text: Great service and very nice staff which is why I'm giving them a good review. They let me add sauces that I wanted to my dishes with ease. The service is efficient and fast when we came between lunch and dinner. Definitely a fusion place. We enjoyed our food well enough (although as people who got to Japan often, it's got nothing on authentic Japanese food.)

bQn9-V1AaFju2nTNhaZkbA.text: For some reason the food at this location is WAY better than the one at the Eastern location, and I can't quite put my finger on it. Maybe I got a disgusting role at the Eastern location(?) Maybe it's the boring decor and overcrowded/packed seating at the Eastern location(?) I'm not sure. All I know is that the food at this location is great, the waiters are on top of everything, and the decor is flattering. Oh! Also it's literally within walking distance of UNLV.   If you're an avocado fan, get the Avocado Train roll. My friend ordered it and I was practically eating it for her. So yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

43-mgHpt-nqzP-yi_hbQZg.text: We came here when another restaurant had an hour and half wait. We were unable to sit at a table either since all empty tables were reserved and tables were taken. This is a busy night on a Sunday. I was starving and just wanted to eat. We sat at the sushi bar.  The servers were nice and courteous. They were patient while we reviewed the menu. I had my mind set on KBBQ so I was trying to figure out what I wanted. I went with sharing the spicy tuna roll and ordered the nabeyaki udon. This was surprisingly delicious! The server cracked the egg in the udon and I asked for their spicy sauce. Their sauce was so good! The spicy sauce definitely packs a kick and they warned us to start out with a little since it's hot. I loved it! Delicious. The udon noodles were perfect and the broth was good. I don't usually eat udon at restaurants since I like to eat this at home so this was a great surprise. Thank you for making my night!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nabeyaki Udon
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Tuna Roll

PixJSST5oee2CSMVDIqsgw.text: Nice place for date:) fresh and good taste Not busy, so you wan't hear noise like it happening in most sushi place

lw4k6I1izc_qroFFg2tAww.text: I try to come here every time I'm in Vegas. Definitely the best sushi place I've found here.

OBW6C0CKObczRE0EV6r-oQ.text: If I could give a -5 rating I would. Sat for about an hour and service was so bad and slow we never got any food. "Sorry, forgot about you, what did you order?"

gAs7x0CmxJ-N3AM27r-Wsw.text: Pro-Tip: get the sauce / topping on the side if you want a flavor that isn't overwhelming.   This is 100% an Americanized sushi place, aka fusion. Like how orange chicken is "Chinese food". The rolls are definitely creative. It's best to come in a group so you can try everything.

zCkyVEr0gAkdpJ5ZDxcF-w.text: Really great vibes and excellent fish. Spot on preparation. I hope they continue to thrive and do well in Vegas. A real beaut!

-tqCtiimD7jcCJXJX0MTxw.text: Fresh and affordable. Best sushi I have found in Vegas. Great service and friendly staff. I ended up going here 2 nights in a row. Everyone agreed it was amazing and enjoyed it.

HiQAviC4OVCeBpaxy8X_Yg.text: First impression of this place wasn't very high due to them being located in a strip mall.   When we entered, was pleasantly surprised the inside was a lot better than the outside. Changed my initial impression right away. Got seated quickly and was greeted by our server Ivan. He was is the reason for the 4 stars.   Impressive menu selections with pictures galore. They all looked so appetizing. Priced very reasonably for the rolls. They had my favorite appetizer of grilled shishito peppers. Comes with shaved bonito flakes.   Sushi started coming out quickly, the place was slow but we were there early too, like 5pm early.   Ordered a bunch of rolls and they were very reasonably priced, most under $10. I wanted to try the Unicorn roll (one of the more pricier $15 rolls). Said it had lobster topped and other goodies.   As the rolls started coming out, I observed the ones that had shrimp tempura, the tip of the tails were cut on a bias. This attention to detail was impressive. The shrimp was cooked right and remained crisp.   The next thing that caught my attention was the rolls that were advertised to have crab. They use imitation crab meat, a lot. That's one way to keep their prices low. I don't mind imitation crab meat as long as I knew they were described in the menu.   For dessert we had the green tea ice cream tempura. This one was a winner. The presentation was it was quartered thus exposing the layers and the inner goodness. Topped with whipped cream and drizzled with chocolate. Very well done and the ice cream was hardly melted.   Overall, the quality of the food was good (3 stars good) and the service pushed my rating up to 4 stars. I would go here again even knowing they like to use imitation crab meat. Price is right for what get.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea ice cream tempura

4J5Np4nT_Sx9qgQGk_zGEA.text: Food is always good service is excellent love the quaint and family atmosphere the Miso soup is excellent the curry the chicken bone and especially the sushi is always good my favorite is the Monster Sushi

ghBZUYE59is-muPdQ0Lr0g.text: First time here! Decided to take a break from the casino fare and walked over after reading some yelp reviews.was definitely not disappointed! I had the sashimi special ...8 pieces of chefs choice sashimi and choice of California or spicy tuna roll.The sashimi was amazing. Fresh and buttery with perfectly cooked rice. The Spicy tuna roll was delicious as well and wasn't rice heavy. My friend ordered the baked salmon roll, polished it off and immediately ordered another! They also get points for being open until 4am. Try it out!

2av-1z0D28EgAGzIZ-DwKg.text: Amazing and flavorful sushi, great happy hour (1+1 on alcohol, till they close). Very nice atmosphere, great service, it was the best food experience throughout this trip. Thank you so much!

qx-J_wVdESer-qWgzF6zcg.text: The food was great....but not use to this type of delicacy. The seaweed salad was enjoyable. The ice cream (green tea) was delicious. Staff seemed helpful but lacked in pouring water and keeping the cups full. Other then that I ventured out to try something new. I'll be back to try other things on the menu. Thank you guys.

8v_VcJg-96BebWGF8nMpnQ.text: Huge variety of sushi! The people working there are very helpful and energetic. The food was amazing as well! Definitely coming back!

-1iVSTuJOEiN8-6qIamUIQ.text: amazing amazing amazing. By far the best sushi I ever had in my life. I am happy to admit Im a local here. I come as often as humanly possible.  I first discovered this place about two months ago. Everything is good. My favorite is the crispy rice appitizer. It's just yum.  matter of fact... I am heading there now! they're open late, perfect for the casino workers and late night crowd like us!

j4SANA51sgKr2KlF0aIrfw.text: HANDS DOWN THE BEST SUSHI I HAVE EVER HAD!  Found this restaurant thru an acquaintance back in 2010 and never ate raw sushi until I came here and it has changed me.  Ever since 2010 I have been on a search in multiple states to find sushi that can rival KAIZEN but have failed.  This destination is a must for every vegas trip I take.  Favorite sushi is the "sexy roll!!"  I could eat 3 orders by myself.  Great restaurant!!!  Keep it going!!

VCS4-vIdPcaaXz6ubzUIqw.text: Fantastic and authentic sushi, and good sake selection. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The menu has all the staples and is also very creative, the Spider Mania roll and Monkey Brain are amazing!

WOT0UEJ5dHxv8IZ__ix9WA.text: I've been three visits now.  Super great place.   Food is fantastic.  Ambiance is nice and service great.   I'll be back!

boNyrFz-ftr3k17xF1btJw.text: When I called they had phone issues I guess? I called 2 or 3 times and it would randomly hang up and they would call me back. But other than that the food is super yummy. It's a little pricey for some of the rolls but it will definitely fill you up! Also open very late so it's a plus.

yVPvdooNP0VCTt7L6qVolw.text: Philadelphia sushi was good. Their BBQ Pork Ribs was very tender! Our server, Mai, was very nice.

6Zdwxdqq-qjCseLw4Hm9RQ.text: Sushi is great! Good quality food. Restaurant is nice and clean. Absolutely loved the Strawberry Mochi!!

so8EP8M-V5jHNGC3_ZqlVA.text: Amazing food and great service! Love coming to this place. Love the orange blossom roll!

y22fYjBKxn10ObGIDLATsQ.text: Ambience: Solid A here. The lighting is dim, and makes for an intimate feel. Decor is simple with traditional Japanese and modern touches.  Service: It's an overall B to B-. The hostess and wait staff is friendly and just the right amount of attentive. Sushi chef was cold. I am so used to friendly, outgoing sushi chefs, so while he was by no means rude, his customer facing skills leave something to be desired.  Sushi: And of course the most important aspect of. Sushi restaurant. Unfortunately, this is a C to C+. As a frequent sushi nosher and lover or nigiri, I was more than a little disappointed. What I ordered: salmon, yellowtail belly, uni, and unagi. The unagi was the best of the 4. But honestly, it's pretty touch to mess up since its BBQ'd. Flavor was good, although the unagi sauce was cloyingly sweet. The salmon was second best. Standard. Not bad, but not great. Slightly flavorless. The yellowtail belly and uni were terrible. I was really looking forward to the buttery fattiness, but found it entirely flavorless and stale (the ends were hard which I've never experience with sushi). To be honest , I choked down the uni. Sad because it's one of my favorites to order. It had an odd metallic flavor that again, I've never experienced. Additionally, the nigiri itself was really sloppy. Most all fell apart as soon as I tried to pick them up with my chopsticks.  Wish I could have given it at least 3 stars, but the food quality is obviously a big factor. I've been here a few times, so this isn't based on a one time experience.

qcHDK-OKeotK-Jd9WOEfMw.text: Well I guess they read my last review because the nigiri sushi list is now taped inside the front cover of the menu! Another great meal at a very reasonable price per person. We stuffed ourselves for about $40 each.  Lots of choices. Nicely divided menu by type of roll - fried, tempura, etc. Much better value than the high end places in the hotels nearby.  Open late so you can eat a nice meal after a very long day working.

cZaPmAIdY4hjqvbQ1w_y8w.text: If I could give it 3.5 stars I would! I will start on a positive note, the tuna nigiri melted in my mouth and the service was tag team so never had to ask for any refills. I ordered a few rolls, the ingredients were fresh but it just missed the mark. When you've had exceptional sushi in all parts of the US you know what your looking for. This place may be fun for late night or actually any time if your goal is to lap up the liquids as there was a really rowdy table in the place at 6pm. Lots of colorful loudness while one eats sushi, not my thing!

edY2YeCXCumO8QNrbQeF0w.text: I must admit I was a little skeptical visiting a sushi restaurant a little off the beaten path on the strip.   Boy was I wrong!  Excellent service and outstandingly prepared well tasting fresh sushi. Guess where I'm going again on my next visit to the City of Sin  Btw: avocado train is a must have!  Enjoy!

NVyM3wY988lmbKIzY9pqrQ.text: Whenever I go to Las Vegas and need a sushi fix. I only go to Kaizen Sushi. I have been to every sushi restaurant in Las Vegas and Kaizen tasted the best. The store is always clean and the food is super fresh. I would recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family.

zs9J7TWaIS1QI0H5c4ThZA.text: Some of the best I have had, fresh and the staff is great! If you like sushi you need to try this palce.

ykntjkI2sdDFBC9kXQaTgQ.text: When I am in Vegas for business I will usually make sure I check out Kaizen. I have brought co-workers as well as my wife here a few times and no one was ever disappointed. The prices are not as bad as on the strip, but a little higher than off the strip. The sushi menu is very extensive with items you will not find at other sushi restaurants. There are a few all you can eat places in Vegas, which Kaizen Fushion Roll and Sushi is NOT. Overall, I always enjoy coming here and it is easy to find as it is in a plaza across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino. They have a few TV's with sports on them usually, and play modern music. The Atmosphere is very modern and clean. I would recommend this place to someone looking for Fusion Sushi.

tUovf2KxzbyxR0qXhVXM_A.text: Go for the avocado train if you're a fan of avocados like I am. From the outside it looks every other strip mall in Vegas. Whether you go 2pm or 2am, it's a funky nite-club with cute decor and great music!  They are clever with their roll combination.  I can be funny about eating raw fish but this place dishes up some of the freshest seafood. Not bad for being in the middle of the desert!

EUYLdLNy5J5G0n9ISR0GmQ.text: I was in town last weekend with friends celebrating my birthday (seriously, I'm still waiting on your presents...). I wanted to grab sushi, and not being a Vegas regular, knew I should check out Yelp to see where all you Vegas Yelpers are going.  Our party of 4 got in relatively early for dinner, about 5:00 on a Sunday, and we were the only ones there. We ordered about 10 different rolls, and they were served at a well staggered interval. I'd say 8 out of 10 were delicious, the other 2 average. The tuna, salmon, crab and more were all delish and fresh. We stayed for a few hours, I think we left after 8:00 since we were eating, drinking and having a great time. The wait staff were great, and were in no rush to get us out the door. In fact, they made sure to tell us they were open until 4 AM...so I guess we could've stayed for a while!  Ambiance was interesting. I dig the hip hop music and videos, and even though the place looks a little low budget inside, the food more than makes up for lack of decor.   Price was super reasonable, we ended up spending about $50 each, but that's with drinks, all of those rolls and a 25% tip. Great value. I will definitely visit this place again next time I'm in Las Vegas. Thanks Yelpers, for helping out a San Diegan in your fine city.

JOjxn0m04z0Dcw9BV3cV2w.text: Hmm I love sushi so always willing to try a new sushi place. On a friend's recent birthday we decided to stop here after enjoying Yelp's happy hour at Rumor. Perhaps it was a big mistake to come to sushi hungry after indulging in quite a few drinks. Let's just say it would have been beneficial for us and our pocket books to do AYCE elsewhere. Between 3 of us, we graciously cashed out at $100 on sushi on individual rolls not AYCE. Well it wouldn't have been that bad, however, when most AYCE places are around $24 a person, it would have been cheaper to go elsewhere! The rolls were enjoyable but not mouthgasmic and overpriced. I do give them credit for surprising the birthday girl with a tempura green tea dessert, which we enjoyed greatly. I'll stick to my sushi joints off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Poke
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Green Tea Ice Cream
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail Sashimi with Jalapeno &amp; Tuna Sashimi with Crispy Onion

JsckQww4oBps9RmD3cFm9w.text: Kaizen isn't cheap.  It's not sushi genius or the best thing you've ever eaten.  It's just really good fresh fish served till the wee hours of the morning so in my book thats pretty sweet.    When I first moved to town from New York and had no car.   I lived in the ghetto area just north and would walk the 15 minutes in blistering heat for the sushi.  Well that and check out the boobs across the street at the hard cock.  Worked for me.

Lp3GX1ZCsmrgCWiMLjBzfg.text: If you have read some of my other Vegas reviews, you will know that I am not local but I visit very often and for extended periods of time.  I also have a lot of friends who live in Vegas and work in the service industry.  As a result, I have tried a large number of sushi bars and restaurants both on and off Las Vegas Blvd.  A friend of mine who has lived in town for 18 years took us to Kaizen one night and we sat at the bar.  The food was pretty good, but nothing to write home about.  The nigiri was average, but the rolls we had were nothing special.  It might have just been the night we went, but something did not seem right with the items that came from the fryer (like the tempura).  One plus is that the price was fair and the place was open late.  The service was friendly, but a bit slow.  Overall, I will not likely go back.  With so many options, this restaurant failed to make an impression and for the price point, I prefer Hamada down the road.

wqDnVRyv_qWqnEJUO5yOhg.text: I am in love with this place! From the ambiance to the food; I have no complaints. I have been going here for about 3 years now & have had my birthday here twice. I work as a hostess at a restaurant on the strip and get off pretty late at night, so it is very convenient that it is open til 3 or 4 am. The staff are all friendly and accommodating; I usually dine at the sushi bar and always have a great time with the sushi chefs. The decor is modern and fun, which is a nice change from your typical sushi restaurant. The pricing of the items are reasonable and not too expensive which is nice. Everyone should definitely try the baked New Zealand mussels; I get them every time.

2qcLS3sonOg0qcFx20Wqcw.text: Kaizen Is not the cheapest sushi spot out there but the service and quality of the food makes up for the price. They're happy hour is on every night from 10pm to 2am and If you go on they're website you can print out a coupon to get a free Saki Bomb with a purchase of 15 dollars or more.

vzjS_x5FWQgHuVG1mtTeeg.text: One of the best sushi places in town. I love the decor of the restaurant and the staff is always wonderful! I sushi chefs are great and the sushi always taste fresh. They play great music and the vibe is definitely pleasant. My favorite roll is the rainbow roll... you must try :)

bvpjMLuiFd_C2EDbxEV0Nw.text: The surprising thing about Vegas is how few great dining options there are late-night.  Sure, every hotel has its late-night restaurant but they're generally pretty average.  This place was great!  They had funky rolls and good drinks and at 2am we weren't expecting anything this good.  Would definitely return.

tR4in0i49V9Rs8qO3730LA.text: Good food, service, and atmosphere. The only thing I didn't like was how loud the music was. The sushi and service more than made up for it though.

N54gtfxIXYt8Krhq83Pj3A.text: Great place for the afterclub drunken munchies or lunch with the parents! I can't help but always ordering a snow corn roll and a scallop dynamite. This was the place that put "Vegas Sushi" on the map for me and distinguished it from sushi restaurants in ANY other city.

QX4L6PYRTxeAWyGpfQNbYw.text: Good quality and creative interpretations.  Ambiance was good for a social gathering on a Monday night, but not too loud. The limited beer and saki selection was the only gripe I had, but by no means a show stopper.

gqeIICK1kNWE53Ly4n5BKg.text: A-OK sushi place located across the street from Hard Rock. The sushi prices are a little steep but im sure its because of the high rent location. The quality of the sushi was just ok and the decor was boring. The service was a little slow and had to order not from the sushi chef but a hostess/server. Dont think i will be back if i am in the area and want sushi.

0fndoShDSnU-CulZxRxFZQ.text: Fun little sushi spot open late with a casual vibe.  I ordered salmon sashimi and the spicy tuna salad.  Both were delicious. My friend ordered a roll (maybe hardrock roll?) that had lots of fish and no rice which was also tasty.  My complaint is that the prices are too high for a casual sushi spot.  I would come here a lot more if they were more reasonable or if they had a better happy hour.  There are so many great sushi spots in town with better deals unless it's really late i'll probably go elsewhere.  The happy hour starts around midnight and is only 1/2 off on booze and not much discount on any food other than certain hand rolls.

312rVNmOfcgonfEcKcVGyA.text: After a long night  and a long drive, I wasn't too impressed with this place. We ordered 3 different rolls and they must've thought that we were ordering from the kiddie menu. Even the sauces could be measured by a squirt. I don't know if this is the norm or if they figured that we wouldn't recognize the bite sizes until we reached home. The only good thing was that it was open at 12:30 in the morning.

ZdES8liAWaom20KyyKs32A.text: This is a great sushi bar.  Very creative rolls, great atmosphere and acceptable service.

4bg8lH04Qt33NQIH-z9A9w.text: This place is one of the best sushi spots in Vegas!!!  When this place is packed or just has a few people scattered through the restaurant, the service is always the same......efficient and  amazing!  I've never had to wait more than a minute before someone comes up to greet me which is a rare thing these days.  The sushi rolls are unique, beautiful, and all have such diverse tastes.   When I have gone there by myself the sushi chefs are great at making you feel welcome and are very interactive, they are the same when I have gone with someone as well but are great for the lone ranger who's out looking for a great dining experience. I highly recommend this place for any local or if you are visiting, it will become you new fav sushi spot or at least be added to your list for sure!  LOVE ME SOME KAIZEN!  Keep up the great work you guys!

9iTVmoWdyF66J20uZTjJ8Q.text: Fresh and delicious sushi! If you don't want to spend lots of money at the casino sushi bars or at Nobu@Hard Rock (which is across the street) go to Kaizen. They have a GREAT AMBIANCE!, cool vibe and current music/videos! They have a long sushi bar with a couple of plasma TV's where you can watch sports. The menu has many options- our favorite was the roll that had salmon, macadamia nuts, avocado and jalapeno! YUM!  DO NOT GO TO Yokohama for sushi which is diagonally across the street. I don't know why it got so many good reviews. Go to Kaizen...you won't be disappointed.

RAOPBFPvNKSMhcYrktoBcw.text: This is my favorite Sushi place here Las Vegas. The ambiance is cool and modern contemporary. The servers are friendly and attentive. But most of all, the food is great. Fresh and delicious. I highly recommend this place.

gYApKAesCNbW3vSk2lYZWg.text: This gem was hidden in a strip, crowded with other food vendors. I ordered take out, as it was right across the street from the hotel I was staying at for business, and I was alone. :(   I skimmed through the menu for a while, when the server came and asked if I was ready. I asked him to suggest some good rolls, hinting that I loved salmon. He recommended the sunrise roll, so I took that and an order of salmon sushi (2 pcs).   I went back to my hotel room and was pleasantly surprised. The fish was very fresh and the sushi rice was nicely seasoned. If I am ever back in town, I'd love to try their other food!

FSPOm3JMfi2Rvesgdr6VBA.text: Irene and Takky are the best!! They were super friendly and very helpful with recommending food! I would highly recommend the Salmon Killer roll and the Chicken Katsu bowl! I will definitely be back on my next Vegas trip :) Thanks again ladies you were truly amazing!!!!!!!

dXyZzeLfyA3FN4kVPn3reQ.text: Great sushi and great service! Super polite staff and they were really quick to make the sushi!

Ggcps7HrB62Bm830bv_oYg.text: Can't believe I've never reviewed Kaizen before. It's THE GO TO spot for sushi, especially for those in the service industry as it's open late/early. I've never been disappointed with anything here. My faves are Charlie roll, yellowtail sashimi, and Kai roll. Definite date night spot!

X0cO5V6R12sM4sOpzYuRkg.text: We are visiting Las Vegas for the second time and we are looking for a cheaper sushi place! I love sushi and had it in multiple places before, but this one is great !!!!Awesome food and pretty atmosphere! Not busy and great service! The prices are good also, average i would say, but perfect for the quality!!

g4MPLm65iW0qzwy9bWUd7Q.text: Unfortunately I forgot to take any pictures. I only eat the veggie rolls so I had avocado rolls and veggie rolls. I also add jalapeno to them. Not to exotic but very delicious none the less. I also had the delicious garden salad with ginger dressing and avocado.    Everyone else had  ninja roll, screaming O, nigiri unagi, monkey brains, t.t. Girls. By the looks of how they devoured everything in sight I trust their rolls must have been fabulous as well.    The service was friendly and fast. Drinks were filled as they emptied and they alway checked to see if we were ready to order more food.

He made us the orange blossom I believe it was called.  It was great too!

I'd have to say the cherry blossom tasted spectacular, had great appetizer selections and especially our server Victor delivered great, timely service! Will surely visit here again in the future! Also a very nice interior! Awesome Sushi place!

ZPkz7QNhtVUg3FEqHL5O_g.text: What they lack in customer service they definitely make up for with ambience and the quality of the food they serve the presentation isn't bad also

gw-OxXwAOSaqxWjOOKjZ_Q.text: What a great surprise! In here our first time and the ambience, rolls, service and lighting was great!! Loved the rolls and loved the late hours they're open.

vKiCTw792avabFzsxDdx2A.text: Delicious as always! The food here is always amazing and they have the best Miso soup. The staff is always great and it's spotless all the time.

Celx5c-nmxsxSP1UQm1yNw.text: Ate here twice while in Vegas.  The food was fantastic and they have Gluten Free soy sauce upon request.  Service was great and very personable.  Highly recommend.

oA6spxXGZnO9Mq0KkHKbMw.text: This place is bomb.com!!! Get the avocado train has got to be the staple! Servers are great sushi awesome bring family friends.

QYYVUxh-FESX6Cg_EpAbsA.text: This is one of the best sushi in vegas. You must try the Silver state roll a lot of flavors going on that roll, also the crazy girl roll deep its a deep fried roll. Fast service everything we ordered is good. Try this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried sushi so good.

f5kb-X5V4UuFheWudWlzug.text: The sushi was amazing! Had jalapeno poppers and ninja roll. Heat and flavor balance was perfect! Great value for the price. It was an extremely easy walk from the Hard Rock hotel. The staff was very friendly, and was always there before needing to ask for anything.

yXDY_DJWgfdsvQ2PuPVNrQ.text: Located in a strip mall right across from Hofbrauhaus, I wouldn't have guessed that EXCELLENT sushi was hiding out. I was craving sushi and my husband found Kaizen on Yelp. Good job!   Here was what my taste buds danced to:  - Salmon  *** Smoked salmon - Smoked salmon cut roll - Unagi cut roll ** Golden Knights cut roll - Seared tuna  The cold smoked salmon was my favorite. I could have sashimi'd that until the cows (fish) came home. It was lightly smoked but such a great flavor combo as a sushi option which I've never had before. My second fave was the Golden Knights roll which is similar to a CA roll but it had salmon & avocado thinly sliced on top and a creamy sauce that paired perfectly. What's great about Kaizen outside of the freshness of the quality is all of the sauces / way the sushi is dressed is perfectly paired.  Definitely will be back! Side note, if you show them your review you will get a free spicy tuna, ice cream, small sake, etc. I forgot what the other choices were. It was on a monitor, not on the actual page as a check-in.

rgnSd8VTIPTATENL79BHeQ.text: We have been to Kaizen twice. The first time was excellent. We love the decor, service and the atmosphere. The sushi is beautifully presented. Last night we were seated quickly, service was very prompt. I asked for Tamari (gluten free soy) before we ordered explaining I cannot eat gluten.  I ordered the Silver State roll which contained crab. After eating 2 pieces I noticed it did not look like crab, but it was actually krab (imitation crab) which contains wheat/gluten. I asked the waiter and he said it was imitation Krab. He offered to bring something different so I ordered a Philadelphia roll and sent back the Silver State roll telling him it didn't say imitation or krab on the menu.  My husband and I went out on the strip and yes I did get sick within approx. an hour after leaving. My complaint is it should be labeled on the menu as imitation krab, not real crab.

LXBM0Wdzb9BWN0CpWi5y6Q.text: The best thing about Kaizen is that it's off the strip but it's close enough for it to not be out of the way, so there's a chance you'll get some quality stuff for a fraction of the strip price.   That's exactly what you get here. I was on a date with a girl that lived nearby, and she loved sushi so I thought she should go here. While she does believe she's had better, cheaper places (this was expensive to her, but I'm a California boy) this is still my go-to sushi place.   What's great is that the place closes late, so it almost doesn't matter what time of day (or night) it is.  If you want your sushi fixing, and want some quality along with it, near the strip -- this is the place to go to.

aiYV2xTGvt1jxSFVcgMimQ.text: I ordered the Nevada roll and a can of coke(no refills btw). I believe it's no refills because they use a 12oz can for their soda. Coke, Diet Coke and 7up were the only sodas they offered. The Nevada roll was delicious as it came with a few different type of fish. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. KS1 Nevada Roll

ILyf_CUWcY8JDqfS7DHMFw.text: First time trying Kaizen and loved my food. Definitely recommend the Avocado train and the crazy boy.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy boy
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado train

cgFsV-3W19r012DFVt3Ejg.text: First time here and we love it. The fish was fresh and the service was awesome. I had the Unagi and it was perfect. The sake and Sapporo was a nice touch with my dinner. I recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time here

I8IYyAtzJZ01bfjRCLkj9w.text: My co-worker and I wanted sushi for lunch, since I work in the area Kaizen was the closest place. Of course, as a Yelp Elite I stalked this page to see what I was going to eat before-hand.  I saw many pictures of a lunch special, so I decided to go with that.   Got to the restaurant and was seated with a regular menu, inquired about a lunch menu and was scoffed at saying, "we do not have a lunch menu here!"  Alright, pay-per-roll it is. We got 2 fancy rolls and 2 basic rolls (california & spicy tuna) to share. The total was $50....  Which confirms my theory that AYCE places have so much more value.   I can't stand places that just throws a stick of imitation crab meat into a California roll and serve it. This place does not actually make the crab-meat mix, with mayo, etc. This place was just MEH.

x0rDLhytJjbH9pYv6OArYA.text: I was out of town and wanted some fresh sushi I came across this place! The sushi was fresh the eel sauce was bomb as well as the gyoza. I highly suggest it if you are looking for fresh  sushi

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot roll and potstickers
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area

P72jDnu1p1rO-0x4THUSVg.text: YUUUUMMMY!!!! The fusion flavor was surprisingly delicious. It was late and we were starving...this place was a jewel find. Open til 4am????? They deliver????? Awe yeah!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YUUUUMMMY!!!!

6E8f1Q1WDuXC4j9LlbwDOg.text: Service 3/5 Not very attentive staff and they don't look too happy working there.   Food 4/5  Rolls were good Seared tuna was dry and quality didn't seem to par Salmon tataki was delicious. The salmon was amazing  Price 3/5 You can get this quality sushi if you drive 15 mins away from the strip. Paying 9.95 for jalapeno poppers seemed absurd.   Overall food was good service was average. It's not off the list but it's not a go to place

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared tuna Unsure what roll Salmon tataki

XlVp2Afg1i7uK3SmCae8bQ.text: So glad we decided to randomly check this sushi place out during our trip to Vegas. We picked 6 rolls and asked the server to pick two more rolls for us. I can't remember all of the names but they included salmon killer, shogun. and T.T Girls. The two rolls that the server surprised us with turned out to be our favorites (one was the orange blossom). So if you can't decide what rolls to get, trust your server, they would know best. They were super attentive and friendly as well, service was great. We devoured all the rolls so quickly between the 6 of us. I recommend coming here with a big group so you can try all the rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UBP1BhGPzU8eFHR-OpcAFA.text: The sushi here is a hidden gem. Whenever I roll Into town I come here because I love the off strip location, easy parking and phenomenal sushi. The menu is extensive, but I come for the rice-less options, of which they have more choices than I've seen anywhere. The staff can be less than attentive and I've never seen it busy, but the late night happy hour is good and the food is great!!! I recommend the monkey brains, and the rice-less roll. #KETO win!

k86ur9aE-2gXiWeQqyDT6A.text: Some of the best Ikura and Hamachi I've had in a very long time. Highly recommend  this place. The "kaizen rolls" look quite creative and tasty if you like combination rolls. Several members of the party do and said they were quite good. All around an awesome experience and I will definitely  be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar at Kaizen.

nkfZVsfhKWLtwmfuhcahNQ.text: Well we went back the next night and had a wonderful experience. Our server Eileen (I think) was wonderful. The food was so tasty and ambience very cool. We totally enjoyed our meal and plan on going back again.

xeWDUyHupfO7Hd43LOZmxg.text: Cute sushi bar, Amal will seat probably about 6 to 8 tables at most of groups if 4. They however offer two large picnic style tables that can sit up to 8-10 people for larger parties.   We went with friends and didn't order but a few things. I did not eat the Sushi rolls only had the crab salad and it was good and light.  Restaurant is right across the Hardrock Hotel next to CVS. You can walk right across the street.   Service was good, I wouldn't say exceptional only because these types of restaurants only have 1-2 waitresses or waiters to help all the tables. Overhaul I would eat here again due to location and cost is reasonable.

2vDxuq_jBuiQP5jmv6D0zA.text: If there was another star I'd give it. The sushi here is unreal.   I try to find killer sushi on my travels and the sushi at Kaizen literally made my arm hair stand on end. Holy crap, try the unagi!! I will be back the next time I make it to Vegas and look forward to another amazing experience at Kaizen.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G7k8z8Nh9ax3OR4HmQgHZQ.text: Delicious, service was perfect  it wasn't too busy when I came I got the lobster tail roll it had veggies fried lobster tempura stuffed lobster sushi roll.  Order came pretty quick not sure if it's because not people were there or just good service.  Everything was delicious I will come back

tKqSiwTiRJ9QElh_WIUssA.text: NO ALL YOU CAN EAT. NO FREE APPETIZERS (like edamame or miso soup. Have to pay). Staff checks on their guests periodically throughout the meal. This restaurant is more expensive than other places I've been to, but you get what you pay for. Yellowtail, Salmon, Tuna literally seems like Toro part of the fish. Their cocktail menu is very creative and tasty.   Only issue was a couple staff were standoffish... one even stood near the door to make sure we payed... lol I thought that was funny considering I work in the industry and tip very well. That didn't affect my tip - the chef deserved every dollar!
