q8gr-M8_2g9xndtUalgwnA.text: I called to place a take out order.  I asked what the entree options are for the bento box and the girl gave me a condescending reply explaining that there is a very long list of various options and I should just come in and look at the menu myself cause she can't be bothered to list them.  I went to pick up my order and the girl on the phone was a younger Asian girl who was the server/hostess. I didn't see much staff and she seemed pretty busy which explains why she was annoyed on the phone (still took her longer to sass me back rather than read me menu options). Took about 5 minutes to get acknowledged at the stand.  2 stars because the food was decent but service threw it all off.

LePoJYVfajbBojuHsv9R8w.text: Came here for happy hour - amazing decor and prices. Do yourself a favor and get off the strip for dinner!

nCikvSUN9d8XZDXJIQyk4Q.text: This place it's amazing the food and the service are awesome. Every time we come to the Platform show in August we have dinner here! You can't miss the Spicy Tuna Salad and the Avocado Train delicious. We were there last night a have a great time! If you stay at the Hard Rock it's waking distance!

rJRWBgYfAkmNgStQyikRsQ.text: Oh my. I can't gush enough about this place. It's across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino. We were craving sushi while gambling there and almost went to Nobu. Thankful for checking Yelp we came here instead to save a few bucks. I can't tell you how happy I am that I came here! We had the Kaizen cheviche which was heaven. Then we had the Kaizen scallop dynamite which is baked with mushrooms and cheese. I would have ordered another had we not ordered rolls. I'm a scallop fan and this was just mouth-watering good! The prices are reasonable and I'll admit I'd pay Nobu prices for this deliciousness. Don't be fooled by those high end places. Come to a local spot like this and have a great meal!

7wak-5KmykXKvxdLNb753A.text: Very good sushi--4 stars Service----2.5-3 stars  Customer service is questionable.   We waited about 50 min for a table although we were told 15 min.  Don't order wine here.  Stick with beer or sake or soda.  She paid $13 for a GLASS of wine which sells at Costco for $8 A BOTTLE.  The person who settled our check didnt split the bill among the card but charged one person the balance.  It was really a mess and there were only 5 people in our party.  I would return but will keep these things in mind.

grW-05euQDi41d4p8WAybA.text: Definetly would recommend this place for tempura rolls. staff is friendly. came here outta the blue and wasnt dissappointed.

b-AF38vKHLkx1GJkNQKrdg.text: Amazing place! The atmosphere is great and the staff is very attentive. The decorations are beautiful and they have several tv's, so it's a great date restaurant or hangout spot.

knodXkFEwpdS3vBf8OMQ7g.text: I'm writing this review as I'm eating sushi at Kaizen Fusion.  I'm a sushi lover and have tried many Sushi restaurants in LA where I live but this place really rocks. Awesome food at reasonable prices and great friendly service. A+

6xASyud9GYSer8ARINPvlQ.text: My wife raved about this place so when I just recently visited, we stopped by.  Not sure why there are any complaints about the service as I thought it was fantastic.  I'm guessing they have been working on their service and improving upon it.  We walked in and  were immediately greeted by a cheerful hostess/waitress (one that actually smiles).  Rolls were awesome, their eel sauce was amazing.  They had an appetizer I had never tried before, they were peppers that were sauteed- very delish!!   I'd definitely come back foh sho!!!!

gY8RyfWgS7goNgjdC1JfsA.text: This place is so amazing, the staff was super friendly, very clean and inviting. The feel of the place from when I walked in was exactly what I expected, perfect.

g-yEhTrjoHqj8_qF222ysw.text: How we found out about this place....amazing....  Kara and I decided to leave my boyfriend at the hotel for a girl on girl bonding dinner shennanigan. I remember i was drunk...and emotional. and drunk.... and a limo driver gave us a free ride.  He asked me where i wanted to go to. I said. SUSHI.  And luckily, without any attempt of harm, or kidnap or rape...we made it safely to the sushi spot...in a LIMO.  fly!  Tip: Girls. we just got lucky our limo driver isn't a douchebag. But do not attept to hop in, to any limo just because it's a dashing limo..I didn't think at that point. Thank god we didn't get killed in our short skirts.  Anyway....  So...my girlfriend and I ...along with our drunken hungry stomachs..ordered so much sushi, which we devoured in less than an hour....  Service on a saturday night was great. No long wait. and they are really friendly.  I had to take my boyfriend here....so we came back here on Monday...again....  What i've tried here so far..i really did like...  here we go: (this is from two nights of being here)  *First Kiss: Deep Fried Shrimp topped with soft shell crab, tuna and white fish.  It comes with a subtle tangy sauce with a flavor that's just about right without overpowering the natural flavor and tast of the fish.  *The "O" Roll: Chopped deep fried soft shell crab, spicy tuna and avocado, topped with Yellowtail.  As the name says.... This is a full blown Orgasm in your mouth. Definitely a must try. It gave me multiples. I had to order this twice.  *Palm Springs Roll: OMG. This is an orgasm within an Orgasm. Cubed Tuna in Spicy Mayo and Ponzy Sauce galore, with crab, avocado and cucumber. Soooo Goooooood. This is really amazing. We ordered this on our two nights we were at Kaizen.  *Kiss of Fire: If you like Spicy...you'll love this roll. Inside: there's crab, avocado and cucumber... Topped with Spicy Tuna, White Fish, Jalapeno. Sauce: spicy garlic ponzu and hot sauce..... Down this with Asahi or a shot of Sake. you're good.  *Kaizen Roll: Who doesn't agree that anything deep fried is just oh. so . good??? and unhealthy? whatever sushi pooper. This roll is a must try as well. IN: Deep fried soft shell crab, lobster, avocado, asparagus, yamagobo,cucumber, radish sprouts.. Topped with Tuna, Salmon and Yellowtail. sauce: eel sauce.  *Chicken Teriyaki Bowl: Even their Chicken Teriyako Bowl is not ordinary. It's yuuuummmmy!!!!  What i like about this Sushi Joint is that...it's not over-rated and doesnt try to be fancy shmancy like other sushi joints on the strip. They keep their quality and deliver freshness fish after fish..after fish. Service is fast and excellent. Prices are decent. Fish cuts are thick and generous. Selection is different and unique.  Definitely recommend this place to Sushi Lovers in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiss of Fire
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c083f6hfR81k_BG3GNjfpQ.text: This place is amazing! Friendly staff, good music, contempo/urban decor with sporting events on tvs. Great happy hour specials! Definitely coming back when I'm in town. Bonzai!

0KbJKbHuwJRIVuCmCrUXpg.text: Rock and Roll sushi is so good taste is refreshing good service and fast love it the spicy tuna salad is sooo good too

gfhKgYhx03cH3IrnkCgb0g.text: As soon as me and my boyfriend walked in we were immediately served , the place is beautiful and great customer service ! Will deff come back here for our sushi !

CNjaCm71hoHEcWrzHI8deQ.text: I love eating here. They usually have some sort of special fresh fish like tonight blue fin tuna. I don't know why more people from hard rock don't venture over here. Its way better than most of the places over there and right across the street.

Hxayxt4oqQVoOdgOp_SPqQ.text: Freshest fish. Perfectly steamed edamame (not mushy). Great service. Oh, and ORANGE BLOSSOM ROLL.  That is all you need to know.

uFAqCl_FL8giSXneoTkt0w.text: Very clean and modern ambiance. Friendly staff and well priced rolls. They offer a diverse combination of rolls with various seafood and meats, as well as entrees, desserts, and drinks. You can sit at the bar or tables.

Y_RE0iFS2y-JAu_2u_4XPw.text: Kaizen is a great sushi spot in Vegas that fits right into the lifestyle here as it is open until 4am on weekdays and 6am on weekends.  When I used to work on the strip Friday/Saturday and get off work at 4am we would always hit up this place routinely for some good food and a drink after work to wind down.   They have a nice sushi bar inside and plenty of tables for small or large groups. The lighting is dimmed a bit and there is always music playing giving off a fun vibe. I've become friends with quite a few of the staff that work here.  Good people, good service.   The food is really good and the rolls are good sized. They have some great rolls like Silver State, Orange Blossom, Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna, Avacado Train, Super White Tuna is really good too. Everyone I have ever taken to Kaizen from out of state while visiting us has really enjoyed it.   There are a few Kaizen restaurants in Vegas but this one is by far my favorite. It is located right beside the Hard Rock Hotel 7 Casino.  When or if I start working on the strip at nightclubs again I will definitely be returning to Kaizen on the regular.

vpixF1F3UUvWZArvPpaM_A.text: I don't yelp... but this place was so good I am sitting at the table writing how amazing the sushi is! Screw Nobu. Walk across the street!

FwZtkePXAXZRwbjwZ3QmUw.text: The Mister and I are staying at Hyatt Place and wanted sushi and spotted Kaizen from our hotel window. We get here and there is a sign that reads 'Voted best sushi in Las Vegas." We are excited but when we walked in, it was empty at 1 PM on a Saturday and was reluctant to try.  I was pouting because I wanted AYCE sushi but the mister noted quality is more important than quantity and he was right!! I ordered the Kaizen roll...it was such a marriage in my mouth!!! Try it! Also their green tea ice fream doesnt taste powdery but creamy! Their portions are generous as well. The mister ordered sashimi 10 piece and he vouched the fish was fresh.  The place looks like it is more for the dinner crowd judging by the many speakers and projectors.  They got my vote for best non AYCE sushi in Vegas so far!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zzabnev-xmvmXU24S5hzIA.text: The beef tataki is so good, only place I've seen this dish and I loved it. Sunday through Thursday happy hour 12 - 4,  BOGO all alcohol.

6Ds-yBZko3LE8cLW2kvtSw.text: Awesome food.  Love this place!  It's open late and the service is excellent.  They were great with customizing the rolls to our wishes.  Highly recommend.

4eaOc651DMMhbSPElx1uAA.text: Yup! Super good. Highly recommend the "sexy roll" good roll, great sauce. Late night happy hour for late night revellers.   Buy one get one for ALL ALCOHOL from midnight to 4am sun thru Thursday.

f7vPBdZ-f5G7G8Zwx6tonA.text: Came here randomly late on a Tuesday - the service and decor was good, but the sushi (rainbow roll and kiss of fire) was pretty poor. Will definitely not return!

qdWkGGehMNMLMqHtQuD0fA.text: Happy to return.  This time sashimi. How do they get such fresh fish in the desert and I live by the beach local restaurants do not compare?

s32TYPQDpO95iX5vAdHNCw.text: Came here for dinner for the first time. No wait. ordered our food. our hot sake and beer, appetizer, and one of our entrees came out. Forty minutes later, still no food. We ask our server to check up on it. He never came back. We asked another server and he took care of us. Eventually we got all our food and he gave us 3 more hot sakes on the house, which made it a little better. I was super hungry to begin with, so I was not in a good mood at all and I couldn't enjoy the sushi I ordered because I ate everything so fast. This review is based mainly on poor customer service. Food was average.

92n75vGRTlB5mZHj7VC00w.text: Very attentive service with great food.  Had the server suggest a few popular rolls and we were not disappointed.   Clam miso soup, orange blossom and TT rolls were excellent!  Will recommended when in Vegas.

v60V_mP5ICll-42uBS0fkQ.text: Very good tempura and the service was excellent. It is dark when you walk up to the building, but inside the decor is super chic. Great place for a date, girl's night, or to just grab lunch. My friends got sushi, and enjoyed everything!

IGiVQXVvTkg0vgzeaDd-1Q.text: Thanks Yelp for helping me find this great sushi place! The flavors were wonderful and the fish was so fresh. Gotta say it was much better than a lot of places at my home town...and I'm right by the ocean!  The service was excellent; friendly and fast. Love that it's open super late, too. Will definitely be back next time in Vegas!

_L8Ydw-RJ99e_HwESlLxGg.text: We have eaten multiple times at Kaizen and they never disappoint, fish is fresh and the staff is friendly and prompt! Being from LA we are blessed with great sushi and don't eat sushi in the casinos so it was great to find Kaizen a few years back on one of our trips to Vegas!

Ald4yqD91vgYXt4rnFBslA.text: Very fresh sushi. I had the Mexican roll and ate every bit of it. Fast service and a must to visit!

7yDyqkWljulM6Hw3-DSv1Q.text: Probably the best sushi I've had and I've tried several spots in LA. sushi is fresh (pleasantly surprised by the real crab in the Rainbow Roll), service is fast, and it's a nice relaxing spot to go before you start your night! May even be back here later since they're open til 6 am.   Very close to the Hard Rock!  Looks like our new go-to spot for sushi when we come here.

v6RHBEqjA6HUNOb5k6dEkw.text: Went in for lunch on a weekday. Had the spicy salmon and Sunrise rolls. Rice was pretty stale--being that it was lunchtime, I'm assuming this was last night's rice :-/  The taste and the freshness of both were good. I was the only one in here so service was not surprisingly good and fast.  Would've given 4 stars if they had fresh rice.

dl3DCoSXtYt3GNXuVSaIeQ.text: Ok let start off that this place is probably where they invented sushi and the Japanese stole the idea from this establishment can't tell you how many times I go to this place everytime I go to Vegas but the amount of different sushi rolls they have are very unique  Happy Hour on drinks start at midnight Monday through Thursday and it's the best place to go and get budget stuff I do my sake bombs and then head out to the club after  Here are the things I tried so far Bbq roll - out of this world

u0fvoC2TTyD4tArRJkyhEQ.text: Late night fun with buy one get one free sake. Sushi is good fun place to be plus it's open late so that's a real plus

Kq2SD9g6QE6lSxYL-EWnjA.text: The restaurant is super clean and modern.  Hip and electric Music is playing in the background. Servers are nice and I would recommend this place to anyone.  The sauce can be on the sugary side fyi. Ivan was super nice.    Request him.

vMzjZnk7XJIIENuBThwv7g.text: Yelp, you're fired. Four stars?! All I wanted was non-AYCE sushi, rated decently,  and near the strip. Jesus H. Christ! It's a fail when you come into a restaurant starving and you leave with everyone in your party invoking the Lord's name with his middle initial.*  Things started out okay with them seating us promptly. We drooled over the menu and ordered enough to feed every child in Botswana. It went downhill from there. The first piece of sushi, two pieces of uni, took almost an hour to get to our table. WE WERE WASTING VALUABLE GAMBLING TIME! Everyone at the craps table is depending on me to get back in the game.  The sushi man was a little stingy. It wasn't like I was ordering a 49 cent taco from Del Taco in South LA and then complaining to the cashier, and then to the manager that there wasn't enough meat in my sub-dollar taco, all the while getting approving "um-huh"s from my significant other standing behind me. You know? They could've been slightly more generous.   What's funny is I think they were Thai. Thai reminds me of Thailand. Thailand reminds me of my vacation to Phuket. In Phuket, we journeyed to a steakhouse that was highly, I mean HIGHLY, rated by Tripadvisor. So I thinks, maybe we's getting a good deal on expensive steak. My partner orders a ribeye, bone-in, because that's how us gangsters roll. The waitress retorts, "Just to let you know, it's a little chewy." My partner responds, "What do you mean?" Waitress says, "Are you Malay?" My partner, looking confused, says, "No." Waitress replies, "Have you had a steak before?" HAHAHA. Okay, screw you guys. It was funny at the time.  ANYWAYZ. You're better off going to some of the better AYCE in Vegas and not stuffing your face. You'll pay the same amount, or less, and get better quality sushi.  *In almost a decade spent in church, they never taught me what what Jesus's middle initial stood for, although the whispers say it may be Herbert, but it wasn't from me.

N2cV9TOnyrfiO9ioPn_X6g.text: This place suck, everything I order taste fishy!!!!, they are over price! Server was impatient to answer question about their menu! These people did not care about me! We Will not return!! Ever!

kPTc0v_ehFlYCbJ_WssCJQ.text: The service is crazy fast and the polar opposite of "chatty"...which I liked. The rolls were tasty and there is a huge selection. Really, the only thing they could improve is to get fountain drinks. I'm annoyed by paying $2.50 for a can of Coke that obviously is not refillable. We were seriously blown away by how fast they got our food out to us.

2adSjeLblwCcQZKk9JqMEg.text: This sushi house has a relaxed atmosphere, fresh sushi, and good service. I will be back for sure. Thanks for the free roll!

_Xa1byy5DN_CWD-Wz_kEew.text: Fantastic place to take a lunch break on a hot afternoon. Very quick service and tasty items. Great ambiance as well!

PcPZQU5UNpHZ-tBclwqjfg.text: Off the strip and reasonably priced. Friendly wait staff. The saketinis and avocado train are must-haves!! Absolutely delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nevada roll was very tasty
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delish avocado train

wS0E7kIyoo3QEyAduVRxVQ.text: This place is fantastic! Delicious food, great service, and a wonderful atmosphere. I highly recommend.

7wZD4MywNS-SL4bsz_ad0Q.text: This place is a most pleasant surprise! It's in a little strip mall, a 5 min walk from Hard Rock and The Alexis. Quick, friendly, attentive staff. I like the layout and how they compartmentalized the "booths". Food comes quick. Quality sushi so good i had to order same thing twice (snow white roll, YUM) cos my bf devoured the first plate even before he got his own (banana roll). One thing i really liked is that the rolls were tight so things aren't falling around the plate.  This place makes me think we've been to the wrong places! Lol

vQlRYb7lVC4EMqHSsBjzbw.text: Most fairly priced sushi anywhere close to the strip. An okay selection of rolls and kitchen entrees as well as great, fast service. Would gladly return here if we stay at the same hotel next year.

b7UNDbIZ_sO4iywQfLfd4g.text: First time here and this place is great. Food is amazing and atmosphere is good. Will definitely be back

S21lJbF2AuV54hNlB2PhCQ.text: I saw the amazing reviews and really craved sushi so I came here with my mom. I hardly go to vegas so I'm not familiar with anything. Everything on the menu looked really good and sounded appetizing. Or it could've been that I was starving. We ordered a few plates. The seared salmon appetizer was way too salty. I had to tell them to take it back. And all the items on the menu was mainly tuna. Halfway eating I was starting to get sick of the smell and taste of tuna. This experience wasn't what I hoped for. If I'm ever in vegas, I probably wouldn't come back.

Ki5hWPmMj_D9cYWX8_pc4g.text: When it comes to food service and price point I would give Kaizen Fusion Roll five stars as far as customer services goes however they'll come in rolling at a 1 lowly star. So this review will average itself out at 3 stars.   Here's the situation. My friend and I went driving around looking for a place to eat at around 4a and yelped the nearest location. Boom Kaizen popped up near UNLV.   The food, for the price is awesome, I got a baked salmon roll. Delicious. Unlike all the other all you can eat places here and original. He got some type of calamari roll and something else.   Adding an $11 lychee flavored sake and a green tea tempura ice cream (but they don't serve vanilla flavor which didn't really make any sense to me but who am I...) who couldn't be more pleased?  Well... let's start from the beginning.   The serve here was beyond poor. Upon entrance the two girls that we were working had just the most unengaging attitudes and missed so many marks. I had to ask 3 times for the same 7UP, the miscommunication was so obviously there that the poor service just had to be mentioned.  I mean and I'm not to be a stickler about table courtesies, but all the servers that took our dishes away or served us just stuck their whole bodies right between both my friend and I - based on my memory as a server, aren't you supposed to come around the side or wouldn't that just make more sense? Anyway - it was an odd experience. Given I understand it's 5:30 in the morning at that point everyone wants to go home and they're shoving people out, but the place is still an establishment and the restaurant clearly strategically placed itself across certain hotel&casinos for a reason, but the place was dead on a Saturday night for obvious reasons...  I mean it's obviously not the food, the food is great and decently priced.  Worth it if it's LAST LAST minute late night dinner and you're near the UNLV campus.

O1j2gbMTBzDV68rac9AcIw.text: Fresh and delicious sushi walking distance from the Hard Rock Hotel. Extremely affordable price. I've been here over a dozen time in the last couple years. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

apVXMZMXnVKqO5TN2EeAhQ.text: Food was mediocre. Service was HORRIBLE! Even though there only a couple of other customers and we sat at the bar. Too expensive for the quality. Take my advice, skip this place and go to Sushi-wa in Henderson or I love Sushi.

MTtQOQMKWKCQJLg6ulwQHw.text: Awesome food and many varieties of sushi and other items. Service is excellent always greeted as soon as you enter the door and a nice place to go late night.

This is a gem of a place that is solid and creative, about 1 mile off the strip.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are above average.  You'd pay almost twice the amount on the strip.  I'm a huge sushi fan in places all over the country.  Excellent dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi platter $19.95, and the fish quality was excellent.

mmeKJy4lCMSRDZTZOkAn3Q.text: Love this place!! Food is always fresh and the service it great. They are open late, so we end up here all the time.

06Myqpb6MsG1O4zEhURryA.text: Came here late starving. Sat down and ordered. Food came unbelievably fast with great quality. Definitely exceeded my expectation! Recommended!

6kXBPqSBKt4FC5mVqo_B6Q.text: I come here to Kaizen all the time!! Great Sushi, great customer service!! There is a Kaizen Sushi near my home and I go there all the time...i even went for my birthday! I definitely recommend Kaizen Sushi!!

WmliJl93WOoOpO57UMelMg.text: Hands-down, The Best Udon I've ever had. Period.   Living in Pasadena, I'm constantly searching high and low for good quality udon. I don't know why it's so difficult to master. It seems like good ramen is easier to find in LA than good udon.  I had my fingers crossed when I ordered the udon at Kaizen but wasn't expecting too much. But my first taste had me closing my eyes in ecstasy.  I was in heaven.  I was incredibly starving at the time, so that might have swayed my opinion a little, but the broth was delicate and complex and oh-so-delicious. The noodles were the perfect texture.  The only downside is that the service wasn't good.  After waiting forever I had to flag someone down to take our order. Then they forgot our order of edamame. Food took a while to come out too.  But it's all worth it for the Udon!!! YUM!

db9fz4iNj1ULMiPPT_1KKA.text: Unique menu. Lots of interesting choices. Simple but cool atmosphere. Quick service and a great place to go before a flight. Have been here 3x.

vadC8gVSwnkzURWYFEx5MQ.text: They have the best Japanesse Lasagna in town and speciality rolls are awesome.  Prices are great for a place like this.  Clean, good service, and overall a place to visit and eat good sushi.  Thanks to Ivan the server for his service, he did an amazing job!

7FhENO3ptHGUzp1_sQGdGQ.text: The food is great, service is professional and and fast! They also open late so it's great for Vegas! Would definitely recommend this place.

VGlyQu_4zYraK1zWApfF-w.text: Wow, am I glad I stopped by. Very nice atmosphere. Very friendly staff. I really like that the rolls I had had more of the ingredients than the rice. I don't like it when the rice over powers the rolls. I had the Kiss of fire and it was great. I will be coming back time and time again to go down the list of their special rolls.

jE0_P4oryQol2pLF8sCqcg.text: While in town for a work convention my partner and I stopped by for dinner. We were on a budget due to being on work time. Fortunately we both had a decent amount of food for about $50.  The sushi itself was a bit pricey; $8 for an order of salmon sushi. However, their cut rolls were the right price for the money. I had two full sized cut rolls for about 25. Not only was the price right, the chow was DAMN tasty. One roll had a house sauce made of a spicy mayo mix. YUM!!! The one down fall was the sake. I didn't notice a house sake and the cheapest bottle was $10. Now please keep in mind I'm only criticizing this because I'm on the work budget. $10 for a bottle of good sake is very reasonable. I definitely recommend this place for the location; right off the strip; the price, the menu and the quality of the chow. DO IT!!!!

wMsZTcdxsjydtwUAYzWfMg.text: First time at kaizen. Arriving at around 5am and there are still many people eating. Although it doesn't have an AYCE menu , price is decent and food quality is still great!

RuTduK2VFenwvJEBjfNjnQ.text: Such amazing flavor,  the staff was extremely friendly and very quick.   To say the food was outstanding is an understatement.   We had the Zenith roll,,  the orange blossom and sake.   Wow!!!!!!!  We will be back and tell all our friends!!

8RNq6qN48YRi44uORsR0og.text: As a Vegas local, this would be my number one spot to eat and reccomend!!  The Rose roll and white Rose roll are both to die for!!! Fish is fresh; and the way they put it all together, I haven't found a place quite like it, anywhere!!! Also, the screaming O salad, rock & roll, and if you want something more hearty, the avocado train or silver state roll, are both amazing!!!  Great customer service!! I always sit at the bar with Eddie.  He makes everything just right; and, great conversation.  I always feel like I can come there alone if I want, and have a great time; or, bring friends, when they come to town.  Manager always asks how everything is, when I see him...  and the servers are on pointe* soon as I finish my last bite, they grab my plate; and soon as my drink is low, they are there to refill it!!  Locals favorite + right by the strip, across from Hard Rock Casino, so all you crazy tourists should make your way there!! Tell them Amelia sent you ;)

RO03muNNOVQh4aDAneAB3A.text: Kaizen is great. The atmosphere, service, and food can't be beat! Definitely try this place out if you are looking for sushi!

Kyl_wBtz8CWW2Qla02kPOA.text: So far I love the decor and this trendy atmosphere. Very nice with a modern texture. Can't wait to dig into my 2 sushi rolls. They look delicious

SynnV3bC8YtMczJi_yWfKA.text: Incredible Delicious!!! Open late night just across the Hard Rock Cafe without the eye-gouging prices from the strip.  Was actually suggested by the valet at the Cosmopolitan ( In Vegas always pay attention to the suggestions of the Valet and the Taxicab Handlers on the hotels)   Have eaten before at Sushi Roku and Shibuya and this place is as good, maybe even better than those! Try the Unicorn Roll it was amazing and a steal at ($14)  Me and my wife loved it and we will be back.

4YVqShZKs9oveNDYuAo2yA.text: This is our favorite sushi place locally! The staff is super friendly and you can customize the menu on AYCE- a rarity in any sushi restaurant.

H3tDcvYvsSzS-qalc5yUxQ.text: Great service! Very clean and fast service.. Would highly recommend.. We came in they greeted us quickly and friendly. Was seated right away. We had the T.T. Girls and Japanese Lasagna... Best sushi I've ever had!!

djMrkG7SwoMgMIywJ57huQ.text: A little pricier than my guy and I like, but we splurge here every once in a while. Or we'll get our taste in sushi and then fill up on capriottis next door. Definitely recommend the banana tempura roll. Its the reason we go here. Its way super weird but way super delicious, trust me. Always had good service here. They're polite about the fact that we order 6 miso soups.

aFdb_RsFc91ju1jSxzA9Fg.text: Open really late and great sushi  I have stopped in here on numerous times to Vegas. Mainly because i get into town late and after a full day of traveling i need somewhere "non vegas strip" to eat and relax.  There best roll is hands down the "sexy roll" but ill let you be the judge cause there all good. The waitresses are nice and the place has a nice layout. Nice top 40 hits with a huge screen where they play the music video to whatever song is playing. Kinda cool to watch if you dont wanna chill at the bar and watch whatever sports game they have on.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b4-FKI_jX0khRpOyb9H-ew.text: The fiance and I were staying at a near by hotel so we decided to give this place a try.  We were really surprised at how fast our rolls were served. Aside from the fast service this was probably the worse sushi I ever had in Vegas. The rice in the rolls was a bit on the hard sticky side, and every time we picked a roll it immediately felled apart. The rolls were on the smaller side and did not justified the value of the higher prices. The fish didn't tasted very fresh, in fact there was a fishy after taste to it.   I came to the conclusion that the sushi we had was pre-made and had been sitting in a fridge for a while. My suspicion came from the very fast serving after ordering it, literally 3-4 minutes had gone by and we got our first and second roll. Our third roll came in at around the 7 minute mark. The third sushi roll was hot and it tasted like it had been microwaved, probably why the wait time was longer. My fiance and I had the Philadelphia roll, crunchy roll...nothing crunchy about this, and lasagna roll. I was greatly dissatisfied with the sushi and have no plans of ever coming back here again.

DnbNBemy8LYTzWRHxiNR7g.text: Amazing!! This is by far my favorite sushi restraunt in Vegas. The menu is insane so many choices and so delicious. You have to try the Monkey Brains, weird name but its honestly the best thing on the menu!

G6MYFkdMBMpc6ZGAAw-41g.text: Love Kaizen. Come here quite often after hours. Good rolls and prompt service. The staff could be more friendly but I'll deal with it for good food at 4am. They should have a children's menu too, kids are not going to eat a whole bowl to themselves.

GQeK9cXMuFZnQ6jb8PUqBQ.text: This place has stood the test of time! We have gone back multiple times and every single time the food is just as awesome as the last. This is a rarity in sushi, there always seems to be off days at a lot of places, but we have been pleasantly surprised with their consistency in both quality and service!   If you are new to sushi or in love with it as we are, I highly suggest coming here and giving them a try! It might just become one of your go to places !

cWeq7Uu8SuownYoHqqcztA.text: Amazing was referred to here by few locals Lychee Shaketini on point.  Services as all other reviews state is good. We sat at bar. Very modern looking and off strip so prices are good

uTpPJck4y28EhAJOAyrdhw.text: Beware of 24 hour sushi places - even in Vegas.  Tried to give us something that was supposed to be tempura shrimp but was actually panko then redid with the same veggies which came out overdone.  Forgot the chicken karaagi - then when it finally came out when we were done it was these odd little pieces, NOT karaagi.  Take heed.

6yW3keDh2jMZd5J1Wa42dA.text: I ordered Unagi Chirashi. It's awesome. The portion is bigger than I expected. There are 8-9 slides of unagi with delicious sauce. Price is also reasonable. Recommended! Unfortunately, checking process is tooooooo slow as there is only 1 waiter (who knows everything) handling all table.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4g--jQhUxXknPrrjAex_5A.text: I was staying at the nearby Hard Rock Hotel and the dealer overheard my party discussing whether or not to put in a reservation for Nobu that same evening.  She recommended that we come to Kaizen instead, strongly insisting that we could get the same quality sushi for a quarter of the price.  I was sure she was exaggerating, but figured that if her recommendation fell somewhere in between complete hyperbole and the truth it would still be a worthwhile risk.  This was one of the best meals I've ever had in my life, and Kaizen will be on my go to list whenever I'm in Vegas.  They have more "riceless" rolls than I have ever seen, each one more delicious than the next - this isn't the typical crab meat stuffed into a cucumber you'll get at most sushi restaurants.  The Scallop Volcano Roll integrated mushrooms in a manner I had never before seen at a sushi restaurant, and I'm not ashamed to add that I was drinking the mushroom broth afterwards like soup - it was simply amazing.  Is the quality better than Nobu?  Of course not.  Is the taste on par?  Yes, definitely.  Add in the 2 for 1 happy hour and this is the best combination of value and taste in Las Vegas.

cjJ1cU8uhP0wNl0NVJDzkg.text: Sit at the sushi bar and you will immediately notice that something is off. The counter height is at least a half-a-foot too high - check it out.  Their spicy crab hand roll ($5.50) looked something out of a scary anime movie. It was a crumpled up sheet of imitation crab soaked in a warm red mystery sauce sloppily stuffed into a sheet of nori. By the time it was handed to me it was soggy and clearly unappetizing. I've *never* seen a spicy crab hand roll look like this. I would even go as far as saying it was really gross. I dare say it tasted even worse than it looked - warm, chewy, and messy. Somewhere in Japan, this has got to be considered illegal sushi.  Our sushi chef's demeanor was deadpan and straight up unfriendly. I tried to give him the benefit of the doubt but we soon caught his drift and decided to leave after another order (a scallop sushi roll which was ugly as shit, and made without care).  Just when I thought we cut our losses and were off to another establishment to save our supper, I was given the "Sorry, sir, our system is down, can you pay with cash?" What complete crap. I should've called their bluff. It's been 5 years since I've encountered that in Vegas. Visa, Mastercard Inc., and the Better Business Bureau should be notified.  The industry folks love this place, and I don't understand it. Avoid at all costs.

aYc3V8D--_WOerasPCXBZw.text: My favorite sushi place in Vegas. Great service and selection, near the Hard Rock hotel.

m9W10oSW8O9qOuCIvDbMWQ.text: Definitely worth checking out. It's crowded and always busy but easily the best sushi spot in Aliante. Get the AYCE and try all they have to offer. We came specially for Min, sushi chef, he is a master of his craft.

ZSzSnoX4htScoszNeVKncw.text: Really beautiful place with great sushi and a lovely staff. Great place for our sister date, glad we ventured off the strip for this one!

zk86GivgBOTwj-_hMg36eg.text: Its open late. location has good easy parking. Stay away from the thai food. but everything else is ok.

OHAi1fNQW3lhtiP3nFhfrg.text: Me & my wifey have been here more than once. First time it was so good. Now this is the 3rd time and it was clearly not the same. Crab Lettuce wraps were not fresh they taste different from the first time. Service was okay could be that it was a little busy.. the cooks are always great.

JmJhAvkAxLKLMNmkeeOETA.text: Ordered the tuna sashimi plate didn't care for it.  Ordered the double yellowtail roll, didn't enjoy that as well. Ordered the kiss of fire it was good but not great.   I've been to kaizen a few times, usually it's on point and decent quality.  This time I don't feel like that was the case. Tuna sashimi was warm and fish did not look fresh. That kinda put me off on the whole meal.

T1pRjo8wXgdkFjjw5hEiEA.text: Kaizen is at a great location. We came because it was very close to our hotel after we got to Las Vegas after midnight, and it was surprisingly amazing! (So I decide to give my first yelp review ever)  The staff was really nice and friendly, he recommended us the avocado train and a few other rolls which were all great. The fish was pretty fresh and the sauce was delicious! Highly recommend the avocado train if you're a big fan of avocado :)  They also had happy hour which we could buy one drink and get another free :)

yzokffqR7Ipg5zJetuwH_g.text: Great happy hour late night and wonderful service  the sushi is exquisite and delicious.

8rb6O2KIJcG8JyujEFe4oA.text: Been here a number of times over the past few years. Always a must have.  The service is great and the food is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oHu68Tp33x0FCov8tnAEVw.text: We stopped by for dinner. Elegant atmosphere, modern, attentive service. We asked for the chef's recommendation and very quickly the roll Kiss of Fire appeared along with 10-piece sashimi. The roll has slices of jalapeno and a dab of hot sauce, and along with a vinegary sauce was full of flavor, without completely masking the flavor of the tuna, which had a fresh, buttery texture.   The sashimi tasted fresh, nice texture without any gristle and interesting sauces. Our favorite was yellowtail with a wasabi sauce.   Tempura green tea ice cream was perfect, firm ice cream with just the right thickness of batter.   Service was quick, friendly and polite. I think we are coming back tomorrow :)

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiss of fire roll. It kicks!

-XSVbzpYIZQ8tKr_YbOHMA.text: My new favorite sushi place!  I tried it for the first time this weekend and liked it so much I went back the next night.  They are open late, the sushi tastes wonderful, and the prices are fair.  I can't wait to visit Vegas again so that I can eat here.

hdfwkAOFnUazs2uSHeyvYw.text: I found this place using yelp during our recent visit to Vegas.  The great part about this place is the late hours.  Me and my hubby was hungy at a late hour so I yelp the place and was pretty satisfied with the place.  Service was awesome.  It's close by the strip.  Awesome sushi and good food.  I would definitely go back there when visiting =)

pqmTTGAYaMBEAsYlf52nmA.text: WORST customer service ever. I got there one night and paying the bill, I was told my credit card was declined. So I gave another one. The day after I checked my bank account and noticed I was charged on BOTH cards. I called and I was told to wait few days and the charge on the first card would have disappeared. I waited... nothing changed. I wanted to talk with the manager, but apparently this guy is NEVER available. I called and went there in person several times with my bank statements printed out, none could solve the issue. Eventually spoke with the manager, who told me to send to his email copy of my bank accounts with the statement showing (like I have all this time to waste? Do they think Im making this whole deal up for 26$? What about giving me a free meal and PEACE OUT?). I did emailed him all documents...He NEVER answered back. Called again, he was not at the restaurant. I'm so pissed that I've wasted all this time and got robbed. It's just unfair. Be aware of how they treat their clients!

h8D8KJFC8m0IkM41pcjVCg.text: Found this restaurant when we were staying at the Hard Rock Hotel (another story) and needed a place to have dinner. It was within walking distance & after checking it out on Yelp and seeing some good reviews, we gave it a try. Very good sushi & the manager and wait staff were very nice & attentive. We both had sushi & edamame and I also had miso soup.  We were both full when we left & the bill was about $40, including my ice tea and my husband's beer. We would eat here again if we were in the area, but since we would never stay at Hard Rock Hotel again, that most likely won't happen. If you like sushi and are stuck at HRH, this place should be on your list.

dOX1QCfZ6wzPMmVmxD37wQ.text: Best sushi on the west coast.  Fish is always fresh and the Korean BBQ roll is fantastic.  Located across from Hard rock.  This place is a must try. Inexpensive especially compared to the strip and a good staff too. Also they are open until 5am so after a late night of drinking definitely the place to be.

yo_jklP2UAfWI5EhzPxzjg.text: They now have a section where rolls are half off.  The last time I've eaten here was probably 2 months ago.  So hopefully they will still have it.  I thought this place was just a little expensive.  They do have a lot of creative sushi/dishes.  I see I'm writing for the paradise location.  This location has been much more busier.  The henderson location seems to be slower and less crowded if that suits you.

GWtLxKTzEt9HCwGgj3BEEg.text: I've been here a few times and let me just say, avoid on Saturday nights at all costs. The atmosphere is awful, a trashy crowd lingers and don't forget the extremely loud and cheesy music, its uncomfortable for anyone wanting a dinner where you don't feel like you are in a college-esque nightclub. The hostess couldn't be any ruder either, saying we couldn't get our food at the bar, and then she changed her mind after we were seated at a table- its like we are at a sushi bar at a strip mall not the Queen of Englands quarters, no need for the snobbery. Anyways, the sushi chefs are awesome and very friendly, and any other day or time is great to grab a bite to eat here, they also have Saketinis that are soooo adorable and delicious.

qLEvXdYOGEDFZynWg_8ROA.text: the sushi was a'ite.. but way way way overpriced.  we've had better at an all you can eat joint.    it's clean.. and the service is good,  but nothing wowed me or made it stand out... the names of the sushi were clever!  i'd probably never go back.  plus i think it's overpriced.  it was ok.

Pad_u_DkUy480JMP51ueMg.text: Great sushi.  Terrible service. The restaurant is set up very nicely.  We were seated in an elevated area between two other tables.  We waited about 10 minutes before any employee came by.  We were ready for drinks and to order when a server came to a table next to us (only because a diner at the table hollered for her to stop by).  She almost walked away when one of our diners asked her to come to our table because we were ready to order.  She told us she wasn't our server and would have him come to our table. A couple minutes later, he arrived.  He suffered through taking our order.  He was writing it down, but we still had to repeat ourselves a couple times.  I had our drink order memorized at that point and slowly said it to him again.  Then we ordered about 7 different items.  We were really worried about getting the right items.   The food began to come to us, before we got our cocktails.  I chose to wait a couple minutes for my drink before I started eating.  We ordered quite a few items, but I only tried a couple.  The cucumber salad was fresh, crisp and delicious.  I thought the beef sashimi was delicious, but my friend thought it was bland.  I had the chicken teriyaki roll and substituted with soy paper.  I highly recommend it.  Inside the roll is piece of chicken teriyaki, crab, avocado, and cucumber and they are placed on teriyaki sauce.  It was delicious!  The best part was the serving of chicken teriyaki with broccoli, mushrooms, and onions next to the rolls.   4 cocktails and 7 dishes came out to about 90 dollars; not bad.  The funny thing was, when we wanted our bill, the gal who said she wasn't our server was able to bring us our check when we asked her to have our server do so.  Next time we're in Vegas and want sushi, we'll probably go here, but sit at the bar for more prompt service. On a funny side note... one of the nearby diners was Carrot Top.

YSYu77Z4FFs3dWK1e0se-g.text: Best late night Sushi in Las Vegas.  Great service every time.  I recommend the rattle snake roll.

fQogmdTcvW7O47TM1NKlIg.text: another one of my great finds! just like firefly. delicious!  if ur in vegas, def plan a pit stop.

pygLrEJYAdsk-paiCn21hg.text: ok this review may have been blurred by my inebriation as well as my company at the time, but it was a damn fine experience.  what better than hot tea, cold sake and fresh sushi at 5am after a silly night of drinking?  i never thought sushi was a good late night food, but i guess anything can when its that late.  yeah, this place is open till 6am on the weekends.  this whole concept intrigued me.  i didn't even mind hearing the new britney cd in its entirety...  for our dinner (breakfast?) she had a house salad with some wild dressing i sampled that was very good.  the best roll we ordered was some scallop roll served in a sauce of curry with mushrooms...awesome.  i deducted one star b/c i was very excited for the korean bbq roll (i'm a huge, huge fan of short ribs) and it didn't do anything for me, too chewy for a roll...was terribly disappointed.  otherwise, food was excellent.  the hot tea was good, i don't know why i drank more but the sake after a whole night of drinking was strangely appealing.    like i said, i ate up this whole experience.  the newest fan of sushi and sake at 6am!

J-9tab-RaNYvZMRwkn8SDA.text: Awesome quality on all sushi. All fresh. The food was amazing.....but a bit over priced and bad service. I will come back just because of the hours, open late and great food.

SjTZXs2kezEPX0htf9AHVA.text: Took Yelp advice and this was the closest place to eat.   Couldn't print their coupons but they said they would honor them....NOT!!  We ordered sake bombs because we had coupons and they only honored one and called it a birthday coupon, after telling us both were free.  Food was good, presentation great, service not so amazing.  We aren't the Hard Rock crowd, but came for food and deserved better service.  The presentation was amazing and the sushi good, but the service lacked for us old ladies.

sF0gjlPa4C06YjsAgZrmEA.text: The best value food I've had in Vegas- minus the taxi ride to get there. It's located way off strip- in a 'strip mall' across the street from Hard Rock Hotel. If you are staying at the Hard Rock, simply walk across the street to try the ridiculously good spicy tuna roll covered in tuna and dripping with roe sauce that they call the "Sexy Roll". I also tried the Scallop Volcano- a california roll exploding with tons of cooked mushrooms, scallops and spicy yummy sauce.  There are a lot of unique rolls with chicken or other cooked foods inside.  Sit at the bar and talk to one of the cool Japanese sushi chefs.  Good for large groups coming over from the hotels etc...

iXMDo_qmHw8KeMgzoa0pug.text: Recently went here again and it was just as good. I can't get enough of this place! I love that they have a DJ (I don't know if that's a regular thing, I was there at about 12 on a Saturday). The place is open until 6 am on Saturday, which is awesome. It's a really fun place to go and they make the sushi pretty quickly. We ordered the Hawaiian roll (it's very different than it is at other places), the baked salmon roll, 1 oyster shooter, and the Rainbow roll (the total was $45..not too bad). And of course it was all very delicious.

Eshx_co_lCm_VgPkWszdnQ.text: I really enjoyed this sushi spot!!!  I went here with my girlfriends at midnight on a Sunday night.  The sushi is very fresh and tasty.  I ordered the Salmon Tempura Roll and loved it.  I tried little bites from all my friends' food and it was soooo good. I love how they played music videos! Perfect way to get pumped for a night out.  We walked across the street to party at Hard Rock.  Would definitely go back!

JdZT2ZGDm1DAIoJVt6VIXQ.text: average sushi and rolls, prices are a little bit on the pricey side... but not too bad.  i guess i went on the wrong night or something cus it was pretty crowded with only two waitresses. service was mediocre... it took me reminding the waitress and even the bus boy 3 times for hot sauce!! ughhh..... i was practically almost done with my rolls by the time i got it.  i even heard the table next to us ask the waitress if they were short on waitresses bc no one has taken their order..... :|

mw2bNGk5qhzjuzCTgo134w.text: Sat at the bar.  A bit of a wait, but great food and friendly service.  Sake and sushi!

xzZ7qpTuL02S1ZxdFhg3hg.text: Good place for sushi i go here for lunch with friends they have good lunch specials and i also can go here at night there open late and its a nice place. Also the fish is always fresh which keeps me coming back.

iYHEV2YUTrp2AkNLo8hdjQ.text: Just plain perfection. The sexy roll is to die for.  On our last trip to Vegas, we ate at Kaizen three times.  Skip Nobu across the street, and come here instead.

kSJTMTPx_uFIjTK6ONpRcw.text: I'm still in love with Kaizen! I hadn't been back to Vegas in a year and a half. I wasn't about to skip going to a Kaizen before returning home. My boyfriend and I ordered the garden salad, octopus and cucumber salad, octopus sashimi, the tuna and shrimp in a cucumber roll, an avocado roll, and a chicken teriyaki roll. We love food! Everything was delicious, so much so that I was ready to go back the next day!! It's nice to get away from the craziness of the strip and have something so close by!

3D5Mlh7KTsBuI5mOAorEpQ.text: Absolutely amazing sushi sushi spot here in Vegas!! Definitely try the KISS OF FIRE ROLL, my favorite. Great staff, great service and the restaurant is beautiful. We came here every time we're in town.

xB2GDnWxJoxbfKfiwClkGA.text: The sushi here was horrible! We ordered two rolls, the dragon roll and California roll.... Both were so small! It's not worth your money.

UGFGCB_HJdhTquoPLtJXOQ.text: Perhaps one of the worst dining Experiences I've had in a long time.  I was part of a large party.  First they got the orders wrong.  Then their Chicken Katsu was dry and tough as shoe leather.  Then came the bill, which they didn't have correct and couldn't separate successfully.  To add insult to injury after each person telling the cashier what they had (in order to pay correctly) they insisted that they were going to add their automatic gratuity to each bill.  #nevergoingback

TIzISNExk_sytn-Wahmq6Q.text: let's start with the food. wtf, so every piece of sushi I picked up break apart before hitting my mouth. I ended up with a soup of ell sauce and rice. second, the service, two servers working together and after ordering more food ( at this point I was so hungry and it was late, I wasn't leaving) so dude takes my order and joy, oh sweet joy. comes by asks if I needed anything. I replied , no I'm good thnx. she comes back with a check. at this point I had to point out there's more food coming. haha I was like wow. not to mention that I asked for a bottle of fiji and she placed it on the table after a few minutes I go and pour it and it was frozen, I mean not a drop can squeeze out. like can you not tell the damn thing is swollen and frozen and she was like " I'm sorry the busser must of left it in the freezer" I'm thinking... didn't you notice? probably she just didn't care. This placed my left nut and joy sucked my right. so at the end of the day, I guess I left happy. lol I definitely don't recommend it and suggest for them to work on service and their sushi chef's or people pretending, really need to get training or start giving a shit.  two thumbs down. never again.

wNKdLeM9Dk9qqUTjAkl87w.text: Decent place... rolls have way too much rice. I mean jeez the rolls were huge! Needed a knife to cut them in half. Flavor was good though. Service was extremely slow.

q8STqpHp5Y82pHMSH4nqFA.text: I love this place, my favorite sushi in Las Vegas.  The mango lobster roll is fantastic.  Only negative is that sometimes it can get weird in there as drunks from the Hard Rock wander in.  Important tip: After midnight, bottles of booze are two-for-one.

f0NaXA4Q5daN2kEa6jOhBQ.text: I really enjoy a sushi fix when in Vegas.  In addition to my standard fare of gyoza and edamame, I have tried a couple different rolls and haven't been disappointed. I haven't eaten in the restaurant, but take-out is quick and the food is packaged for travel well. I will continue to come back.

q0Km3SUe9BV0bFV9OcZ65Q.text: I had RoadRunner delivery from there. I always really enjoy their rolls. Especially the Japanese lasagna. It's the best I've had!

W98BI9NIbsgwt_38KqDQcQ.text: Went here 2 weeks ago as Gangnam Asian BBQ had an hour wait at 9pm on a Sunday.  Based on other reviews, looks like they get overflow from Gangnam often.  Food is mediocre, although plentiful.  Service is friendly but we had different wait staffs coming by.  They check on you verbally but they don't seem to notice that your drinks get low! Overall very average, we don't intend to come back.

U5aaZLHEfCQYiqpIR9FeFw.text: I go to this place a few times a month for dinner because of the tasty food, shockingly good services and reasonable prices. Always stuffed by the time I leave.  Made the decision to go there for lunch and was happily surprised with their lunch menu.  Although I ordered my regular Chicken Teriyaki bowl, my friends ordered the "boxes" which is only available at lunch. Will order the Box next time since you get a lot of different types of food for the same price.  Love this restaurant!!!

9LK4nyNVPpl92Hm9UD94JA.text: The only reason this has 2 stars is because the food was decent, and another waiter came and asked if we needed anything after we had sat there for 45 minutes, waiting for our waitress to come ask us for our order. Then our second waiter forgot about us as well. The food was cold after 2 minutes of getting to us, and we literally almost left them a pile of barf to clean up. $0 tip for you guys! And we are normally the type to give 20-25%

bBifvDbT6cgxCJSv6TYK8A.text: This restaurant has good decor, nice ambiance and looks very clean and hip!  Food is excellent so stop by and get your sushi fix on!  Service is excellent by Ivan!!

4Eo_g3nZ9xKWCI_cUewRDA.text: What a fun little sushi joint. While we were in Vegas for the long weekend, we had a late night (2am) craving for dinner and of course, almost nothing was still open except buffets and Kaizen sushi. Score one for the sushi joint. A taxi driver recommended the spot to me and I have to say he was on point.  Walking in, it's a small place. But the decor is warm and inviting, as are the staff. They were playing music videos and tables full of people appeared to be having a great time doing sake bombs.   Their menu is HUGE. It's almost near impossible to make a choice based on all the yummy pictures and descriptions. But I settled on the Japanese steak and veggies (yummy shiitake mushrooms) and my friend ordered the albacore and the beef tataki (sp?) The food was so delicious that even as we stuffed ourselves silly, we made sure to wrap up the leftovers and take them back to the room.   The price was affordable, service was quick, knowledgable and friendly, and they called us a cab to go back to the room. And did I mention they're open until 3am? Kudos. I'm definitely a fan and will return next time I'm in Sin City.

CzJixUQsFCJkNizsdJr3cg.text: Came in on a Sunday evening for dinner and was greeted well and seated quickly. Not a super busy place during the evening/dinner time which is nice because we needed someplace low-key to eat. Being from the Pacific Northwest, I am picky with seafood and sushi and I was impressed with the sushi here. The tuna was very fresh and the roll was made well. My friend got salmon and it was delicious and fresh. The price is not crazy which is also what attracted us here. Overall great place to have a low-key dinner.

tPLbamqhze0_NkKU6LBrDw.text: I tried the tiramisu glass for dinner tonight but I didnt expect the ice cream consistency. When it comes to tiramisu, I preferred a warm sponge cake texture better.

O5tXZOwcfrqVv4adGzFTlg.text: Friends and I decided to come here for some sushi since it was close to our place where we were staying at. Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi is located in a little shopping center. Inside they have nice decor with TV's, plenty of tables, a projector screen, and the sushi bar being visible wherever you sit at. The lighting is dim but it had a nice feeling to it. I ordered the KAI and Rainbow roll. Both tasted fresh and it was tasty. I thought the prices of the food was decent. The service was great because you didn't need to ask for a refill and the lady was polite and respectful. If you have a craving for sushi try this place out.

MW7PpGGghBBXBdTjT1JdFA.text: Every time I eat sushi in this city I'm mad at myself. It's always bad. Always.   This time it was the worst. The yellowtail sushi was boring and the rice was stale. The salmon hand roll; uninspiring. The spider roll came out cold. Not warm, not cool.  COLD. It had been in the fridge. The fried crab was soft and soggy, not warm and crunchy. It was horrible. As in the worst sushi roll ever. I don't even know how the sushi 'chef' looks himself in the mirror. He should be ashamed.   The server took my order but demanded I also write it down on their silly paper myself to keep track of what I ordered.   That, and I never did get that glass of water I asked 2 different people for.

tabDB8SsbSQdWD60uvyGHg.text: Great sushi place! I am hooked and it's right next to campus. I will definitely be back for more and I plan to bring many of my friends. This was a great choice for dinner

iZpGUVjXke9Tl1B6NQ7_Ww.text: Great service and even better food! We had the T.T girls roll and the Nevada roll and they were delicious! Try this place if you are here!

Ha0tCnZ5IM9WxEpZZAIaSg.text: We do a lot of sushi while traveling on business. Kaizen is amazing in quality and presentation while being a fraction of the big hotel sushi costs. 5 stars.

qZT1gpoEOh-7lakyzrXqXQ.text: Lots of selections and everything is good! Shogun roll and dragon roll are so delicious!! The atmosphere the the place is decorated really nice. Price is very reasonable for good sushi! Love the music too. Awesome place!

bIClpcC5U260c7cWgOKLnQ.text: Kaizen is our favorite sushi restaurant in all of Las Vegas.  Been coming here for years.  The freshest fish in the city, the best service from waitstaff and sushi chefs and just recently discovered their wallet-friendly lunch specials (12-3 pm).  Love their schedule--they're open until 4 in the morning!!  Great for entertainers to come after spending a late night working..

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi lunch special

C9z_NGRwtf1dFOdal65goQ.text: Kaizen on Paradise Rd is great. I like there Japanese Tai and the Blue Fin Toro melts in my mouth. The price is good compared to the strip restaurants. Must come try this place out

Ab9xB04jdi3Elq2vqTk0UQ.text: I was disappointed when I came in there to eat horrible service I was just sitting there waiting for sombody to take my order or ask me if I need anything and for 25min nobody said anything just looked at me so I got up and walked out in I will never go eat there and I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

ZdGBdVQeEHIAo0sMhveL0w.text: I used to love this place. I would frequent this place at least once or twice a week. Any special celebrations I would tell my friends and family to go there. Anyway we came in with a party of eight and were told to wait for a table to be put together. We waited for about 20 minutes. Finally I told them we don't need to be seated together. We just need two tables. The lady said the available tables are reserved for reservations. I was like OK?!  There were six tables available and she kept insisting they are reserved for reservations. So I told the lady no worries we'll go somewhere else. She said OK bye. Which to me was funny because obviously she didn't care about customer service. We drove down a couple streets to I LOVE SUSHI. THE PLACE IS FANTASTIC!!!

StlK99Psll82T66VXTH9yw.text: First Impressions: Clean place. Nice decor. Good atmosphere. They have a TV. It's a nice and quiet place, but there weren't many people there, so it might be different when it's packed.  About me: I'm Japanese. I love sushi. I go out to eat sushi once a month or so by myself. I was in Vegas just for the weekend.  Summary: I went at around 8:30 pm, and they were out of uni & toro. I ordered mainly nigiri sushi and not much stood out. I also got the chicken katsu, which wasn't bad but nothing special. Food: 3/5 - Average Service: 4/5 - Good Overall: 3/5  Review: I went at around 8:30pm on a Sunday night with a friend. I made a reservation twenty minutes beforehand, but the place was almost empty when we arrived. The first things I always order at a sushi bar are toro and uni. They were both out, but it was 8:30pm, so it was understandable.  I started out with albacore belly, mackerel, salmon, ikura, and tuna. I usually always order albacore belly, mackerel, and salmon as they're a few of my favorite sushi. The ones I had here weren't bad, but they didn't taste great either. I was here with a friend who doesn't eat sushi as often, so I ordered the tuna (something common) and ikura (slightly obscure) for him as well. The tuna and ikura tasted better than I expected, but my expectations were set a little low after eating their albacore belly, mackerel, and salmon. I may have ordered something else as well here, but I'm drawing a blank.  I didn't want the bill to get too large, so I ordered chicken katsu to share with my friend. The chicken katsu was a little thin, and they were cut into pieces the size of a pencil (in terms of thickness/width). This is personal preference, but I preferred the pieces to be a little fatter/wider.  I wanted to finish off the night with some more sushi, so I asked the sushi chef for a recommendation and ordered the madai. It was actually pretty good. Possibly the best sushi of the night. I ended up ordering another serving.  The bill came out to be ~$100 for the two of us, which is average for a sushi place (not too cheap, not too expensive). I paid $60 ($10 tip) for the meal.  During the meal, the waitress made sure I didn't run out of my tea (she asked if I would like more when I was low), so that was nice. She also asked us multiple times how our meal was going. So the service here was pretty good.  Conclusion: It's a decent sushi place, but it wasn't good enough to make it a go-to sushi bar every time I'm in Vegas. I think it's worth exploring other options.  Food: 3/5 - Average Atmosphere: 4/5 - Good Service: 4/5 - Good Overall: 3/5 (weighed on food score)  Other thoughts: I went to a sushi place in San Diego called Sushi Ota about a month prior to visiting Kaizen Sushi in Vegas. The sushi at Sushi Ota tasted incredible, so it raised the bar for my future sushi outings. I may have rated Kaizen Sushi higher if I hadn't visited Sushi Ota.

aLR_5YQnn4pLte-VczYVZQ.text: Who doesn't love Kaizen!?!?!?  It's convenient, consistent, and the food is fresh!  Service is always top notch and although they don't offer AYCE, I still walk out very full for about $25.  The staff is really polite and always on top of their game, even when it's super busy and they are clearly understaffed.  The waiters and waitresses they have know the entire menu and restaurant very well + their regulars.  The best thing about this restaurant is the layout and seating options.  When I dine with friends where we will be talking a ton and want a more private area, the tables on the left offer a nice view of the restaurant without all of the noise and busyness.  When I come alone I either prefer the bar top or the long tables on the main floor area, depending on the mood I am in.    I love the music here and although it can seem a little bit loud sometimes when the restaurant is full and Lady Gaga is playing over the sound system to add to the noise, it somehow seems fitting to the energy of the servers here.    I really do wish Kaizen would start doing an AYCE menu at least during certain hours.  Their sushi is really fresh and if they offered AYCE, I would likely get more nigiri than rolls as their nigiri and hand rolls seem quite pricey for being so small.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California hand roll and Hawaiian roll.

5u8M3kupZgTyePEX1275yQ.text: Excellent service, great menu and very friendly attentive staff! Our favorite place for when we are in the mood for sushi!

f1vG3o9kGwyQpwx3fD1NYQ.text: Great happy hour: buy 1 get 1 free drinks. Sushi is fresh, and chicken katsu tempura roll is delicious. And it's open 24 hrs!

rVdwdGyU4vm-zn8Uw0y9-w.text: The ambiance is great. When we walked in they seated us immediately, our food was very good and served to us very quickly, our waiter was very attentive to our needs, and I will definitely be back again. I had the Shrimp Killer Roll and it was absolutely amazing!

KnVYzyWkIRfOgJOtH4ntaw.text: Good price for the amount of sushi given. We really enjoyed their fried avocado! We are from out of town and when we come back we will make sure to stop here!

nf7TGWrE93RzbWmK6FiTaQ.text: This place is better than most sushi places that I've eaten at in San Diego. My girlfriend recommended this place to me and I'm so glad she did! We are staying at hard rock hotel and are only in Vegas for one night but I am really glad that we ate sushi here because it blows all the other sushi places in San Diego out of the water.  The rolls are all unique and the chefs make the sauces bring out the best flavor in the fish. The tangy and spicy mayo add delicious character to the already melt in your mouth sushi. You win Las Vegas thank you for this amazing place. King of the ocean, double yellowtail are both amazing!  So is their king crab miso soup, worth every penny!  The cucumber salad came with a sweet crab garnish and really complimented the basic yet fresh cucumber vinaigrette.

pSbq3SWZ92H9YrI8GsaaqA.text: All we ordered ( karaage, gyoza, yellow tail, scallop dynamite, jalapeno poppers & ika yaki, are really tasting good. efl/bdb 6/30/17

Pe2JRfJ0ENiDRe7RbFAHEg.text: This place is always a must visit when we land in Vegas! The food is delicious and the service is always fun. The lighting makes sets the mood along with the killer music. No matter if you're with friends, family or that special someone, Kaizen is the perfect spot for great sushi and a good time!

kuABesHP-CXiKIuwFPQJbw.text: Perhaps the most delicious halibut dinner with roasted veggies I have ever had. Very attentive waitstaff nice atmosphere and we were able to watch the Olympics on a large screen TV. Really exceptional food--would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.

jCp2ayF7HrhBFjEDmK6ceQ.text: Fantastic service and even more fantastic rolls. I recommend Kaizen to all my friends and family! Be sure to get the deep fried cheesecake. It's amazing.

KT6Nv8I32RJEdX3nlkP1lg.text: Great sushi. The menu has a lot of different choices to choose from with all you can eat. I definitely always recommend this place to my friends.

1r0kTpYHeLY0zgUDMu5sVg.text: Kiss of fire roll absolutely to die for!!! I've had the beef tataki as well, can't go wrong with anything here, great vide, great service, my go to spot everything I'm in Vegas. I make sure I stop here! P.s. I live in la and have driven to Vegas ate here and driven back!! A++++++

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The kiss of fire!

gPlCK9dOrry_plvVIJoIzw.text: When we come to Las Vegas the first place we go for good sushi! The jay roll, the spicy tuna roll and the sashimi were very good and not Strip prices. The service is excellent and the restaurant immaculate. Definitely recommend!

XeqaxUAqmARn2fgxcXGG0w.text: The service was horrible. The girlfriend and I decided to try this place since we were craving sushi and it was walking distance from our hotel. The food was mediocre. We will probably not try this place again.

gRek5-tKsOONwvMCvmq4lw.text: I am jealous of you Vegas locals!  You have a place to get sushi at 4AM on the weekdays and up to 6AM on the weekends?!  Yes it is a TAD bit more expensive then other places, but the rolls that we purchased were delicious.   We had Spicy Tuna, Las Vegas, California, and Night roll.  The hot tea was one of the better ones I've tried as well.  Sushi is not overfilled with rice, the crab (if not imitation) in the California roll is not drenched in mayo.   The staff was friendly, and service was good.   It is also easy to order because their menu is loaded with pictures, so if you are not sure, feel free to order with your eyes.  The restaurant is located in a strip mall by the Hard Rock. The inside decor is really "cool" and what I guess I can describe as "fusion". On the outside you wouldn't really think anything of this place, but hey it's whats on the inside that counts. They even have a DJ playing some 90s music for that extra "hip" feel. It was more than welcomed.  For late late late night-- or early morning cravings of Sushi, check this place out.

SJw6Z7jcQziDYH1df254uQ.text: I would recommend this place to any family because they have good food like the udon noodle. It has good service and they are very nice people.

dgNuOG8r66puYWvXpi-bjw.text: Fun little place with good decor. Sushi is good. BIG variety to choose from. Orange Blossom is my pick. Reasonably priced. Strong on service.

BAkbgzZk3w1AhRpbPQKXIw.text: Decent rolls for a decent price.  I would put this on the same level as some of the sushi spots i frequent in the Bay Area.  What puts this place apart is that they're open late, till 6 in the morning!  Also, i was impressed with the service.  We ordered miso soup,  tempura & sushi and got our food in the correct order!  Its a win-win!

9nvju54ygzPT0SCBcbVmcw.text: Excellent sushi. Great for a little stop for a craving or an entire meal.

_-lyz8o5OG5_CVEXtl2Amw.text: It was the afternoon after a crazy night and I was hungry and a bit hungover. I didn't want a fancy place. I didn't want a touristy place. We were staying at the Hard Rock so we dedided to check out the strip mall across the street. Kaizen Sushi was closed at that time, and even though I couldn't see what the inside looked like, the sushi craving kicked in.  We came back later on and I am so glad we did. I ordered a couple of rolls, one being The Hungry Roll.. oh my god! it was enormous.. I would have been good with just that!!  We went back another time with a pretty large group of friends and they were very accomodating. I tried some of the baked rolls, which were delicious and not so heavy as my beloved tempura rolls. Eveyone else's food looked good, and no one had any complaints. I had the Lychee martini which was very tasty. We also got the party started with shots with ty ku.. sooo yummy! I wish they had it in L.A.  Overall, I love how it is nice yet very casual. Also, they have such a big selection of rolls!!!!  My only complaint (which wasn't the restaurants fault) is that we had them call a cab for us and we waited for about an hour and they never showed up. We walked over to the Hard Rock and the taxi line was huge. It was hot and it was annoying..... not the restaurants fault, but something to keep in mind!

0JD58PHykXPTLDNyqC7rAg.text: We ate here when in Vegas for Defcon last year and I LOVED this place! The food was really fresh and the wait staff was really nice and catered to our vegetarian needs.   This experience before I began eating fish again so that was really important to me.  I loved the cucumber Salad (Sunomono) and the way it was served in a martini glass, vegetable rolls, cucumber rolls, avocado rolls, we delicious and plated beautifully as well.  I would definitely come here again especially to hit up the happy hour specials & free sake bombs when you spend $15 :) Yuuuuuummmmy!
