w2A2qW2SJHnt3u4iIVa7WA.text: Super good. Have not been diappointed by anything we have had. Totally recommend this place.

4k0-WMzEdtx9HhDn_ECcUg.text: The environment is calm. Foods are awesome! There are a wide variety of options on the menu. I would highly recommend.

J8Y5qf1zPze8CPQ28Cl_ZA.text: Favorite sushi place by far! I enjoy this location and the one in North Las Vegas. Their garlic edamame is definitely my favorite and would recommend it to everyone. I like going to the one in North Las Vegas because the location is more convenient but also because it has all you can eat.

N4-dQi86YCaR_v0EZkIi2A.text: In a word?   Omnomnom...  Wait? Is that a word? It's a sound, for sure. And we made it a lot devouring our dinner at this great place!  Fresh, plentiful, tasty, creative. Oh man. I have a new favorite, fo' sho'. A little slower than some places (as others have pointed out) but worth it, I think. They take their time to make sure it's executed perfectly. Service with a smile and we lacked for nothing.   The shitake mushroom roll was earthy and perfectly balanced with the crunch of veg and a touch of crispy tempura. Served with some tempura fungi on the side, and it's a complete dish!   The Rose and White Rose rolls have been entered into my foodporn um, brain bank... ;) No rice (perfect for me): it's amazing fish, sauce, and a touch of veg here and there... WRAPPED IN MORE FISH. #winwin  We also had a soft-shell crab roll (the name escapes me and it's not on the online menu) that was similar. More fish wrapped in fish. Really. #happyMuse  We had a few other rolls, including the Rock and Roll, the Firecracker, a crunchy scallop roll (served with additional panko-breaded scallops! Yum!), and an unagi/avocado roll. All very, very good. The sauces were not overly used - Bonus points! - just enough to go with the flavor profiles they were trying to create. No sauce-drowned fishies here!  To taste the fish on its own (as Bentern says in his review, without the "tacky" sauce), we did order some nigiri including salmon, tuna, and uni. The uni, my favorite but not that of my dining companions, was fresh, sweet, and perfect. Always a great sign of a great place, IMHO.  Again I have to point out that I like that they don't pack their rolls with rice (and have a LOT of non-rice options). The menu is *extensive* (the online menu is a fraction of the options you actually have). In addition to the sushi and sashimi, they offer some entrees as well.  I don't mind a lack of AYCE because I don't eat enough to make those "deals" worth it. However, I could see the draw in having something here... They can be on the pricey side. That said, Friday night we had a hell of a meal between the three of us... a ton of great food, a couple cucumber salads (meh... just a lot of cucumber in a martini glass... wasn't impressed), some soup, and all those rolls. For... 70ish bucks? Three people? Not bad at all for what you are getting.  And now I am hungry... Dinner, anyone?

iMl0vishIO1yT3SZXm3n0Q.text: My friends and I hit up this place at 4am on Saturday night after some hard partying at Blush. The restaurant is slightly off the strip but it's well-worth the $12 cab ride from the Wynn.   We had a group of 6 and we were seated right away. Our food came super quickly and everything was really fresh...shocking for 4am!   I had a cucumber salad that was served in a martini glass (super fun). The clam on top was SO fresh. I also had the crazy boy roll which was delicious as well.   Very reasonably priced. Our waiter even called two cabs for us after we were done.   Also a plus: this establishment is non-smoking so it was a breath of fresh air...literally! Will definitely go back next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cucumber salad

g2106MOZROX3zSn7uL-oUg.text: This is my favorite sushi place of all time. I want to move to Vegas just for the sushi here!! Service is great and the rolls never disappoint! Fish is always super fresh and tasty.  I always get the white rose roll avocado train and my new favorite is the spicy tuna salad. If I could eat here every day I would but i have to make the four hour trip to Vegas just for my yummy sushi rolls :(  love this place and the ambience. Great for night owls like me and also love the music. I rarely leave yelp reviews but I have to for  kaizen! Please move closer to LA!

N_GPadAyVe8UA3de4voctA.text: Had a quick lunch here before heading to the airport (leaving Vegas...so sad).  Thought that they had very inventive rolls, but was disappointed in the complete lack of a lunch special (was there at 1 pm) as well as the service. The waitress was pleasant and helpful, but was the only one working the entire lunch rush and couldn't handle everything. I sat at the bar and waited a good deal of time between each roll, and had empty water glasses the entire time.  I think the service is probably perfectly fine when there are more employees there, and the rolls were certainly tasty. Slightly overpriced in my opinion, but tasty. I'd say this place is worth a try if you're headed to the airport and want somewhere that isn't flooded with tourists.

3-hQD4jw0zcqHJGI9gCJLw.text: To make the review short, this place is elegant and amazing.  The interior is nice and cozy, the food is great, and there is plentiful sake to choose from. If you are a unlv student, check this place out!

cb3CHELHT0TKWR0blfYfog.text: This place was AMAZING :)   The sushi chefs were personable, friendly and had some awesome sushi recommendations :)   The restaurant was clean, had a great atmosphere, good bar selection and fabulous service.  Must try the avocado train and orange blossom roll

Kp6vfBjFTxbSgT6v7c3blg.text: Probably the best sushi I've had, reasonable prices for good sushi. Good sized rolls. We had five rolls, only one we really didn't car for. The raw scallop roll. Defiantly thumbs up!

PmcMnh0kXNm0lo_02l_LjA.text: First time here and I have to say it's all around refreshing! The restaurant is very spacious (along with contemporary decor/furnishing) with a bustling atmosphere. Food was fresh and the cuts were truly silky and smooth, I had the screaming "O" with seared tuna. If you don't like heavy sauce ask for the spicy ponzu mayo dressing on the side instead of on top. The garlic edamame is the BOMB (olive oil, crushed garlic, a little shoyu stirr fried with FRESH crisp edamame --straight and to the point). All the waiters were super helpful and did not leave me unattended. Side note it doesn't hurt that there bathroom is even squeeze clean. Not an AYCE place (for all the fish lovers out there (:  )  but this is a place where the quality overshadowed quantity (but forreal i love AYCE with quality too haha) I will definitely make another trip again soon!

kQIVXcTguz8LZHf0BUkgyA.text: We were staying at Hard Rock & walked across the street for dinner. What a gem this place is!  My husband had a Philadelphia roll & said it was so fresh & delicious.   I was looking for something vegan so i asked if they could make me a teriyaki bowl (which was on the menu but with meat or shrimp) with tofu. They did & it was very good!   We were very happy with the food & service.  I would go back again.

EUPLGLbfbj-nuootHCR1Zg.text: BOO. So disappointed.  Came here around 8 on a Saturday night after Yama's Sushi had a 30 minute wait. Soon as we came, we were seated immediately which was good because we had a party to go to at 10.  Each of my friends ordered a hot/cooked dish and a specialty roll; I ordered the chirashi (sashimi sampler on rice) because I didn't want to be too full for the night's festivities.  In 15 mins, my friends each got their cooked meal - seafood curry, chicken katsu, and chicken teriyaki donburi. Told my friends to eat as my food was surely to come out soon. I watched my friends eat as I drank water; and watched more and more people come into the restaurant.  Before I knew it, my friends were done with their meals. And I started noticing that the groups of people that came after us were getting their sushi. This was about 30 mins after ordering. We kept looking for our waitress for the next 5-10 minutes but, no one came into our section. We, finally, had to wave down the hostess to check on our sushi.  My friends' specialty rolls, finally, came. But, at that point, their food had already settled and they weren't hungry.  Finally...after an hour of waiting, my food came. By that time, I didn't even wanna eat it.  For a city that has all these AYCE and stellar sushi spots, Kaizen should be lucky to be open. And with service like this; forget it!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks good but, waiting 30 mins for this ruined my appetite.

Maybe a little less attentive than I'm used to Kama maybe could have improved on that but overall another great time at one of the best sushi restaurants in town   I've been to this place on three or four occasions. It never lets me down. From the sushi to the sushi me to the cut rolls, this place is top-notch. I also like how it's not so formal. It's a place where you can be somewhat formal or completely laid back and just enjoy some amazing sushi

mAKi823SmA8Cs6MgtDq15A.text: Stayed at the hard rock and was craving some sushi! This place was seriously so good! We came around 9pm on Friday. It wasn't busy at all. Service was quick and fish was really fresh.   We had the - Paradise Roll Poke Mix - combo of ahi and salmon Salmon sushi Ahi sushi  You should definitely come here if you are in the area! You won't be disappointed.

BASOMxJRWBWSpba9FU15yw.text: We had dinner here our last night in Vegas, and it was such an excellent choice. Everything from the food and the customer service to the decor was fabulous. We started out with salmon cheese sticks, and they were so good that I contemplated getting another order. I had to restrain myself. We moved on to the sushi rolls. We had the salmon tempura, calamari tempura, and tiger eye rolls. The rolls were fresh and delicious. Amazingly delicious. Kaizen has become one of the best sushi restaurants I've been to. It is located a few minutes off the Strip and is definitely worth the trip. Usually, I don't go to restaurants more than once when I'm vacationing since there are so many options, but we've already mentioned Kaizen for our next trip.

W5Hlp1U_Qtv36YE52nFS3A.text: Decent sushi, but not my favorite. I don't really get the rave reviews. The majority of sushi spots in Vegas are AYCE- and I'm fine going to a place that isn't, but the expectation is that the quality is higher. And while the presentation and service were good, the actual quality of product and freshness of fish seemed average.  When ordering takeout, this spot is great about carefully packing up your order so each roll has it's accompanying sauces alongside- this allows you to control how much is used and prevents the rice from getting soggy on your ride home!   Menu features a wide range of specialty sushi rolls, and some grilled items and apps as well. Nigiri oddly did not seem to to be that common here. The Kai roll was recommended by staff and the best of what we tried.   NOTE: Takeout rolls noticeably smaller than what is received dining in.

Zki5iyi0sYXYrxxamUnUoQ.text: I fell in love with this place when I was working in a Vegas show in 2012. I live in Los Angeles and I visit Las Vegas quite often. There wasn't a single Vegas trip that I didn't stop by Kaizen to have my favorite sushi. I've been to hundreds of sushi restaurants including LA's top rated and most expensive - no one can compete with the taste of food like at Kaizen. My favorite is a chicken teriyaki bowl and garlic edamame. My spouse loves the avocado train , Palm Springs, orange blossom rolls and pretty much everything else that's on the menu.  Top sushi restaurants with an amazing environment and music !!! I'm definitely signing my name under it.  Armen Way #dwtslv

If you're right off the strip and don't want to wait for hours getting to some fancy location on the strip, I highly recommend this location to hold you over on a myriad of Japanese-American creations.  Particularly friendly location if you're in town and near the Convention Center as well!

-bQJNUzkmnKs85L4KnmMMw.text: This is the first time I'm writing a negative review... I don't want my money back or anything I just don't want anyone to suffer the way I did.  I always pass this sushi place when I go home from work so I decided to try them out.  Last night, I picked up a salmon dinner to go this was around 10:30pm - 11pm & all is well, food was ok.  Went to bed around midnight stomach already started hurting before I slept and around 4am I woke up & started puking so much and I noticed the salmon was still recognizable... (I know our body won't digest food that are bad) felt like dying pretty much until noon... almost went to the hospital thinking I'm having ulcers/appendicitis.  Had 2 glasses of chamomile tea, about 3 tums, 3 glasses of milk, about 20 peppermints, 7 glasses of Gatorade today... Finally feeling better now... almost 24 hours later.  Never threw up so much in my life that my throat hurts.  And yeah diarrhea too... thank you to whoever ok'd to serve that salmon.  I hope karma gets you.

yl95EUXEF-3PmOtzPduD2g.text: this was like a Japanese haven in Vegas. It was late .. actually close to midnight... you'd think no one would want to feed us anymore. But Kaizen was still ready to feed us dinner!  I had the steak(Japanese style ) of course and my hubby got the humongous rolls.. can't remember the names. but I took photos nonetheless. I was pretty hungry, so names don't linger in my head anymore at this point. got myself a miso soup to start. it was good.our server was awesome. he was extremely attentive. he suggested great appetizers, great dishes.. and he  constantly checked on us. the presentation and the dishes were exceptional. everything tasted great and fresh. for the price, it is also affordable. For Japanese, this is a place to visit. you should not miss this once in Vegas. The ambiance just needs a little updating.  it should match what they are serving I think. lol.

-28eRwXUmbuRE8JUnYka5Q.text: One of the great sushi restaurants in Las Vegas. I love the sushi here every roll I get there is full of fresh flavors. Biting into the rainbow roll is effortless and the crunch roll has a great coating that once you bit through that there is more flavor and textures that bring on a great taste. There tuna poke has the perfect balance of fresh and spicy flavor. The staff is amazing.

02QGXE2xAyAZ140w2-mgUw.text: My favorite local sushi place in Vegas. Avoid the big names on the strip - this place is just as good at half the price. All the locals know this place and hang out here.  This is one of the few sushi places I know of that have a Fried Banana Roll. At less than $10, the roll is ridiculously well priced and delicious. Which brings me to my next point - the prices.   The prices are extremely reasonable. They have their roll with all the bells and whistles at $13-$16 a roll, but with a plethora of well-topped rolls at or less than $10, it's a bargain. Quality is top notch, and this is coming from a guy who lives in LA.   Drop by here and grab yourself some sushi (did I mentioned they're open until 6am on Fridays and Saturdays? Insanely convenient, I know)

DmZfdnHQCzVZuAV0qA7JEg.text: Wasn't so impressed by this spot. The location is conveniently close to the strip, but the sushi wasn't anything great. Given that many of the Vegas sushi spots are AYCE, I expected the non-AYCE sushi restaurants to have higher quality fish.  They have an extensive menu of Japanese fusion dishes. Seems like the popular thing to get here are their specialty rolls. My rolls were poorly put together, but I was okay with it, given that it was late at night and I was craving sushi.

LmLb6H9MsKbv95zJMb-ZjQ.text: Food is alright, nothing special tho. The restaurant itself is beautiful and servers are very polite. They're always checking on you. They have a nice menu, nice sake selection. They're not expensive or crowded. It could be a very good restaurant.  Here's why I'm giving this place one star, hygiene.  As soon as we sat down I noticed a piece of hair on the small soy sauce dish, not cool! But I decided to ignore it since my husband gave me his, as I was the only one who was going to eat. A few minutes after we started eating I asked for paper napkins and as the server was bringing them to me one fell down on the floor. Surprisingly she picked it up and put it together with the other napkin she was bringing me... After giving me the clean and dirty napkin she took the dirty one with her saying it was dirty, and I honestly believe that if she knew we hadn't seen it she would have given me the dirty and the clean one.  That was the end for me, I could barely finish my meal as I was disgusted.  It's a nice restaurant with good food but they could use hygiene.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piece of hair in my little soy sauce recipient

P55ZNSZKgW4ZYceVN_M_Cw.text: Food is good, service is okay, 18% automatic gratuity on my check is NOT okay. 10% is standard, 15% for excellent service, 18% is robbery unless you are freaking OUTSTANDING. Servers are not very friendly, personable or helpful, and $16 tip to pass a plate from the sushi bar to my table is not a good deal. Several reviews for this place compare it to other Vegas all-you-can-eat (AYCR) places. With that being said, I'm not going back here! You have to EARN your tip, not force it on me...this is the USA not a socialist country! Also, bathrooms suck, always waiting to pee, and music is lame...who is your music programer?

YZcm1S-lE42jpgX5mnPAOQ.text: Poor service from the waitress, rude girl and didn't wait table .   Got better interaction with bus boy... I like good customer service. Food was good though, but too bad I witnessed other customers say their food was too spicy and so they throw that food away, what a waste of a good food! I wish restaurants would give to the homeless 3 other than that good food, but also I was sick and couldn't eat much. Tried grapefruit drink it was good

bsht1YlcPIxvMZ9DJr4sFg.text: This is a new spot that we will come to when we come to Vegas! The food was sooo good! The eel bowl was so good, the hungry roll and philidelphia roll was great too! Everything tasted fresh. The waiters are attentive but don't know if because there were only 3 guest here on a Sunday but none the less great staff. If u Check in on yelp and do a review u get a free something lol explains why there are so many reviews lol great place great food and great staff:)  If I could change just one thing it would be the can sodas, no refills. It didn't bother us mich but just maybe something we would of liked to know before ordering a soda.

GNgqlS7wNpSgwX0TUjquxA.text: This is my happy place. Whenever I'm in Las Vegas, this is the very first place and very last place I go to as I'm coming and going - luggage and all. The atmosphere is great, the food is superb, the people are amazing. I can't think of a negative thing to say about Kaizen. Well, maybe that it's not in California???  It's not a touristy spot so it's not crowded. I've seriously been here at all times of the day and I've never had to wait to be seated. There is plenty of parking. I'm telling you, this place is so unassuming that I'm tempted to keep it my little secret. This place is so awesome though, that it deserves all the success and accolades.

us0Wvr1lfW-7McbUJZgMYw.text: Awesome service! Great sushi!!  Perfect if you're staying at Hard Rock.   Good prices especially when you consider the location and proximity to hotels here in Vegas.   Bring friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oDPivfFdUljbGEOVVnZN1w.text: Nice lil' place.. great service!  I got the shrimp tempura roll, which came out with a side of tempura sweet potato.. I wasn't sure how I felt about that, as it wasn't on the menu like that.. but it was really tasty, so it ended up being a nice surprise!  The roll was okay, but not tight, so falling apart was an issue.  For my 2nd roll, I got the Crazy Girl and it was awesome!  Huge roll with great flavor!  I wasn't blown away, so I'mma check out some other sushi places before selecting my "go to" spot.

cEa5khppSbHvheoN-zq9-w.text: First time here and came on a Saturday night and was quickly seated. Love the ambiance and the open concept.  I ordered the Baked Salmon Roll and  the tempura appetizer! The food came quickly and both were very good! I love that the rolls weren't huge where they weren't falling off which I love!! The tempura wasn't overcooked either and not too greasy!   Lastly the service was impeccable! Everyone checked on us and always made sure our drinks were topped off! So glad we came here!! =)

gUQUtGvJ-cwS21HxjQ-gnA.text: I went in here for lunch. The place was quiet and I sat at the bar. The sushi chef was quick with producing the order. They even have fresh wasabi. Maybe it was because it wasn't busy, but I felt they were a little over attentive. Having people constantly on me for refills or taking plates detracted from the sushi experience. Additionally, one of the staff was hitting Youtube for the music videos playing on the big screen.  Pay for Youtube Red at least so the advertisements don't jar the customers, again detracting from the experience.  Food - 5 stars Cleanliness - 5 stars Service - Exceptional but over whelming - 3 stars Ambiance - Youtube adds - 3 stars

KSzCeLKLXz4j4AfrN02U6g.text: Food was good , service was even better. We ordered the Kai sushi roll and the Nevada roll . sushi is just typical sushi to fix your cravings .

svcICZuxrkskNK3PUhmUOA.text: It was just ok. Their rolls are creative for sure, but the few that we got just didn't have any special taste to them, they were bland. Nothing to write home about, you can go to many other places around town and get far better sushi for considerably cheaper and have the option of ayce too. The service was on par with the food. NyIT8Pzl54r6jf7uAFmwhA.text: This place has roaches crawling on the bar and into the food prep area! Who knows what else they have crawling around into the food prep area and pay no attention to.  We picked this sushi location based upon the positive reviews. It was a cute location and appeared to be clean. We sat at the bar and once our food was served there was a roach crawling on the counter that ventured into the food prep side. The guys who make the sushi saw this and made no attempt to find the roach. They went back into the kitchen and started laughing and came out after laughing and acted like nothing was wrong. We were so disgusted that we had to leave. Never going back again. Obviously food cleanliness is not a priority for this restaurant.

Cg6ZZ60dLUvOrh0wfWctdA.text: My girlfriends who were in town staying on the strip wanted sushi and since I am a local and have a car I demanded we leave the strip and go here. We ordered the avocado train roll, the unicorn and another I don't remember the name of... But let me just say not only was the presentation of the rolls great, the flavor was amazing! They were beyond happy with this place which made me feel good. The venue is clean and I really like the set up. Some intimate tables on the side but the middle has big long benches for a unique seating expierence. Would be great for a big group! The server was incredibly friendly and helpful with his suggestions for what we should order. I am looking forward to coming here again.

a7VDJexfISc0xWSIL3QhoQ.text: I thought I have reviewed this place many times but it's asking me for one again. This place has consistency and large portions and decent prices.  I send everyone I know there!! No complaints ever!!

L00ib1dELPQoR1NgMmNxfQ.text: We came late on a Friday evening and were seated immediately. The sushi and sashimi were incredibly fresh tasting and the rolls very tasty with fast and friendly service.  The ambience is contemporary, inviting and romantic. They have a nice selection of desserts. We had the chocolate truffle and it was so delicious. We wanted to lick the plate! They are open until midnight and off the strip with ample parking so easy in and easy out. Definitely recommended!

4u1qJ_W7pcbGcYbIHPCPSA.text: Tasted very delicious! Very fast and kind service. Also very cheap (about $7-10 for a roll) would highly recommend

3mDGWA2Y8oBmLdsTw4VsGw.text: Great spot. I been here many times and definitely recommend it.  Food is fresh and service is always excellent.  They have a late night happy hour.

3C4J0Rv75Rr3eX5QHsa3Wg.text: The atmosphere and music is great the servers are pretty knowledgeable about the menus and sushi in general, the sushi taste fresh and is a good size. Another little side note the sell some of the art pieces that are up for display at the restaurant. The happy hour is a pretty decent length only down side is there's no all you can eat but as long as you know what you want there should be no problem, my favorite roll is the Philadelphia roll :D

HgsTfsORPdfyXC1jk0KjUw.text: My friend and I just landed in Las Vegas after a very long flight and we hadn't eaten in ten hours We came to the plaza where this place is because we wanted a foot rub We went into some barbecue place but they kept saying that everything took a really long time and I was very hungry so we came into the sushi place which is the most amazing place that I've ever eaten in Las Vegas Food is incredibly fresh everything was good we ate several rolls soup salad sake steak and I would come back here every day  It's completely delicious the service is very fast everyone's very attentive and it's totally got a clean Vegas five  I would highly suggest this to anyone and the guys who work in and sushi counter is very cute  Waitress was nice the seaweed salad is excellent the Mississippi is delicious the Eda mommy was fresh and steamy in the Orange Blossom Hill is the best get that and don't miss the steak salad it's yummy

mQ6B77G8-_hERddbF7Chfg.text: Easy to miss. Great food and service. Many items on the menu. So much to choose from. A must to go

hnpN2Xjb3kr_ZTEAJADIVA.text: Honestly, this place was ok at best I think.  Service felt a bit slow (maybe someone called out) and their food was sub par.  Don't get their Karage...it's simply chicken fingers.  Not good at all.  Their rolls are solid enough though.  It's the side dishes that were pretty weak.  I can't remember exactly what rolls we got, but I do remember them being good.  The decor and ambiance is nice though. Although the rolls and decor were nice, it just wasn't enough for me to bump it up to a 4 star rating.

zT84yS71qM-U45amz--9NA.text: So far so awesome. Patient staff, nice atmosphere, and the music is on point. I'm just waiting on the food and if it's as good as it smells this place is gonna get all 5 stars.  Update: yo! The food is bomb and if you do the review for free menu item get the cold sake. You get like more than four shots of cold delicious drunkiness. Also the food is goooooodddd. Don't get the Hungry Roll that was just fried tempera batter with bits of fish and rice.  Kiss of fire! Kiss of fire all day and everyday. Haha and the severs here are just beautifully brilliant. 10/10 will come again.   -Pumi

u5ZnyVBXpfSAIo8XyEwAQw.text: The sushi was pretty decent and the atmosphere was nice but they're serving AYCE-grade fish (we all know the difference) at high-end fresh fish cost. I don't mind paying a la Carte prices when the fish is high quality and worth it. Go to the Kaizen on Eastern, where they do AYCE with the same fish and menu, that way you're not paying $50 for 2 mediocre rolls just because of location.

tRoJLu5j1ySxg5dgDDuvCg.text: Wow! In Vegas looking for late night sushi, Kaizen was close to where we were so we had to try it! The menu has so many amazing dishes it's hard to choose! We tried the orange blossom roll and it's so good! (And the Salmon deep fried shrimp) highly recommend coming here you won't regret! Friendly staff, parking, fair prices and nice atmosphere! Definitely try this place! We will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange blossom roll (nom nom)

Hm5nyeiu-uVTS43L8h8RVQ.text: I am new to sushi and the chef helped guide to some great choices. Very friendly and mellow vibe. I will be back before I head home. Nice happy hour with buy one get one drinks. Girlfriend like the decor.

2Rb7ZLYLnLa0LO_5g8GikA.text: I am not a sushi eater but I had some of the a la carte items like the chicken veggie teppan and it was so good !   Definitely great prices, and from what I can tell the all you can eat sushi is a great deal.   I recommend the cucumber salad and chicken & veggie teppan.

9unGsehsmHGCzDQMMYu9CQ.text: This place is amaaaaaaazing!!! The rolls came out fast, they were reasonably priced & they had amazing green apple flavored sake.. It was so smooth you couldn't taste any alcohol!  Service was great, atmosphere was nice, they play music videos in a huge screen, and they also have large tables for groups, as well as private tables for couples.  I'd definitely come here again, their menu is large with a lot of great choices!!

El-EW4mKboGbc8IeA_Ef_g.text: The sushi here was great! Fun service and catering to any need. If you want a great time have V as your sushi chef and you're guaranteed a good meal!

gYLCWiTXfLun-gAWfAU3fw.text: We came in the waiter was very friendly and professional. The seats are very comfortable! We had unicorn roll and chicken yakisoba. It is not our first time to this restaurant. This restaurant has always exceed our expectation!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of the restaurant

l1loPDTE7jEKQSaoRWtxSA.text: Good stuff!  I would come back.  Oh wait, here till Friday.  Ill be back tomorrow night!

lLWYilBuTXRmNUNY9p2F-Q.text: This place has a lot of potential, considering the fact that the location is pretty good.  The place attempts at an identity; dimly lit rooms, walls and menus decorated in sleek yet simple design.  Bold and different from other sushi venues in Las Vegas.  Overall, not bad.  Even the food is designed to look cute and all.  You may notice the sushi takes a little bit longer to prepare than other venues, and obviously it's because they're taking their time laying out and arranging the sushi to make it look nice.  Makes up for a nice Kodak moment if you're into that kind of stuff.  It's impressive, but the bottom line is that no amount of decoration can make a delicious meal.  The fact is, the sushi tastes bad. Really bad.  To be fair, the sushi may be OK for first timers or real causal sushi goers, but it just doesn't cut it for me.  The biggest reason is that the rice is terrible.  It doesn't mix well with the sashimi at all.  It's always because the rice is cooked too thin,there's too much rice in the roll, it's not packed correctly with the sashimi, the list goes on and on.  The fish is OK, but not mind-blowing.  The best way to find out if a sushi joint is good is to eat the most perishable fish on their menu.  I always try the Ebi(Shrimp), Ama-ebi(Sweet Shrimp), and Uni(Sea Urchin) as starters.  Try one of these as a Nigiri (Fish and Rice only, with no tacky sauce), and you'll know in a heartbeat if the fish is fresh or not.  It doesn't matter anyways because you shouldn't order Nigiri at a sushi joint that doesn't have AYCE unless you wanna put a hole in your wallet.  The price is pretty overpriced as well.  I know it's near the Strip and everything, but it seems that's all you're paying for at this point.  The food does no help to justify the price of the dishes.  Oh, I just want to point out it took nearly 20 minutes for them to prepare a California Roll.  Unbelievable.  I don't care if it looked pretty because when I'm hungry I can eat anything that looks close to edible.  The thought of waiting another 20 minutes was insane.   I can't imagine how much longer it will take if I ordered it during their peak hours.  If you go there around 10-11pm when they're busy, good luck ever getting your food..  In conclusion, considering that the food comes out looking pretty like a flower arrangement and takes a long time, its more like a lounge-like environment.  Go with a couple friends when you aren't too hungry, have a couple drinks and poke at the pretty food that takes forever to come out.  In that sense, it's an OK experience.  But as far as taste goes, stay awaaaay.   PRO: Nice decoration, location is OK.  Sushi may be decent for casuals CON: Sushi tastes bland, dishes takes a really long time to come out, no AYCE

_J3HrF1hNOFSKu7vYLep5A.text: Yum! Great garlic edamame, wonderful fresh sushi, and the ceviche was delicious. Cool vibe, creative menu.

bnwnbYkx0xOS-W4iDzTqvg.text: While visiting LV, my friends and I really wanted to eat some sushi. The first place we "found" seemed to either not be open or no longer in business, but just our luck Kaizen was right across the street. They have a fun atmosphere and a sizable menu. I couldn't decide what to pick!  I chose a few interesting rolls, and they were very good.   Good job Kaizen!

brrfwHk5utNGM176LaHGPg.text: BEST SUSHI PLACE IN THE CITY. I've been here multiple times and the rolls meet all expectations. Freshness, Flavor, Presentation, Large Rolls, High End quality. Nice little setup too! The service is a little bit average but who cares! Drink and have some rolls :)

eaL-6twHhyuYyCyolMeMmg.text: By simply crossing Paradise Road, I'm pretty sure we ate two or three times the amount of sushi we would have received for the same price in the Hard Rock.   Service was SUPER fast. That probably contributed to why we kept ordering roll after roll... we arrived hungry, and the food emerged as each dish was ready, seemingly two beats after we'd spoken the words. Delicious spicy hamachi, tuna sashimi in garlic ponzu, rainbow roll, unagi, various maki of salmon persuasions, I could go on... The vegetarian among us was also pleased with her rolls. I was quite impressed with the freshness of the fish (a feat of modernity I've never gotten over since inhabiting landlocked states).    Even after several add-ons to our orders, sake for the table, and mango mochi, the total bill was still impressively moderate. Unless your heart is set on Nobu, give Kaizen a try. Just be careful of those speed-demons tearing across Paradise.

pBrABfykNvJ_dFkNcQAl7g.text: fun and festive sushi spot off the strip. for those staying at the hard rock, this is a must. be careful crossing the street! it is a nice alternative   sushi rolls are fresh and are made with some flair as well. the portions are fairly large (8 pieces) and make up for the slightly expensive menu.  watching the chefs prepare the sushi is fun too. the staff is very welcoming.  great for groups, or a casual hungover Sunday brunch.

z5VJ8lNmTJAZ7jlFc0lY5A.text: I'm so glad I yelped this place when I was staying at the Hard Rock. I was getting extremely tired of eating american food (ie Cheese Fries and Chicken Strips) at Mr. Lucky's 24/7, me and my friend were totally craving for some rice. =) I was confused by the location on the google map because we exited from the back side of the Hard Rock rather than the front and couldn't see any street signs. After walking up and down Paradise Road we finally were able to find the location. It's really easy to find, just make sure you exit the Hard Rock from the front, walk over to the Hard Rock Cafe and walk across the street towards the CVS pharmacy. A few doors down is the Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi. =)   I loved that they were really trendy, with trendy decor (70's looking partitioners that split the tables) and they were playing popular upbeat music that got me back into the mood to party again (I was feeling tired from Rehab, I wasn't feeling up to going to Body English later in the night). =)  We got seated right away, the service the waitresses were giving was very attentive, and we got our food right away. =)  The food was DELICIOUS!!! =)  We shared a tempura roll and edamame (they hook up the edamame!) and the chicken teryiaki bowl. But it wasn't your trypical teryiaki bowl... it tasted stir fried so it definitely added more flavor to the entree! =)  Plus the meal ended up being like $20! Super cheap! =)  Even if I wasn't staying at the Hard Rock Hotel I would still come by here again for Sushi... another bonus to this place is that they are open late! I believe on the weekends they are open until 4 or 5am!  A MUST visit if you're craving for more than just american fried food and don't want to make the drive out of the Hard Rock.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ypfrMBvakmBeWvbDcAflfw.text: WOW! This place is so good! The quality is fantastic and there is So much variety!  There is something for everyone. Keep in mind it's near the strip so it is a bit pricey,  but most good sushi is and this place is worth it.

YtqLYu2zEkPoc8yIcXfCTw.text: This place is awesome! Great happy hour specials. You gotta try the Spicy Tuna Salad. The staff is friendly, helpful, and attentive. All the rolls are sooo delicious! If you're in Vegas and you like sushi then this spot is it! I am definitely going to be back here when I'm in town. Cheers!

2cZF11HUvEd1Lf26HL1ijQ.text: This place is sooo good.  They have a large variety of rolls, and they are almost all delicious.  It's a great place for a small group of 4-5, and they stay open really late.  We always go when we visit Vegas.  And for the people who don't like rolls, the entrees such as teriyaki chicken and udon are good as well.  They flavor the veggies and udon very well.    Our favorites: Lasgana Roll Avaocado Ball (kinda pricey but totally worth it)  Skip the shitake mushroom roll.

4fVanzPNI4e3rIknXLm-UQ.text: The Rose roll is something else.  Seriously.  I went here with my cousin because he raved about the place for a long while, claiming it was the best sushi he's ever had.  Since he's from the West Coast and I'm a Midwesterner, I decided I had to see about this for myself.  Not sure if it was the saki bomb or the sushi itself, but damn, it was good.  A little on the pricey side for what you get, hence the 1 star reduction.  I guess that's in comparison to the sushi prices I'm used to in places that aren't Vegas, so it's probably good for Vegas prices.  But I'll definitely be back if I ever find myself in Vegas again, as unlikely as that is.

WlqyfZxHglGLnbpUao-4Fw.text: It's open til 4 am!!!  I love that it's close to the strip so I can satisfy my late night sushi cravings after partying in the clubs.    My favorite roll is the First Kiss Roll.  It's kinda expensive at $15 but it's SOOOOOO good.  Besides that, the only thing I really get is the $5 spicy tuna rolls.     Gone here many times and it never disappoints me, except for the one time where it was 3:40am and last call was at 3:30am =(

QIqpUKXJBUBlbRxCTaQ1Ag.text: Horrible service. . I am accustomed to being told of sushi bar specials and chef's recommendations.if  you want cheap bad service ..this is then your spot. . DON'T WASTE YOUR  TIME...

PxtZ5Hleylfs9cgAIllsJg.text: This was my 2nd visit to Kaizen, the first being a few months ago while visiting Vegas. Both times, we were able to get seated right away, the service was really good and the food even better! This time we sat at the bar and the sushi chef was very friendly and helpful picking some popular items. I'm pretty sure after each bite I said "ridiculous" to my boyfriend. Ridiculous = ridiculously delicious. It wasn't inexpensive, but the rolls are really big and everything tasted fresh and unique. The flavors and sauces were so good that I didn't use soy sauce or wasabi for any of it. Can't wait to go back!

o1pB8TZecTgLzhtva-6pYA.text: Great sushi restaurant, just behind the Hard Rock Hotel on Paradise.    I live here in Vegas, and like most other locals, I hardly ever eat on the strip.  I will usually only go to the strip to eat at Joes Stone Crab in the Forum Shops.  It's great to find nice restaurants like Kaizen to eat at when you're in the area.  The prices are not half as bad as Sushi places on the strip and the quality is excellent!    My servers name was Sumi, probably misspelled.  It was the best service I've ever had in any kind of Japanese restaurant, I will definitely be going back again.

kNedrcsiA5PthlczY0P8uA.text: Love the atmosphere, phenomenal customer service, and lots of delicious menu options to choose from. Great location, too. We will definitely keep coming back whenever we're in town!

IZ-TOivu4E25eDY4om7aRA.text: I had friends in town and wanted to find a local sushi place. Walking inside to a very clean decor relived the stress of a sub par sushi restaurant hole in the wall.  At first glance I was impressed! The service was good with very attentive servers. The sushi selection is above average and the sake was good! I would definitely revisit for a casual dinner.

Qqhk2b-loi5KJhbkhTjV6g.text: High quality fish, fusion cuisine. Their sushi is incredible!!! Good selection of wines.Very good service , cozy atmosphere. Expansive, but reasonable if you take into account organic ingredients. Furniture must be updated / changed as soon as possible. We go there for good food and willing to pay the price , stays open for industry till 4... give it a shot.

VVE9n9clUXKpZ9Z1mmUUug.text: Very peaceful and possitive atmosphere,  This is are second time here, living in California. Every time we come to Las Vegas we just have to stop here. The sushi was fresh. My fiancee loves this place. Great service are waiter was very attentive and helpful both times that we've been here. The rolls are amazing. The parking situation could be a little hectic.

XQL7lgAV8r6guhZUVzq6KA.text: Always a pleasure to eat at kaizen. The servers are always friendly. The restaurant has a modern feel and is clean. Food tastes great, prepared with fresh ingredients. It's open super late, so that's a plus!

BCR21hVWoKnR53v28z2KHQ.text: It's kind of hit or miss with this place. Decent but I've had much better. Servers are sometimes nice but seems like a lot going on behind the scenes. Chefs are fun but sometimes seem over worked and grumpy. There are actually very few sushi bars I know of that are actually owned by Japanese owners, but when they are, you can be sure that they take the art of sushi making very seriously. This place, not so much.  I tried it again. Fish was fresh and tasty. If only the busboy spoke english, he might've heard me say i didn't want anymore tea. Instead, he reaches over my plate to grab my cup and then proceeds to spill it on my jacket sitting on the seat next to me. Not to mention he ran my food to the wrong person.   Wish the bussers would learn how to communicate properly...and, why isn't my server bringing my food anyways???

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One for me and 3 for them so they are happy

0eRak9nOHbTtQxA2YeHI0Q.text: Holy mackerel... I was not expecting this dining experience. Just arrived from LA to visit my grandparents for the holiday, got out of the care home way later than expected, hotel check-in was a mess, all the boyfriend and I felt like was sushi. It was 10:30 and everything was about to close at 11. We gave up on the "epic Vegas dining experience" and just picked the highest rated sushi joint on yelp that was open. Some place in a strip mall. (Eyebrow raised)  Just upon walking in, we were shocked to see and feel such a nice and trendy vibe. Clean, classy, good music, nice bar, neat tables. We sat at the bar and opened the fabulously photographed menus. Sushi spots with photos is a major plus for me and they had EVERYTHING photographed. We picked a bunch of stuff and were blown away with not only the taste/freshness/quality of fish, but the presentation, price/portions, service... Just everything. The bill ended up being $122 and trust me... we were really going for it. Anywhere else back in LA would have racked up to $200+.   We stayed and hung out well after we were stuffed to the brim. The ambiance is nice and I felt like I was getting a special type of Vegas experience without all the hustle and bustle. I will absolutely be showing this place off to friends who join me on future trips. What a treat!  Oh yeah... And it's open until 6am. AND they have a happy hour that starts at midnight. GENIUS!!!  I posted photos of what we ate - albacore topped with fried onions, filet mignon salad, white rose roll, sea bass & unagi. We also had saki bombs, the largest portion of edemami ever, uni and crispy tuna tostada things. YUM YUMMMMM YUM

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unagi! (Fresh water eel) was delish!
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Rose roll. This was a bit too much fish for me, the boyfriend loved it

NAAuKanh1yB0E88s9eWntA.text: This is one of my favorite places in Vegas. The ambience and food are the best. Definitely will come here every time I come to Vegas now! Also, they are open till 6am I've eaten here at midnight once and it was pretty busy, and 3 am they are still busy.

_-RB7FmBqekJ5JJmyJ0G7w.text: Food is absolutely amazing! Not an AYCE and somewhat pricey but the quality is well worth it. Try the shrimp tempura. It's the best I've had in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tempura Roll $7.95

Sf5Dt7Bpzd5v2jUvbhObHQ.text: I absolutely love this sushi spot. It's gorgeous inside and has the most amazing quality food!! The staff is friendly and service is fast! I highly recommend trying this place out.

mUd0-1821C74Fi_G9iMO7A.text: Amazing service and delicious sushis. We had intended to go to a Korean BBQ restaurant in the same plaza but the wait was over one hour, so we walked a few steps to find this place. The restaurant had a nice ambiance with the white Christmas lights and the fringe curtains that separates the restaurant to different sections to create a cozy atmosphere. Servers are super attentive and you don't even have to flag them down to get a refill. We did family style and we shared our sushi rolls. They are very large and beautiful presented. The avocado train was picture perfect and tasted delicious with a big ball of crab wrapped with avocado! It was so beautiful! Their Ninja roll was a perfect combination of just a little spicy kick without being too spicy. Rainbow roll was just average. I would recommend that you order their specialty sushis and not your typical sushi rolls. You will be blown away!

4iP5jaGmT-CBCZV6zqUYxQ.text: Delicious. Enjoyed the octopus sushi, salmon sushi and shrimp tempura roll. Really good udon. Nice chicken curry rice. Good meal, service & atmosphere.

xhO9BLnICGNHMIu5P4O3OA.text: Tonight enjoying different pieces of sushi and a rainbow roll. Thank you Charlie for the Mackerel recommendation!

photos.caption: Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Getting really into the seared sushi now
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I prefer the rainbow roll without the sauce. Easier to taste the fish that way. Bluefin tuna here is amazing, as is the escolar
Photo of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kate is one of the kindest people I have ever met. Love the yummy food and the peopke here

The service, the ambience is great here and the food is amazing! It totally worth going off the strip for this one! Thank you Kaizen, we'll definitely be back for more :)

-LptrEAUdHpl6mVYV6PBKg.text: The restaurant is close to where we stay and it open late , so come in and give it a try . The server are very nice and take well care with very amazing food

CKFkgXANbc5-6oi1u677dA.text: Ended up coming here with a date to avoid the crazy New Years crowd on the strip! I was recommended to come here by one of the pit bosses while gambling. They had stated that this pale was open until 6 A.M. which was a major plus since It was past midnight at that point. Ended up getting to the restaurant around 1. We started off with a bottle of sake called "nothingness" which was pretty good. (Sweeter cold sake) The food was absolutely amazing, everything was fresh and delicious. The service was also very good! Since it was considered happy hour at that time they brought us an extra bottle of sake on the house. It was only a 5 minute cap ride from Planet Hollywood here which wasn't bad at all. I initially had doubts about this place number one because it was off the strip and number 2 because it was open so late, but I am glad I ended up coming here as oppose to anywhere else. The vibe was also very good. A nice place to take a date. For it being a sushi restaurant in Vegas the price was very reasonable, I was expecting it to be about doubled what I ended up paying! I will definitely come back here next time I am in town! I can easily say it is one of the top 5 sushi spots I have been too!

KyE5dvcDxOCCoC2VEEx2-w.text: Great place and energy, specially Kate gave us extremely nice service, polite and helpful.

0pf-DpycUDlnbX-yAvWoNw.text: I love going here after work with my girls. Their sushi rolls are really delicious. My fave roll is the Avocado Train. Service is usually really good, but EXCELLENT when we get our fave server Jun. Yummmmm!!!

U_PmcnkT4dFyESNwbocsCw.text: We went to Kaizen because we got a recommendation from a local! So so glad we went. We got a sashimi platter and some nigiri and the fish was so fresh. We also got a few rolls. I believe one was the orange blossom. The sushi chef was awesome and he made us two rolls by our request.  We had a blast and did some saki bombs as well. This place is priced reasonably for Vegas and has awesome service. We will definitely go back when we are in Vegas again.

Syz09R_OH0mjCDV7Lx82sA.text: Great staff, and the shogun roll was delicious. This place made a great impression on Vegas sushi!

DmsPy4bljp_sW4WyQzih3A.text: A hidden gem across from the hard rock! Fresh sushi and amazing mochi! Please stop in if you can! So chill and relaxing in here with great food and people.

xmrC4duGEfYdclyiXDhGQQ.text: Delicious! Only a few people when we came at 5:30 on a Wednesday. Service was really fast and the quality of the sushi was good. We got a Rattle Snake, Banana, and Mango Lobster rolls.

Sk27enxxl5FVyecWVF4yAQ.text: The food is good! Ingredient fresh and the rolls are innovative . Out me first tune coming here , friend different rolls and is definitely it something you can find in a regular Japanese food restaurants. Location is convenient with ample of parking . Spacious seating And the services are attentive .

PeggfC5sC2QIFPlzLoqY2w.text: Every time I come to Vegas, I make it a point to eat at Kaizen!!! Food is always delicious and menu is 14 pages! Best of all, happy hour is 10 pm to 4am! Buy 1 get 1 free alcohol! Love the service too!!!!

BhIh8Fym65eBtrrveH_reA.text: Three stars it is, because the food is always fresh and tasty. I love the location and food, but the service needs major facelift. I've been here about 5 times in the last 3 months and the last experience was the one that made up my mind to stop coming to this specific location.   In our seating area we were the first table to arrive and then a few other people arrived about 5 minutes later. We were immediately ready to order, but instead our waiter took their order instead...  [worst] thing a waiter could do.. in my book.  He came to our table 10 minutes later the came back with sushi that was completely drenched in sauce to the point where I could't eat it and the dish they served it on was so darn small  my food was spilling all over the place, so I asked for larger dish... weird...   The place wasn't packed and it took another 15 minutes to get a check and get out. Ugh... Despite the repeated poor service at this specific joint, I still recommend Kaizen, but at a different location.

xegUO4ED6rtvdH9-EkvvuA.text: Great service. Very good food. Nice ambiance. We for Nevada roll, Dragon roll and Rainbow roll plus Kaizen ceviche. Super fresh fish all around.

tcZMnxVdqo3KBaWzLWeaAA.text: I love Kaizen!  I'd never been here, but I am always in the area when trolling around for food. Grabbed lunch here the other day for a team lunch at work.  Everything was delicious. The miso soup, the seaweed salad, the various rolls. Try the caterpillar roll, and share it with people. It's foodporn worthy.  Service was fast!  I can't wait to come back.  Sorry this review isn't as novel as my previous ones. I'm close to 400. I don't care. This place is just worth it, and I can't wait to come back!

mmISrz5-PKxoP2CsgCFWEg.text: Not really a fan. I wanted sushi in Vegas and wound up here.  It was in a questionable strip mall.  The long tables were kind of cool and they played rave music with the concert videos in the background. The sushi wasn't to my liking.  I thought it tasted fishy, like in a not fresh kind of way.  I don't know, it wasn't bad, but it wasn't really good either.

qOkgb0rmQTRXom1ZLs6_yQ.text: Not as tasty as i like.

RQtd2gHDPLb87Yvo-KF2Rw.text: Worst service ever!!!!! I'm never coming back here again! Our server sucked, he was rude and extremely unprofessional. We were a party of 6, out food took forever and when we complained about it, an employee who claimed to be the owner, yelled at us!

MsVxfMeKNBWYKeBhrXq2Xw.text: I like Kaizen. It's hip, easy to go with a group of friends and they have some interesting rolls to choose from.  My only issue is that it's a bit pricey for me. Two rolls and a drink - your check is about $40 before gratuity. I'd rather go to an all you can eat sushi restaurant for half that price and pig out! But this place is open super late (4AM) which is a plus for us industry folks who crave sushi right after partying at the club. HEYYY!!!!

T-KZT8qt7uqRgVa5OgjGpQ.text: I've been coming here for years & always a great time! I usually get the hot night roll or chicken Katsu bowl, which is consistently yummy. Also a great late-night spot close to Las Vegas Blvd.

U-ViyosxxxCJYKKpO8Z-nA.text: Good spot to get your grub on. Music wasn't to loud. Friendly service clean. All around good eats

P9uxORsRe7Kmw4iGetug7A.text: My wife and I were looking for some place quiet and peaceful off the strip and we found it here!! The food was outstanding!!! Along with the service and presentation!!! We had the "Charlie Roll" and the Lobster Mango Roll fresh and delicious!!! You should check this place out!!!!

GAak53XKwMxzpHyGDmM8OA.text: Take your time and enjoy the experience... Great sake choices too ;D  It's been a while since I had really great quality sushi; thanks to Mel!  All their rolls are done exquisitely and with great detail.  The menu does provide you ample choices so you should listen to your gut and instincts to choose what you should have.  All in all, the service is extremely attentive and prompt.  If you're not getting your food quick enough, it's most likely due to your indecisiveness in selecting what you want from the menu.  I thoroughly enjoyed myself and would make the effort to wander off the strip to eat here again.  If you're staying at the Hard Rock Casino, it's right across the street in the same complex with CVS.  Enjoy, eat sushi, and please drink some of their wonderful sake too.

oIlMWeddrzYZb-18Ce8kXw.text: Kaizen is a destination restaurant worth the flight to Vegas.  The sushi chefs are incredibly talented and come up with some really fresh combinations.  My favorite?  The Rose Roll!  Why?  Because it has no rice or seaweed, it's all fish wrapped in fish.  I have them add some jalapenos on top to give a bit of spice.  Amazing!  Fresh sashimi and nigiri, doesn't get better than this. Also the prices are super reasonable, we fed 9 people for less than $900 and this included drinks, food, sake etc.  Will go every time I'm in Vegas!

QVPN2HKhfEyZ487a8iaWFQ.text: I am no sushi expert, but both my brother and I agree that this may have been the best sushi roll we have had and not a bad price. The service was great as well, I drink a lot of water and my glass never even got empty.

xKgnnEpRdfSF70su3Ec5Zw.text: Best sushi we have had in a long time! Highly recommend this place Great Sushi excellent service. Very cozy and welcoming atmosphere, love the area under the little lights your facing the bar basically. It's a small place but it's delicious sushi definitely   recommend the Nevada roll and the avocado one so tasty!!

_7hLZ5ivIikZgTIRRCy0XA.text: This place is awesome! I've been here a few times already and haven't been disappointed.. They have a variety of sushi rolls for everyone and it's worth every penny.. Taking another trip here with my girls the next time in Vegas!

8yLbBCDaEhH26kNInfOD4g.text: Oh yeah my favorite sushi spot away, yet not far from the strip. They have great service, delicious sushi rolls, and nice decor. The sushi is inexpensive to average. It's located right across the street from the hard rock, so it won't take you more than 15 mins to get here if you're staying on the strip. If you are craving good sushi and don't feel like waiting hours in order to get it, just drive or take a can here. It will be worth it!

q9kkUlorLwXR1VT7G513Zw.text: Seriously underwhelmed. I came here after seeing numerous good reviews for this place. Wow, all I can say is wow this place was terrible. For starters I think it's in bad taste when they add mandatory gratuity for service. I feel a tip should be based on the service provided, which was decent but not out of this world. The iced green tea tasted like fish water. Waitress tried to tell me they add some special leaves or whatever but fish is fish is fish and that tea tasted like fish!!! The short ribs were greasy and burnt. The other rolls were decent but nothing I would come back for. Matter of fact we were left so unsatisfied we're on our way to get tacos now after leaving this place!

otZz-jqcShp5sqlW2mgs4A.text: Good select of sushi rolls, and they came out pretty quick. Service is good. Restaurant ambiance is higher end, reflecting traditional Japanese with a modern flare.

5LZ5enrSm97WWlMGd2lrjw.text: I love this place! I come every time I am in Vegas. I have brought lots of friends there and now they do the same. The sushi is great and the prices are fair. The garlic edamame is to die for. I can't get enough!!!

wiUtXK38x6J5CV-cNm_Ytw.text: Great little gem open late! I preferred the sushi here than at the upscale expensive Nobu. Fish tastes Fresh and they have an amazing variety.
